description:
My oldest daughter and I are in San Francisco visiting my youngest daughter and wanted to grab a light snack so we found Java Beach on Yelp.  Good ratings so we checked it out!  I got the cinnamon roll shaped like a huge piece of square French toast.  I asked the server what were the ingredients and she said, "a whole lot of butter and sugar."  I said, "I'll take it!"  I had it warmed too.  It was definitely buttery, sugary, lots of cinnamon, and DELISH!!! I ate half because it was really rich and too much for one person.  We sat outside and it was very nice but the angle of the sun zeroed in on my big forehead...lol so we had to move.  Very cute, down-home, beach-side cafe.  The staff was friendly and accommodating - if anyone is in the area definitely stop by as they had a lot of breakfast and lunch menu selections!
Happy Yelping
#SYOY
author: Sheryl T.

description:
We popped in for late morning coffee and bagels, and had a pleasant experience.  Good food, friendly  service (you order and pick up at the counter), and nice outdoor seating.

Our Americanos were decent, and I enjoyed my bagel sandwich with pesto cream cheese, lettuce, and tomato.  My husband thought his hummus veggie bagel sandwich was okay.

We ordered at the counter, and found the staff friendly.  We had to pick up our food and drinks at the counter, and everything was ready quickly.

We came on a sunny Sunday morning, and enjoyed sitting at one of the outside tables.  It was quite pleasant.

Overall, this was a lovely spot for a casual meal.
author: Barnali D.

description:
Just came into town to visit my sister and was looking for a cute cafe to grab a little morning snack. The ambiance is everything you would imagine a beach side cafe having. The staff are warm and friendly and the pastry options are endless. 

The seating is great, you have the option to pick a table outside or inside at a booth. 

I got the lemon poppyseed muffin and it was huge, moist and delicious. My mom got the cinnamon roll which was almost the size of her head. All I can say is that it was butter and maple heaven.
author: Shéyron C.

description: For too long I wasn't visiting Java Beach, we always park close by when visiting the zoo and would walk straight past. But, finally we gave it a go and now it's a staple latte and soda bread spot. The coffee always impresses me and I can't stop eating that yummy bread.
author: Tristan L.

description:
Situated next to the San Francisco zoo, Java Beach was a splendid casual place to visit during lunch. Not very busy when we visited and ordering was easy. Their menu featured several sandwiches and bagels, so I decided to order the Kerry Gold because I had missed eating a classic grilled cheese. We sat outside and the servers brought the food to us. The Kerry Gold was an unexpected open face grilled cheese! The cheese was melted on top of two thick bread slices. Even though I expected buttered up bread and cheese in between thin slices of bread, I still thought the Kerry Gold was good in its own way. The coleslaw that came with the sandwich was tasty.

One of our tables outside was a little wobbly, but not that big of a deal. There was plenty of seating inside too, but we wanted to feel the ocean air outside. Such a cute environment! I think I would try a bagel if I visit again!
author: Katrine U.

description:
Oh where do I start. I love this tiny little space for so many reasons. They have good coffee, bagels, salads and pastries. They're really quick with your orders as well. It's my go-to place for a quick breakfast run. 

The best thing they have here is probably their Irish soda bread. It's amazing, especially when they're just cooled after being out from the oven. Fav bagel is the lox bagel!
author: Elle T.

description:
Java Beach is a cute little rustic cafe a few blocks away from the beach and SF Zoo. If you're looking to enjoy a nice cup of joe and/or a lunch, then this will do nicely. It's a little small so it can get cramped, particularly on weekends. 

Aside from coffee, Java Beach also offers decent sandwiches and salads. Maybe grab a bagel or pastry instead. If none of that fancies you, you could get soft serve ice cream or draft beer. Yeah, surprise, this coffee shop also serves beer too! So while nothing here is going to blow your mind in terms of flavor, it's consistent and good enough to get you through the day. 

Prices are a little on the higher end but what's new? Parking is limited to street parking but what else is new?
author: Derek T.

description: A great little place we went on a whim. They had great breakfast choices ie many bagel sandwiches. My bf had their lox cream cheese bagel and it was really tasty. I had their hummus veggie bagel and it was so good and a big portion. If I am around this area in the city I would drop by again and try their baked goods. They had a great variety of coffee as well. I felt service was efficient even while having a crowd.
author: Daniela B.

description:
My family loves coming here for sandwiches and soft serve. Especially on a hot day, lots of people come here for the soft serve. Pricing here are pretty reasonable! My favor here is the hot veggie sandwich. Comes with avocado and veggies on toasted baguette. Tsunami sandwich is also very popular here! 
If you have a dog, they've outdoor seating. Also provide water outside for your pet.
author: Jaylene L.

description: Omg! Try the cinnamon toast! It's soooo good. Also the Kelly Gold open faced grilled cheese blew my mind and my boyfriends! He actually went home the next day and tried to recreate it and it just made me salivate! The hot tsunami sandwich is good, but the bread is too tough so next tine I'll change the bread choice so I can better eat it! I often eat here after a weekend run and am never disappointed. It is not a cheap cafe but the atmosphere and food are worth every penny!
author: Julianne O.

description:
It's a really solid coffee shop and sandwich place. 

The coffee itself isn't something to go raging about, but it's very consistent and high quality. 

Their food is quite good.  I'm a particularly big fan of their pesto cream cheese. All of the sandwiches I've gotten or my friends have gotten have been good and all of them are very large. My favorite is the Mozzarella, Pesto & Tomato Melt. All of it quite filling. 

They also have oft serve - which looks like an awesome treat after a hot day at the bea
And they have beer on tap! So you can also go for happy hour. Or enjoy a beer in the sun - they have 6ish tables outside on the sidewalk. 

The space isn't huge inside, but it seems to work - there are often a number of people there working on their laptops. Free WiFi. 

Friendly warm neighborhood feel - I'm lucky to have it two blocks from my house.
author: Sarah C.

description: Good cup of joe. Friendly service...yummy and hearty bagel options. Plus the location is magnificent on a sunny day. You can sit outside and see the ocean.
author: Laura P.

description:
A bit pricey, but awesome location and food/drink selection! Three stars solely from my experience with a drink (no food order). 

Located right across from the SF Zoo and down the street from Ocean Beach, this cafe is conveniently located to grab a bite or coffee in the area. I don't know about parking during zoo hours, but during the late afternoon on a weekday, it was a breeze to get parking along Sloat. There are small tables outside to enjoy nice weather as well as tables for 2-4 inside as well as high single bar stools. Free wifi also makes this a nice place to work when it's not extremely packed. 

The great thing about this cafe on top of the location is that they have an extensive sandwich and bagel menu. And based on the amount of crumbs on the tables, these are super popular items! While the prices of these items seem more expensive than others (between $6-10), they seem good to try. They also have soft-serve ice cream that is great for the kids that come through with their parents. 

I opted solely for a large (16oz) chai latte. It was warm and comforting on a windy though sunny day. However, it wasn't anything overly special. At $4.75, I thought it was a bit pricey, but worth paying if you plan to work here or head to the beach. 

Maybe I'll try one of their sandwiches next time!
author: Clarissa C.

description:
If you value your money or time, skip this place. 
The 3 girls working there had the whiling to serve just like I had as a teenager forced to do few chores...
The food quality was decent at best and was served sloppy. 
The location is great for zoo visitors, that's why I marked 2 stars and not just one.
author: Michael B.

description: Java Beach Cafe is located near Ocean Beach and right across San Francisco Zoo. They have excellent coffee and fresh sandwiches. A great place to enjoy your weekend breakfast or lunch. If it is a sunny day, sitting outside of the cafe to hang out with friends for a cup of cappuccino is a good choice.
author: Karen L.

description: Okay so the food and coffee was so freaking good, but but but. These people working were so rude I wanted to slap the birch face of the girl who rung me up. I never leave reviews because honestly I don't care that much and I get it because I work in the food industries but like they make the experience awful. Java beach more like java birch
author: Bailey J.

description:
On a sunny day Java Beach's outdoor seating area is bliss. 

On a cold foggy day, Java Beach's indoor wooden seating is also bliss.

Java Beach is a straightforward coffee shop with your standard sandwiches, salads, pastries, and coffee and tea drinks. They also serve Strauss soft serve - so if you're looking to indulge on a warm day - Java Beach's your spot. They have a staff of 2-3 people who take all of the orders and and then also put together all of the orders, so on a busy day - do expect a little bit of a line. That being said - the wait goes by quickly and the staff are on it. 

For hot drinks, filling bagel sandwiches, and homemade Irish Soda bread with a neighborhood feel  - Java Beach is quite lovely.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
Really cute place, and great location! I honestly can't complain because this place is only a 10 minute walk from my home, so I'm thankful for this quick stop on the corner. 

It's my second time here, and everyone's been extremely kind and patient when I took 5 million years just to figure out what I want. I would give it 5 stars if the pricing would be a bit more reasonable. Maybe it's the Ohioan in me talking, and SF is just such a big fish of inflation, but I honestly couldn't believe I paid close to $7 for a veggie bagel! Don't get me wrong, it was delicious and I barely had to wait, but I'll just stick with coffee from now on...
author: Hannah C.

description: I'm going to average the rating out. I love the food here and I like how I can sit out doors. It's a nice neighborhood restaurant. Honestly the food is easily a four star, but the efficiency of the restaurant.. it's going to be a 1 Star for me. Everyone there is nice, it's just not efficient. Every time I come, I literally wait 30 mins for my order. Sandwiches is what I order. There are literally 6-8 people behind working. I still don't understand why it takes that long to make sandwiches. Everyone moves like a turtle. If you are in a rush, this won't work for you. If your having a leisurely day, this will be perfect. Honestly, if there are that many people working, there are more efficient ways to get things moving. Otherwise, I do like their food and hope that they continue to stay open. I just wish they could move a little faster.
author: Russell T.

description:
Went back today and it's been a couple of months.  Ordered a medium coffee and their Irish soda bread.  Come on people!!  $10????

Won't be back!  Ridiculous that a piece of soda bread, even though it's delicious, and a coffee costs that much!
author: Janet G.

description:
Great cafe to stop by at before heading to the zoo! 

Coffee: my friend got an iced mocha and I got a Mocha(hot is $4.50)! One of the best mochas I've had in the city - not too sweet, just milky enough! 

Bagel: got an everything bagel with cream cheese ($3.75) but they ran out of everything by 12 pm so I got an onion bagel instead. Not an extraordinary bagel but better texture than a lot of bagels I've had in SF! The cream cheese layer is a lot almost as thick as the bagel itself, so remove as needed.

Sandwiches: both my friends ordered the Java Club with turkey, avocado, bacon, lettuce, tomato and mayo and a bit of Dijon mustard ($12.50). Comes with a side of chips or coleslaw! Sandwich was really good (may be slower to come out in person since its busy Saturdays) but worth the wait! Chips are nicely cooked and kettle cooked and crispy, not too salty. Coleslaw was more like a vegetable salad (had cranberries and a balsamic vinegarette), so not traditional! 


Overall good value and nice place/great location near the zoo to go!
author: Kristie M.

description:
What an awesome local gem. It's not snobby.  It's exactly what it should be. Sure, if you come during peak hours on a sunny weekend, it may feel packed, crowded and not worth the wait. But as someone stopping in on a quiet weekday, it's simply perfect. 

The staff is very pleasant and helpful.  The food is good. It's a cafe so it's not amazing but it's really good. The salad are have fresh cut romaine...none of this brown wilted stuff from a bag. It's a little pricey but the portions are HUGE. Big filling salads, big sandwiches, yummy breakfast options. If I lived nearby, I would certainly come in for wine or beer after work. 

Clearly, I'm a fan. Don't change, guys!
author: Serif E.

description: They allow smokers to smoke cigarettes right on the outdoor seating area tables, next to the wide-open window, so the entire cafe is flooded with secondhand smoke.
author: Larf P.

description:
Short review since I took the food to go:

Java Beach is a cute cafe by the beach and SF zoo. You'll see people studying or tourists grabbing a bite to each.

The menu is hugeeeeeee, but don't be intimidated! Select something and you probably can't go wrong.

After ordering, there are cups left out for water. Unfortunately the water is room temperature. 

There is indoor seating as well as small tables outside esp if you have a dog. 

I ordered a half sandwich (Dutch) with a side of coleslaw and the irish soda bread with jam. Sandwich was amazing. I wish I had a full. The Irish soda bread and jam was also something to try. However, I do have to warn you that these two items was super filling! I could have done half a sandwich and half a soda bread instead to be at a spot of comfort.

If you are in the sunset area in SF, great place to check out!
author: Calvin C.

description: The food is really good , but I wouldn't come back here because of the workers. The man with the beard and Hawaiian shirt especially. Seemed like he was upset to be at work. There are many places with food just as good where we don't have to deal with rude employees
author: Carol G.

description: About one degree above mediocre. I've had 3 different sandwiches and all were disappointing. Donuts: on point. Salads: bottled dressing. This place gets a ton of traffic, it's always full and friends swear by it. I've tried enjoying but I just don't.
author: Mario T.

description:
3.5 stars. I've been here about 2 times during breakfast/lunch.
I met up with a friend the last time I was here during a nice sunny day. Parking was easy to find since it was a weekday. 
For food:
toast with butter and cinnamon for my little one which he devoured. I got the kale ceaser salad with chicken. Big portion and I finished it all. Hey we need the greens right? And it was good. 
I just gotta keep reminding myself that when eating out in SF, expect to pay more. 
Good spot in the area.
author: Claire J.

description: Bagel with smoked salmon was delicious. Hubby got turkey Clubb which was a whole porta sandwich for the price. Coffee was on point and the outside seating was a great spot to watch passers by and see the beach waves. The dogs were happy to have breakfast with us as well
author: Karen H.

description: Delicious caramel soy latte. The mocha was also good. Service great! Very fast! And the food looked delicious. We will be back!
author: Stacey C.

description:
The food was yummy, the seating limited, but the staff was downright mean. I understand that it was quite busy, which is probably common on the weekends, but the woman taking orders was clip and practically barking at people at times. I'm so sorry we couldn't hear you perfectly over the din of people talking, but please don't allow our attempt to hear you better further your already existing grumpiness.

Update: Buffy, the owner, reached out right after I wrote the review wanting to rectify the situation. It was really kind of her to do so and nice to learn that they are a family run operation that lives right there in the neighborhood. Thanks for being so prompt and really responding to feedback!
author: Victoria R.

description: Great fresh Irish soda bread and variety of coffees. Good place to be first thing in the morning and hear the ocean down the street.  **** but tip for owners- you NEED to install a fan in your single restroom AND have an air freshener. I mean come on, this can make your experience there go dooooown, hence 3 stars.
author: Tere C.

description: Love this place. Once a week (or more) I will walk down to Java beach and grab a soda bread or pastry and a Bernies Blend drip coffee. It's a highlight of my week.
author: Sarah K.

description:
This cafe is decent. The coffee is good. Bagels are good. But the service is really sloooow and there's really never anywhere to sit. They have 3 or 4 beers on tap and also serve wine. This cafe is better than your local Starbucks for sure. It is a bit pricey... $7.50 for two bagels. I would say their bagels are worth $2.49. 
Overall, I would say that this place it okay.
author: Kevin S.

description: I love this place for a quick bite and a great view of the beach. We ordered the open faced tomato mozzarella pesto sandwich which was simple but tasty and the coleslaw is so fresh! (not pictured) We also tried an iced chai latte and an iced cafe mocha which were AMAZING!
author: Josie W.

description: Ordered the chicken sandwich. The portion was generous but it was salty and had too much mustard. While I was there a vagrant walked in off the street and started hurling threats at the staff which resulted in his arrest. A little scary experience.
author: Angelica R.

description:
This place is really busy on weekends and seats are limited especially outdoor seating. A good number of people seem to camp out on the outside seats after they're done with food. They just sit there and read or have their kids run around.  This place doesn't take reservations either.  So all in all if you have a dog or want to sit outside hang tight. 
Also our food took about 40 minutes to get ready. When the food came out they don't tell you what's what.  They seem to be short staffed so they just drop off stuff and run away.  There are tons of dirty plates sitting around.  To top this off my sandwich was super burnt on the bottom.  Food was not bad.  Tsunami sandwich and bonfire dream were good (other than the burnt part). Coleslaw was spicy but otherwise no flavor. 

Update:  the manager contacted me and the way she explained things I think this may have been a random incident.  I will be willing to try this place at a less busy time.
author: Rou M.

description: If you're feeling a little beachy, this place is for you. Come and eat their ice cream because it's delicious! I love the chocolate and vanilla mix! I also like the bagel with the smoked salmon but everything is a bit pricey. The mocha was not too sweet and goes well with everything else. It's also a good location near to the San Francisco Zoo.
author: Phuong N.

description: Been here many times over the years.  It's the place to go if you are down by the Zoo. Their coffee is good but they really need to freshen up their coffee that sits out more often b/c after sitting it gets that burnt bitter taste. Besides that their pastries are the bomb and this makes up for the occasional bitter coffee.  The soda bread, what can I say, it's f*ckin awesome.  I would just go there for that alone.  Side note: they have bathrooms and they are clean :).
author: Mike S.

description: A cute little café that's clean and has polite staff. The only downside to this place is that it's overpriced. The refills cost the same as the drink, and everything is a few dollars too expensive. Food is good, but it is expensive. There's usually parking nearby, and there is a bathroom to use.
author: Courtney A.

description:
Grabbed two coffees here the other day, Barista gave me a funny look and asked "Really???" when I ordered a caramel white mocha. I guess that's not very San Franciscan of me... I dunno, so honestly that made me feel awkward. That's always a turn off for me, when someone who works somewhere makes you feel bad about what you like. 
That being said, my caramel white mocha wasn't so great, but my boyfriends Hazelnut Latte was DELICIOUS! The food also looked very very tasty, as I waited for the drinks I watched them pump out lots of sandwiches and melts. I'd probably come back and try them some day.
author: Rachel M.

description:
All we got today was a hot tea and hot white mocha. I wasn't able to try the food but the staff here was friendly and nice. 

This cafe is located near the zoo so, I would recommend coming here for something to eat before or after going there. They have baked goods, sandwiches, teas and coffees, frozen yogurt, and you can even get a rootbeer float. The sandwiches look pretty big and can get chips on the side or coleslaw. 

Also, there is seating both inside and outside. The seating in the inside is a little tight and all the tables are bolted/nailed to the floor so you can't slide them over to make more space for yourself (if needed).
author: Ariel B.

description: Nice little coffee house.   Decent coffee.   Easy access from the peninsula or the city.   All the seats were taken by "cafe offices," so that is a bit annoying. But that's the way life is.  At least there's also outdoor seating.
author: Rik C.

description: Absolutely love this cute place to eat in the Sunset. The food is delicious and reasonably priced. Being super close to ocean beach, sitting outside on a sunny day gives great views of the ocean. It's little places like this that make the Sunset district and local food vibe of San Francisco so great.
author: Edward A.

description: I frequent this place several times a week.  The staff are ALWAYS friendly and personable, as well as provide GREAT service even when it super busy. Also, they go above and beyond to make fabulous food, accommodate people's requests that are not on the menu, keep the place clean, and provide that rare customer service you don't see anymore.
author: Cynthia R.

description: Have to write about the BLT I just had. It was the ideal BLT. Plenty of perfectly cooked bacon and fresh cool lettuce and tomato. I'm still swooning.
author: Jenny M.

description:
We decided to try this place since the food at the zoo isn't good. I really hoped this would be a great alternative, but it was very disappointing. We ordered a grilled cheese sandwich, a grilled ham and cheese sandwich, a Diet Coke, and a piece of Irish Soda Bread. $30 with tip. 

I thought both of these sandwiches were safe bets! How do you mess up a grilled cheese??? By not grilling it and serving it open face. The cheese was melted but the bread was not even browned AT ALL. It was warm cheese bread. Both sandwiches were served this way, so not a mistake. And no, the menu did not state that they would be served open face. (BTW, the cheese was good tasting and the bread was fine. If the sandwich had been an actual grilled cheese, it would have been satisfactory.)

The sandwiches were both served with chips. These were the Kettle Chips from Costco. They were very broken, mostly crumbs. I would not usually complain about this but since the sandwich quality was subpar, the broken chips just added to the overall poor impression. 

The Irish soda bread was bland and boring. Apparently it is a family recipe. Time for an update. Seriously. $4.50 for bland. Oh, and I had to remind them to give it to me. It didn't come with the order, so I had to go to the counter and ask for it. 

As an aside, none of the tables were cleared, even though the place was fairly empty when we arrived. About 10 minutes after our food arrived, staff bussed all the tables and wiped them down. 

After we ate, we wondered if we should have eaten the zoo food. That was a sad realization.
author: Karen A.

description:
This is my local spot, and proud of it!!!

Really nice people and great food/coffee. 

Awesome location too!
author: Joe S.

description: I found this Gem just taking a joy ride on Muni. I wanted to get coffee at my usual spot Star-bid-ucks but then thought let's go to Martha Bro. So, I hop a Muni and decide to  "Let it Ride " instead of offboarding at Marthas. Then a little sighting seeing via Muni for the 15minute ride to the end of the N-Judah line. The train dropped me out at the beach's doorstep, and  as soon as I walk off the train I see a few people chillaxing sipping coffee. Bingo lets give this place a try and enjoy the beach scenery. I ordered a coffee with 2shots & a pastry. It was 3.50 for two shots of espresso and  coffee( I think they called it a nitro). The place is nice with many coffee and food options. They loose a star for a dirty bathroom but I assume with all the homeless folks & beach goers in the area that's a tough issue to combat
author: Andre F.

description:
Java Beach is a neighborhood gem and because of its prime location, is also popular for tourists or anyone visiting Ocean Beach or the SF Zoo.  We are lucky enough to live just a few blocks away, so Java Beach is a great place for us to walk to for breakfast, lunch or coffee.  

Stopped by this morning for brunch.  There was constantly a line out the door, but we still found that seating was available inside and outside.  Since it was a beautiful day (without fog), we nabbed a table outside.  It's a casual spot where you help yourself to the utensils and waters.  The line moved quickly at the ordering counter.  Cashier was super duper friendly.  Food was also ready in a matter of minutes.  You pick up the plates yourself and dropped them off when you're finished. 

Enjoyed our meal without any fuss.  Food is simple and satisfying.
-Smoked Salmon Bagel ($7.50): Served with your choice of bagel.  I chose poppy seed today.  Could have been better if more lox was packed in there but god enough for me. 
-San Patricio ($10):  Huge sando filled with chunks of chicken breast, avo, lettuce, jack cheese and onions on cibatta roll.  Served with your choice of kettle chips or cole slaw.  The sando was a huge portion packed with incredibly fresh ingredients. 

Overall, highly recommend this local spot.  They have the basics done well - baked breakfast pastries, granola/yogurt/fruit bowls, bagel sammies, cold and hot sammies and salads.  If you're a coffee person, they got you covered.  Could be a little pricey on the daily but weekend or occasional visits won't break the bank.  It's all about the location!
author: Liv A.

description: Eck! I don't really like this place too much...I gave it a chance though. I liked the Italian Soda but I wasn't crazy of the fact of how crowded it was. And the NOISE oh man was nothing like a good coffee shop should be.
author: Abigail S.

description: Consistently good. I can always rely on a wonderful sandwich regardless of which one I order. Also, love the location for a quick bite so close to the SF Zoo and the short walk to Ocean Beach. Outside seating is great too.
author: Brittany A.

description:
I'm skeptical of sandwich shops because you never know how good the sandwich can be. This shop, surprised me and I would definitely come back! My friends and I ordered San Patricio and Kelly's Cove to share. There is so much filling in both sandwiches, we couldn't even finish half of one! Neither sandwich felt too heavy to eat; it was actually pretty refreshing. Will definitely come back! 

Service is exceptional. Everyone is so friendly and warm. During lunch/brunch hours, there tends to be a ton of people. So finding seats tends to be difficult; especially on a weekend.
author: Teresa C.

description:
Management cares about their customers here :D And they got Yelp love! 
I had an incident with an ice cream cone and at first they responded offering a refund but they're so sweet they sent a gift card. Now I can take my whole family for cones and drinks and stuff! They dealt with the issue immediately just the way Yelpers like it.
I found vanilla cone in the highlights and yes that's a nice waffle cone and they have good ice cream. Thanks for the love!
Update 4 stars
author: Leo M.

description: Went here with my son. Asked for a sandwich with no cheese on it due to allergies. The morons put cheese on the sandwich. I took it back and  the dim  20 something girl took the cheese off the sandwich and handed it back looking smug and proud of herself. I explained that cross contamination makes that sandwich inedible. She rolled her eyes. I asked for my money. She rolled her eyes some more but gave me my money back. This was my first and last time in this establishment and their incompetent staff.
author: Hackey S.

description: Nice and simple local coffee joint. Possibly the best white mocha I've had. Salmon on an onion bagel was pretty smoking too. Excellent service, friendly staff, and just what the neighborhood needs
author: David B.

description:
First off: I'm grading on the SF scale, which is the most challenging scale I've got. This place would be an easy 5 stars in other places without so many stellar choices.

Quiche is rich and 5-star wonderful. The spinach feta croissant is, too, when hot and toasty. Unfortunately sometimes they'll come out of the over still cold in the middle. The salads are also quite good - you may need to ask with special emphasis that they toss the salad even if the menu indicates the salad to be tossed.

Sandwiches are consistently good but not 5-stars amazing. However, the Grilled Apple Cheddar is waaaay better than I would have thought before ordering it. The cole slaw is also a cut above. It's mix of cranberry sweet and peppery spice that I think is much better than the mayonaisy glop many places serve.

The soups are good, with the stand-outs being the tomato bisque (sometimes called tomato garlic) and especially their chicken curry soup, which goes fast.

If they have the pre-made salted caramel cold brew I highly recommend it. Even if they don't, sometimes they can try to make something for you that's somewhat like it. Otherwise I don't think their coffee is consistently better than SF average.

Finally, I don't normally care much for Irish soda bread, but give this a try. The folks behind Java Beach are legit Irish and they also make a variety of variations on the basic bread that make it more moist and flavorful than I've ever had before.
author: Nathan P.

description: I rarely go to Java beach (either location) because the service is mediocre at best. Today I waited about 20 minutes for a BLT. I can see the issue if they were busy but they were not. Unfortunately the girl making the sandwiches was busier talking with her friends sitting at the counter than looking at the orders ahead. As far as I can see the only thing that takes time making my sandwich was heating up the bacon. This procedure could have been taking place while making the sandwich before me. On the upside the food was good and tested fresh. In addition, the girl making the coffee was quick and efficient. Because of her and the food I gave 3 stars.
author: Audra H.

description: Nice basic coffee/sandwich shop not far from the beach.  Nice cup of cream of broccoli soup ($6.50). Sandwiches $10-13. Food is pricey for the setting, but if you don't mind the expense it is a good casual stop.
author: William B.

description: Friendly and attentive staff and nice local business. Great place to get coffee and selections for fresh sandwiches and salads are great. Sandwiches are all made with love and are fresh. Salads are also good with many to choose from. Outdoor seating which provides a great view of the ocean and the surrounding area. SF zoo is across the street, so it can get busy at lunch time. Tried many sandwich places and this is by far one of the better ones.
author: Andrew M.

description: Chloe is amazing!!!!  We go there often for the ice cream. One day we came after the ice cream machine was turned off, but she had saved us two cups in the freezer because she had a feeling that we might show up. That's incredible service!!!
author: Reanna H.

description: Tasty subs, generously sized and fairly priced. Lots of indoor seating and some on the sidewalk. Conveniently located across from the zoo.
author: Dejana B.

description:
Love love this place. It is by the beach and there's plenty of parking!! Double stars just for that cuz parking is ridicilous in SF! 

Now onto the food, i got the San Patricio and its HUGEEEE i was full after eating half and had to give the rest to my friend. I also got Arnorld Palmer and it was more on the sour side but still OK, i'd probably get the ice tea next time. Oh downside is that there aren't many seating areas and it filled up fast since people come here in the laptops and stay for awhile. Unless its sunny outside then they have tables outside too!

 Can't wait to be back and try their salads!
author: Debbie D.

description:
Whatever you do, don't get the Mozzarella, Pesto & Tomato Melt! Almost $13 for two slices of bread, with slabs of flavorless tomato and thin mozzarella (not the fresh mozzarella kind) with overwhelming gobs of what seems to be mostly mayo and a little pesto, making the bread soggy and gushing out from under the tomato whenever a bite was taken. It's all I could taste. It was yikes. I took it home to doctor it up, as to not waste the $13, but to no avail. I felt gross while and after eating it. I don't think I have ever been so disappointed by a tomato mozzarella sandwich in my life...

On a brighter note, the chips were good! I also got a root beer float, and at first they filled the big cup with a tiny two-inches of ice cream, and then gave me a bottle of warm (but good quality) root beer. The root beer instantly melted the ice cream, so I went back to ask for a little more, and received a generous amount.

It was warm and sunny out, and I sat on the patio, which was nice. I was originally planning to go back to try the quiche, but after that sandwich I am slightly afraid to try any other food. If I do go back it would probably be just to sit there in the sun, with maybe a tea or a little ice cream.
author: Megan L.

description:
This is the second time in a row where I ordered a salad and they forgot a key ingredient. The first time they forgot my chicken and I didn't realize until I was already on my way home. The second time they forgot avocado; luckily, I decided to check my take-out box (which was barely full) before I went home. The workers there don't seem happy, nor do they seem to know what ingredients go into their salads. Even their apologies are lazy.

If I'm paying $16 for a salad, there should be better attentiveness into making it. If I'm paying $4 for added chicken, there should more than 3 thin strips of chicken in there. All the employee has to do is grab the right ingredients and mix them up in a box. It's not that hard. It's the bare minimum that is required of your job, so do it properly. 

Seriously, I can't believe I'm writing this. If this isn't one of my biggest pet peeves....
author: zoo k.

description: Not bad. A little pricey since it was stuff I could have made at home. But friendly staff and beachside convenience. I actually didn't like the french roast. But the food wasn't bad. Excellent parking.
author: Liz H.

description:
OMG - thank God for Yelp! Again!

Cute restaurant, nice staff, delicious food. We had the kale Caesar and the pesto mozzarella melt - totally recommended.
author: Gary G.

description:
I came here one morning to get a latte before going to the zoo and I can't wait to return! There was plenty of free parking in the area and there was also free wifi so it's a great place to get work done. 

The latte came with up to three complimentary shots and the latte art was beautiful! Service was friendly and the breakfast items that other people were ordering looked tasty. I think this may be my new favorite coffee shop in San Francisco.
author: Karen L.

description:
I'm not normally one to complain, but this is the third time this has happened to me here and I just have to say something. I always order the same thing: an iced latte with almond milk. And I'm always very clear about it being iced because I used to work in the coffee industry for 6 years, so I totally understand the frustration of having to remake someone's drink, especially when you are super busy.  So I always double check my order on their screen to verify that I said my order correctly, and that they heard it correctly. And every time it has been correct.
I'm not sure what quite happens with the communication after the transaction is complete and the order goes to the barista, but this is the third time they've made my drink hot instead of iced. 
I get that this is really not a big problem in the grand scheme of things (hence 3 stars instead of 1), but it isn't necessarily the mess up that bothers me, it's the way the barista handles it.  And it's literally the same barista that messes is it up every time. 
The first time it happened to me, I just took the hot beverage because I really dislike frustrating people.
The second time it happened, I spoke up and it felt like I completely annoyed the barista.
Today, the third time it happened, I enjoyed some passive aggressive attitude, as though it was my fault she had to remake my beverage.
I get it. It's frustrating to have to remake a drink because it takes time and you have a bunch of other orders to fill.  But you should never make the customer feel like they did something wrong, when they didn't. If you're having to remake multiple orders, its most likely because you're rushing and not paying attention to the details.  And frankly, my drink order is pretty simple.
author: Samantha A.

description: Bree, the barista, is amazing! She makes the best mochas! I wish she could train everyone to her standards!Wow! For now, this is my exclusive coffee place over other places I love! (Trouble,Andytown for great coffee) (Peets, Starbucks for loyalty program).
author: Halina Y.

description: I've since gone back and the previous negative aspects I had mentioned have since been resolved. Glad to have another quality sandwich spot back in my life.
author: Buster G.

description: Pesto bagel veggie sandwich was delicious! Their everything bagels are the best I've had. Highly recommend. The Bbq chicken sandwich was really good too.
author: Espie M.

description: I WISH their coffee wasn't so good.  Their Bernie's Blend keeps me coming back - even though whenever I go in and order my favorite open-faced smoked salmon bagel with double smoked salmon, a meal which brings me great joy, it inexplicably comes out from behind the line here differently almost every time:  sometimes open faced & other times squashed together like a sandwich; other times with all the double salmon on one side and all of the tomatoes, capers & onions segregated on the other side (either of which presentations needs to be laboriously dis-assembled and then re-assembled with equal, edible, common-sense portions of ingredients on each side; sometimes with double salmon (as paid for) and other times not; sometimes with regular cream cheese, capers & onions, as the menu promises, and other times with shockingly incompatible sundried tomato cream cheese, which then needs to be scraped off for a total do-over.  Sometimes I get so discouraged with the inconsistent service that I ask for a simple toasted bagel with cream cheese and for all the remaining ingredients to be put on the side so I can just assemble it myself, but that request is usually met with a scoffing attitude from the unconsciously-incompetent millennial behind the tip jar.  I wish their coffee wasn't so good.
author: Mark P.

description: Great Sandwiches and salads. Coffee is superb. The coleslaw is very different than traditional, very good.
author: Z ..

description: Awesome vibe, the blackberry Irish soda bread, browned warm with jam... mmmmm. I'll come back just for that! Turkey club delicious and the coffee! Great local gem.
author: Spunky M.

description: Great place to grab a coffee and work on the computer, or a pitcher of beer and enjoy an afternoon with friends. The food and coffee are always spot on. There is usually parking near on the surrounding streets. It vicinity to Ocean Beach and the San Francisco Zoo makes it convenient. I will continue to visit Java Beach!
author: John G.

description:
To be avoided. Too many decent cafes with good coffee and wi-fi in the city. 
Wi-fi coverage is spotty, tables not bussed and cashier, while friendly, can't even get a simple order straight. Stop coming to work stoned!
author: CJ M.

description: The only advantage of this place is that it is across from the entrance to the zoo. The coffee was pretty good but the sandwiches were overpriced. Also, there was a significant delay between the time we placed our order and when we got served.
author: Ricardo G.

description:
GET THE BLT.  not the pesto and tomato.  
fun staff.  Honest and down to earth and friendly.
author: Shannon S.

description:
Great little cafe! One of my favorite spots to stop in for a breakfast sandwich (that's not microwaved). Cold brew coffee on point. Low key love the fruit bowl. Staff are friendly, always have a smile on. Location kind of puts it off the grid for a lot of people I do think.

Nice espresso machine.

Java beach is doing it right I would recommend this place to others.
author: Nathan B.

description:
Went here with a date after going to the SF Zoo and not wanting to pay their outrageous prices (Mac and Cheese for 7 bucks?! No thanks...) for food.
It was a startling walk over to the restaurant after being out all day without food, and being greeted with every mother with tons of children (lots of field trips at the zoo that day) all eating ice cream outside. I was worried that there would be a line of people still waiting before just looking inside and realizing is the a ghost town at the counter. I just took a chance and booked it inside.

I was just drooling at the menu as me and my date ordered sandwiches. I got myself the Tsunami sandwich with the coleslaw on the side (which is a pop of WOW! MY FACE HURTS FROM THE BURN) and water. We sat inside, which is really tiny compared to what I assumed to would be, enjoyed our lunch date and sat in there talking and eating close to two hours.

The Tsunami is a total win for me, as it really is complimented by that coleslaw, brings up a weird nostalgic feeling of eating asian chicken salads with cabbage and the heated flare from the vinaigrette and cracked black pepper just make my tastebuds sweeten up inside my mouth.

I'm afraid to say it but this place has amazing food (for my experience) and I hope to come back when my wallet is loaded on dough to try out the rest of their menu :D
author: A. R. G.

description: As much as I wanted like this place, I had very bad personal experience at this place that I will never want to remember. It was a Sunday morning, we wanted to take our daughter to the zoo. I yelped the breakfast places and found Java. Great location - close to the zoo, good reviews, etc. We got there, ordered some breakfast, waited to find a table since it was crowded. We waited at least 30 minutes for the breakfast and when we went to the cashier to check the status of our order, they told us that they could not find the order. Just when we were discussing, one of the hot coffee containers spilled all over my daughter. Her legs and feet were burnt! Luckily coffee was not that hot and it wasn't a serious burn. It was such a horrible experience for me personally that I will never go back to this place.
author: Merve A.

description:
Super cute space right across from the zoo and next to the Days Inn. We stopped in here for breakfast after finding the Days Inn selection was sorely lacking and were very happy to find a fun and knowledgeable staff with delicious food and coffee. 
We each had a coffee, one of us had the fruit with granola and I had the quinoa oatmeal with nuts and bananas. Both were delicious! Would totally recommend.
author: Kay W.

description:
Friendly workers, decent coffee and overall a nice environment. They also offer Wifi which is always a plus.

Came here around 8am on a sunday and there was a line, while it did move fast, the location was packed with people and the every seat was filled so had to do a take out. Not so bad considering it's right next to Ocean Beach and SF Zoo. 

I got Tsunami hot sub (Or Tsumani as it is written on the POS system during checkout, kind of funny typo. The sub was pretty good, tasty as well. The coleslaw that opt to get instead of chips was decent, it wasn't spectacular. Also had white mocha with whipped cream to go with my morning and that was good. For both white mocha and Tsunami sub, it cost $15, kind of pricey honestly.

Overall not a bad place, I would come back but not something I would always frequent mainly due to the prices but again it's a nice establishment.
author: Joel L.

description:
I've lived in this neighborhood my whole life, and used to love coming here. However, service has gotten slower and slower, and while there used to be a ton of friendly employees that's really changed--no one seems to be excited to be there anymore. As someone who works in the service industry, I know how tough work can be but that's really important.

Also, the seating situation is rough, and space isn't being utilized well at all. I came in recently and there was one person at each table--barely anyone had any orders, they were all on their computers. Basically, this place used to be one of my favorites and now with the prices hikes and less-than-welcoming atmosphere, I won't be coming in anymore. It's a shame.
author: Em P.

description:
One of the best local spots that keeps me coming back. Love the awesome staff, very friendly, patient, and always happy to accommodate any special requests within reason. Weekends are ridiculously busy here due to location right across the street from the zoo and down the block from Ocean Beach. I like to sit outside and soak up some sun and fresh air when space is available, otherwise am cool with being inside and do some reading/studying on my kindle.
Cool spot, definitely worth checking it out if ya haven't already :)
author: NoR415 T.

description: Perfect place to go on a sunny California day  the coffee is good from what I've tried and the food is to die for. The BBQ chicken hot sub is my recommendation.  The only bad side to this place is that the seating is crazy. Too little tables and too many people just sitting there using up the free wifi while everyone else is waiting for a place to sit down and eat. Otherwise this is one of my favorite places in the city regardless
author: Haley B.

description: I frequent this place for their chai latte's after long days on the beach and I have yet to be disappointed.  I came in for a chai today and realized I wouldn't mind having a sandwich with that.  I looked at the prices and my eyes got big but not really wanting to stop at a second place to grab food I reluctantly ordered a 10$ BLT with the thought in my mind that this better be damn good and you bet it was.  It was simple yet fresh and made the way a BLT should be made.  The staff is also very friendly and I think it's a plus that they promote reusable items, if you plan to eat in there are dish washable cups for water and ceramic cups for hot drinks so there is less single use material going to waste or ending up on the beach.  I'll continue to go back and I recommend this place to others as well.  The disclaimer I have to offer is that most of my yelp reviews are negative but I don't have anything bad to say about these guys.
author: B B.

description:
This is where we head for breakfast on a Saturday or Sunday morning together.  We also love to bring friends from out of town because the location can't be beat.  It's just a short walk from Ocean Beach, so on sunny mornings it's so wonderful to eat outside and then amble on down the street to admire the ocean.

What's great:

* Love those women that work there.  I'm a big fan of cute girls with positive attitudes, and it seems that's all they hire.  Can't remember the last time I saw any guys working there so if I've missed them, my apologies.  Not that I don't love guys too, but hey, estrogen just squirms its way into my heart a little easier on a slow weekend morning.

* Expect deliciousness.  I've never ordered anything there that wasn't delish.  I noticed that some previous yelpers have had problems with their orders being messed up but I've been there at least twenty times and that has never happened to me.

* Coffee bar, baby!  They always have at LEAST four big towers of different coffees, and no matter what your way of preparing your coffee they'll have the condiment of your choice for FREE.  None of this "extra 50 cents for soymilk."  Nope.  They've got stevia, splenda, the blue, the pink, the white, the brown sugar, the agave nectar.  Skim, 2%, whole, cream, soy, almond, you name it.  Pour it on in.

* Outdoor seating.  On a beautiful day it's so splendid to look down the street and see the ocean and soak in the warm sun.  Sure, during peak times you might get stuck with a table around the corner in the shade, but it's still nice.  

*Location location!  Within walking distance to the zoo and right down from the beach.  I've never been to the other location and I don't plan on it.  This one suits me just fine.  We drive all the way from San Bruno for this place about once a month.

* Wide variety of selections.  Whatever you're in the mood for and whether you're vegan, raw foodist, paleo or diabetic sugar+meat-lover they've got an option for you.

* Kid friendly.  Kids love this place and people love to bring them since it's right next to the zoo.  This is one of the few places I'm exposed to the lil' tykes, and it's always funny to listen to little kid conversations, so that's part of the entertainment I guess.

* Great place to work.  They have wi-fi and it's cozy inside, so bring a laptop and pull up a chair.

* USUALLY great parking, for San Francisco.  Unless there's some kind of event going on at the zoo, and then forget about it.

* Dog friendly.  Bring fido, because you can always eat outdoors with him/her.


What's less than great, but hey:

* Slow service.  It just is.  I've never NOT had to wait in line, and once out of five times there's no seat because it's packed.  But all good things in life require a little patience, right?

* Hella crowded at peak times.  And people can get cranky about you coming in and out of the door to get more water or bus your table.  Probably because they've been waiting in line for ten minutes and they keep getting bumped.  Crowded has always been a good sign to me, though, and something worth tolerating.

* Outdoor seating.  Yes, it's good on sunny days, but of course this is also right next to Daly City in That Part of San Francisco, so it's usually foggy.  And that means it's cold.  When the seating is all taken up inside you're forced to huddle and shiver at the outside tables in the grey, wet, pea-soup fog.

* Kid friendly.  So if you're out for a romantic date or trying to work on your laptop, expect the occasional scream or picky eater complaining loudly.  But hey, they look cute so calm down.

* Bus your own table.  Yup, gotta clean up after yourself.  Which means some people don't.  So expect to occasionally have to bus your own AND somebody else's table if you want a seat.

* Less than sanitary at times.  A previous reviewer mentioned a lot of crap on the floors, and that is accurate.  There are always all kinds of scraps of dirt or paper napkin or food all over the place.  This may just be a symptom of people bussing their own table, towing dogs and kids, and running in and out for various reasons; but if you're a stickler for cleanliness, just don't look at the floor.

So for me the good definitely outweighs the bad.  The ambiance is warm and jovial and the decor is very beach-y.  It's a relaxed place for families, bikers at the end or in the middle of their ride, developers/writers/university students, and even tourists.  If you're in the neighborhood, stop on by and give it a try!
author: Elaine B.

description: Great find on the way to Ocean Beach.  Love the setting and ambiance.  Food was pretty good as well.  We had a couple of their sandwiches.  Friendly staff and helpful service.  Conveniently located across the street from the zoo too.
author: Ronny T.

description:
The location is nice, the people are friendly, and it's not usually too crowded when I stop by for coffee or a sandwich. Their drinks are wonderful and I haven't yet ordered anything I didn't like. The only thing is it's a bit on the pricier side in my opinion. It's a great place to stop by if you're ever around the beach or the zoo.

The regulars here are also super friendly and it's a super chill spot to grab a bite and a drink. They're open late-ish for a coffee shop, so sometimes when I don't have proper plans for dinner I'll drop by Java Beach. My favorites include the tsunami, any of their lattes, and toast.
author: Melody S.

description:
Food - 4
Service - 4
Ambiance - 4

I live so close to Java Beach but didn't discover the glory of this place until recently, and now I'm kicking myself for missing out for years!

The first time I came here it was a little after lunchtime, but my friend and I were still craving breakfast foods.  Unfortunately, I guess this place was so popular that they ran out of almost everything including bagels, pastries, and oatmeal.  Luckily, that lead us to discover the amazing arugula salad and fruit and granola bowl.  Their blueberry pie was also delicious and the perfect sweet end to our brunch.

When we came back the next time early enough for breakfast, we tried the oatmeal (which was a little thick for my taste), a pumpkin chocolate chip muffin (a little too thick and chewy), a bagel sandwich (awesome), and the ham and cheese croissant (also delicious).  The beach is only few minute walk away, and on a beautiful sunny day (which I know is rare in this area), it's amazing to be able to have a hearty breakfast, walk along the beach, and then come back and grab a snack back at Java Beach.

I would say their standouts are their sandwiches and salads, and I will definitely be coming back repeatedly to try everything on their menu!
author: Carrie C.

description:
vanilla steamers
whirling dervish
soup of the day
hot mocha
toasted bagels and cream cheese
fresh scones 
wonderful outdoor beach scenery, especially at sunrise:)
author: Dianne A.

description:
Even though I was only here for a brief moment, I really liked the atmosphere here. The staff was very friendly and helpful. It was a nice little cafe that sold coffee, pastries, sandwiches, toast, ice cream, etc.

I was actually just hiding out in the cafe because it was cold out and I was waiting for someone. After a while, I was dying from hunger so I bought a blueberry muffin $2.75. There wasn't a lot of blueberries in it but the top of the muffin tasted good.

All the sandwiches and bagels looked amazing. The place definitely smelled delicious. Will come to this cafe the next time I'm close by!
author: Benita M.

description:
Great sandwiches, good beer selection too. Nice team working friendly and efficient.

Beer is a bit expensive, 16 bucks for a sandwich and beer is a bit much. I'll be back anyway, good place
author: Aaron R.

description:
This review is only based on the Peppermint Mocha and my overall experience. Unfortunately, you're looking at a college student who is scared of birds. I just wanted to find a nice place to study with coffee drinks and lunch and I've heard good things about the sandwiches. But even before I ordered my drink, a pigeon walked in through the front door and flew around the kitchen annoyingly while the workers tried their best to shoo it out. That sure increased my appetite. 

The Peppermint Mocha was not worth the $4 I paid for the smallest size. It barely tasted like peppermint. To top that off, about 6 pigeons walked in while I was trying to study for less than 2hrs, making me pretty uncomfortable with them walking around and having workers and customers try to shoo them out. It wouldn't have happened if the workers just closed the front door but maybe it's normal to keep the door open (who am I to know, this was my first time here). Wi-fi is fast and service is friendly, but who knows if I'll ever give this place a chance for their sandwiches. You def lost me as a drink place and study spot.

Lose the pigeons and I'd try the sandwiches there. But still, the thought of a pigeon feather somehow making its way into the kitchen makes me cringe. 2 stars for fast wi-fi and friendly workers.
author: Amanda L.

description: Incredible bagels. You have try the sun dried tomato bagel or the pesto bagel. So delicious. Cute beachside vibe. A must go for after your family's trip to the zoo or beach!
author: Kelsey F.

description:
First time here today, and wow, I can't believe I've never stopped by before! Located right in front of the zoo, Java Beach Cafe had me at the first bite. 
Java offers more than the typical cafe, because in addition to delicious  sandwiches, salads, subs, and coffee, beer is available on tap, champagne by glass, ice cream by cup or cone.. and there's tons of parking! 
Today I ordered the BLT on sourdough bread with a side salad ($7.50), and it was amazing. My friend ordered a sandwich and she was satisfied with hers as well. All sandwiches come with a side of chips or a salad. Later on, I also ordered an iced vanilla latte, and trust me, it was amazing as well, although a little pricey- $4+ for a small.
Overall, this cafe is spacious, the people are friendly, and there is free wifi, so yay for studying, which is what I did today. I would definitely come back to try other drinks and sandwiches.
author: Corinna T.

description:
Java Beach is a must-visit for me when I'm by Ocean Beach or making a trip to the zoo. It's a cozy and casual spot to grab some breakfast and a much needed cup of coffee. Definitely has a "locals only" type of vibe but still very welcoming.

Their menu mostly consists of quick breakfasts like bagels and pastries but they also have a good selection of salads and sandwiches. Their veggie bagel is awesome! I'm not sure what type of coffee they use but I loved my soy latte on my last visit. 

Service is quick and the ladies working there are really sweet. It can get extremely busy in the mornings and also on weekends - expect lines and limited seating. If you can snag a table, it's a great place to sip on coffee and catch up with a friend. 

*Free wifi!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
The Sunset would not be the same without Java Beach. I simply cannot give them enough praise. Delicious food, friendly staff, comfortable atmosphere, and killer live music on Thursday's. Can't live without their: homemade soups, fruit & granola yogurt bowl, sandwiches and fresh coffee. 
I wish the Sloat location stayed open later!
author: Lindsay M.

description: The food here deserves 5 stars. It's so fresh and delicious; I wish I had the funds to eat here for lunch every day. However, service has been pretty slow every time I've gone. I appreciate attention to detail but I also appreciate getting my food in a timely manner. But I'll keep coming back for the yummy sandwiches and coffee regardless!
author: Ashley K.

description: My hands down favorite coffee drinks in the city. They do soy great and always have the best steamed soy milk in their drinks. Perfect amount of sweetness when you order a sweet drink. The food is killer, and at a good price point. Beer and wine on tap, steps from the beach. Good wifi and charging ports, friendly people, live music sometimes. :) always recommend.
author: Stefanie G.

description:
Java by the beach? 

First things first: This place is shockingly expensive (for someone from Europe)... Sandwiches for ten bucks? Wow... The classic brewed coffee doesn't pack a lot of punch, but okay and a large cup will only set you back three bucks. Apart from that, it could use some cleaning & has nearly no seating due to it's weird layout and tiny tables in the back.
On the Plus side, it's directly across from the Zoo's entrance & the wifi is strong enough to work with. 

But honestly? This really is not the nicest place...I'd guess their main income is the location, otherwise I highly doubt they'd survive!
author: Mike D.

description: The first time I came to visit my friend in his beautiful city, he took me here for sandwiches about a year ago.  It's right next to the beach side and beautiful.  He mentioned that it gets packed, but when we arrived it wasn't too bad, yet.  I ordered a vegetarian sandwich and it came with chips.  The sandwich was immense.  He gobbled his sandwich up.  My sandwich was okay, nothing mesmerizing.  Service was good and we were on our way.
author: Mypang T.

description:
Super friendly and chatty cashier, good coffee, clean bathroom, decent Wifi. 

Good number of tables and chairs, though they're pretty small.

Get ready to make good use of your headphones, I had several people camped out for a few hours, making consecutive phone calls.

Walk down to Ocean Beach before or after and watch some surfers attempting to catch the waves.
author: Matt D.

description: First time here. Back home in Florida good coffee can be hard to find, it's delicious here. The bagel was full of flavor and there was a hearty portion of salmon, tomato, cream cheese and onions. Perfect way to start my trip. I know I'll be back.
author: Samantha a.

description: Great place for coffee and a light breakfast! I've been on a cold brew kick lately and they had a great cold brew as well as espresso and coffee drinks galore. The girls all helping my family and I were very sweet too. It also looks like it could be good for lunch with their sandwiches and salad choices!
author: Vanessa S.

description:
I really LOVE this cafe. Everything on their menu is healthy and made fresh to order. I've been here multiple times. For breakfast, I would recommend the granola bowl or a delicious scone. They have a variety of lattes, my personal fav is the vanilla almond milk latte (it's toooooo good). Their kale caesar salad is great too! I've never had this plate with mushrooms, but it was a nice twist. My friends have had their sandwiches, the club and the bbq. Looked and smelled delicious! 

Definitely give this place a try, you can't go wrong with anything on the menu.
author: Sarin P.

description:
I need to preface my review with the following: I live nearby, work from home, so I come here regularly.  Usually this place is a 5 start establishment. Today was not that. Never had I such a bad experience. 

I called in an order and was told to come in 15 minutes. When I got to the cafe, the guy ringing me up (same guy who took my order on the phone) charged me for three sandwiches when he knew the to go order only had two sandwiches (apparently he "misheard"). After charging me he informed me that it'll be 10-15 minute wait.  I asked why he thought I would want to wait, especially considering that I ordered in advance.  He then called over a crabby looking manager that wasn't friendly looking or nice but refunded me for third sandwich. 

I asked for a bag since I had so many things (ordered a drip coffee and a bagel too), and they basically gave me the smallest bag possible and stood there and watched me struggle to get everything in for a solid 2 minutes. All the while there was a growing line of people. 

I don't know if it's the weekend or holiday staff (I don't think I've ever seen these people before), but they really suck compared to the regular group. Not happy at all with this experience.
author: Tony C.

description:
I live up the street from here and this place is sweet. Parking is rough on the weekends due to the crowds headed to the Zoo and Ocean Beach. But if you're able to visit on a weekday or evening it's glorious. Most importantly, the staff are hella sweet. Have never experienced anything less than stellar service and hospitality. 

Again, this place gets busy. Be prepared. If you don't like small children there are plenty of them. Deal with it or come at night when it's the college hangout/study time. I like that they're open pretty late, though they do run out of popular items early in the day. 

I would love to see management add more egg/breakfast items to their menu besides pastries and bagels. However, their salads are fresh, filling and flavorful. Best not forget to mention they carry Straus soft serve ice cream!! YUH!! And their coffee is good too.
author: Rosalyn W.

description: The food is good. Location is good. But every time I go they are so rude. I'm always saying please and thank you and I can't even get a you're welcome when they take my food to my table. They seem to be only nice to regulars. I'm all about good customer service and I cant even get that. Why work there if you are going to have a shitty attitude. Don't like it there? Don't work there then.
author: Jeanette T.

description:
Fantastic laid back surfer cafe with great sandwiches and pastries.

Java beach is a sunset institution. There are two cafe's in the chain, one by the zoo and the other closer towards the cliff house, just off of Judah. Both near the ends of muni lines and perfect for grabbing a little picnic to eat on, or to relax in after a little stroll along ocean beach.

I love both cafés. They have relaxed atmosphere, are light and airy and ooze personality. 

I have to say I prefer the one just off of Judah, but that's because there are more places to sit outside and it's got the park opposite, so feels more load back than the one by the zoo which is on the main road.

However there is friendly service, great food and consistency across the two locations, so there is little between the two locations and I would visit either.

Perfect for a brunch, or using their free wifi, to sit and check your emails.

I absolutely love the tsunami and bonfire sandwiches, made fresh and rammed full these are huge!

And whoever thought of the beef and ginger sauce combo for the bonfire sandwich is a genius.

Although I would recommend that you go for the mixed salad rather than the chips however with your sandwich order. I find them a little plain and lacklustre - and personally I am a huge fan of rocket (arugula here I the US).

Also check out the pastries, the croissants aren't half bad, I found it so hard finding decent ones in the US, and whilst these don't live up to the ones from France, they are some of the best I found. I really liked the grilled ham ones.

Cookies, muffins and cakes are also good and you get a good sized treat for your dollar.

My only criticism is that I really am not a fan of their coffee. Have a taste yourself, they'll let you sample. The French roast I found to be the best, and they have pretty much EVER type of milk and sweetener that you could think of, but I just never really enjoyed it. They seem a bit raw and burnt to me. Also no free refills!
author: Ray C.

description:
I always have some serious nostalgia when I'm here- it was the place I studied for my SATs in high school, and now years later, I came back to grab a quick coffee and to visit. 

Lots of huge pros. It's right by the beach with a great vibe and an awesome staff. The interior is clean with great wood furniture and a boardwalk-esque feel. There's also plenty of outdoor seating, but away from all of the power strips. Service was fast and friendly, and they have a pretty large selection of pastries, sandwiches, and an extensive bagel menu that I'm looking forward to trying out next time I'm back. 

One small con- it took freaking forever to connect to the Internet. It was a problem shared by a bunch of other patrons as well.
author: Chen-Chen H.

description: Not a fan.   The parking situation is horrible.   Seating area closed for renovations.   Coffee not remarkable compared to other places I've been.
author: Chad S.

description:
After a day spent at the zoo or sitting alongside the beach, Java Beach is one of the few places you can stop by to grab something to drink or have a quick bite to eat. Given this location, the cafe has a pretty laid back vibe, as the staff is pretty easy going and the customers range from young adults working on their laptops to parents bringing their kids after a day at the beach. 

This place has always been solid in my opinion - nothing extraordinary, but nothing terrible either. The coffee has never blown me away, as it seems pretty "eh" in my opinion. The food here is also pretty decent, as they serve pretty good sandwiches and salads. Just beware that this place can get pretty busy because of 1) its location, and 2) its pretty limited seating. Also, for some reason, their tables and chairs always seem to be a little sticky...so if you're the type to be bothered by that, this is just a heads up. 

Overall though, this isn't a bad place to come to if you need a bite to eat or need some coffee. Whether you're stopping by here to get some shade from the sun or to avoid the inevitable fog that's rolling in (most likely the latter), Java Beach is always an option.
author: Aaron W.

description:
It was a rare sunny day in SF so after a hike with my parents by the cliff house, we decided to go for a drink. We came here and it was quite busy, but we're able to order what we wanted fast. My mom got tea, my dad got coffee, and I got a strawberry milkshake with whip cream. It was quite yummy, and we had perfect outdoor seating to soak up the sun.
*Additionally, Java Beach is great if you're lactose intolerant or are looking for gluten-free options. They had low-fat milk, whole milk, almond milk, and rice milk. It's accommodating for all!
author: Shira S.

description: Came here on a sunny afternoon for some brunch because I wanted to take my pup out. I tried the bonfire delight and the tsunami sandwich which were alright, nothing special. I also had a swirl cone which was yummy. Although the food was nothing to die for, what I loved about this place is the vibe. The workers and people were friendly and easy to talk to. I got to chit chat with a bunch of dog lovers while my pup played with his new doggy friends!
author: Michelle H.

description:
A great place for lunch after a trip to the beach or the zoo (across the street). 
- Great coffee.
- Friendly and quick service.
- I had the BBQ chicken sandwich - excellent! 

Downside:
- laptop bums abound taking up seating.
author: Mr E.

description: Great lunch spot next to the zoo. Gets very busy and wait times can get long. Definitely worth it.
author: Mike F.

description: Good place for early AM coffee and basic sandwiches and such. Across from the SF Zoo.
author: Kevin J.

description: I love this little cafe! I came in on a Saturday & it was crazy busy, but I expected that- it's right across the street from the zoo! Despite the tons of customers, the staff was extremely friendly and super accommodating. My latte came out much faster than I expected given the packed house. This place has amazing coffee- it seriously tastes different from any other coffee I've ever had, AND they have nut milk for those who are dairy free. Java Beach knows their coffee!
author: Andrea P.

description:
My boyfriend lives like three blocks away so we always find ourselves comin here for a quick bite. They have the same menu as their location on Judah, except here they have a soft serve machine!!! Their soft serve is amazing and perfect on a nice sunny day, especially in a root beer float! 

My go to is the chefs salad, and my boyfriend always gets the tsunami sandwich.  We've also tried their croissant sandwiches, bagels with lox, and Greek yogurt granola bowls and all were satisfying.  

I love the cool/ relaxed atmosphere of this place. You have to come at the right time or else you are forced to eat outside as the tables are usually hogged by students and their laptops. 

This place is dog friendly! You can eat outside with your dog, and they even have a water bowl for them
author: Linz C.

description:
Amazing!!!

Sundried tomato wheat bagel and an iced mocha....wowww

I go here every chance I get. I've never had anything from here that wasn't completely delicious.
author: Kimberly V.

description: I am totally in love with their bacon and Kerry cheddar Irish bread (like a scone).  I've made sure to be in that area every morning to have one along with the chocolate ganache cold brew.   Friendly staff and always a good vibe.
author: Lisa C.

description:
I have been coming to Java beach for over three years now, and finally decided to write a review! I love the staff here almost as much as I enjoy the coffee, sandos, and brews! 
    I Love sitting outside and taking in the sunshine with my dog and relaxing in my neighborhood. There are mobs of tourists that come through that can sometimes look overwhelming but dont let the line discourage you! They move through the customers really quickly, and they always make their regulars feel like celebrities!  Most customers are great, and friendly to chat however.....  be warned... there is one crazy lady with bright purple hair, lookin like she is forever on a 5 day binge with her two pitbulls in tows that acts like she runs the place. She always brings her dogs inside (they are NOT well behaved) and she is extremely obnoxious to everyone around her, screaming and yelling about what she ate for breakfast last week, or letting her dogs bark their merry hearts out - PUUHHLLEEASE!!!  If you can avoid her, your day will be much better, I promise. i digress... 

    back to the point.. My Java crew always make an effort to remember my drink and ask how I am doing that day, always with a smile on their faces, even when there is a giant line of clueless zoo touristas out the door. The managers Chelsea and Kaley are always quick to help, and are always keeping things upbeat and lively with the staff. It looks like all the staff members really get along and enjoy working with each other, even when it can get hectic and there are tons of sandwiches and lattes in the works. Evan is the sandwich king and makes the best dutch crunch sando with the works, Lucy is my latte lady love (and is super cute to boot!!), and Max is amazing too, gotta love that beard! 

All in all.... GO THERE! sit on the patio, take in the sunshine, the beach air, and amazing food and drinks! Keep up the great work!! -(HEART)  Mom
author: Chelsea J.

description:
I love for a good latte. During October and November, I have a lot of very early mornings I my job. I can't really stomach coffee first thing in the morning, but Ivan do a latte. I love latte's. Java Beach makes a fantastic latte. If you go to Starbucks and order a grande latte, put soy milk in it, and want an extra shot, and a flavored syrup it's going to cost you like $6.50. A large latte at Java Beach is 4.25. It doesn't cost you any extra to have up to four shots of espresso, and only .65 to use almond milk. They also had free hazelnut syrup on their counter. You can make your latte a hazelnut latte for no additional cost. They also had agave nectar, which most coffee shops do not have. 

Beyond the drink itself everything else in this place was also great. I love the look of the place. It's very spacious with lots of seating. The staff were very friendly, and seem like they really enjoy working there. They also have some good looking food. I didn't have anything to eat, but I will next time!
author: William O.

description:
Great cofffee and great food! Wonderful service.
Near the zoo and ocean Beach.  Sallads, sandwiches etc great variety.
author: Shirley M.

description:
I Love Java Beach! I go to this location more often because it is a little closer to where I live than the one on La Playa/Judah.

I've tried the Tsunami, Bonfire Delight, Granola Bowl, Caramel Latte, and the Mocha. My faves are the Tsunami Sandwich and the Caramel Latte. There is something about the sandwich that keeps me coming back to it, maybe its the crunchiness of the dutch crunch or the savory blend of ham/mortadella/salami, I don't know what it is but it works every time. And as for the latte, I'm not a huge coffee connoisseur but I think the coffee here is very addicting... I just back from school for summer vacation a week ago and I've been to Java Beach for their coffee 4 times already! 

I love that the cafe is so close to the beach (The one on La Playa/Judah is even closer!)  This place may be a little pricey in comparison to other cafes, but I think the quality of the food/drink is worth it. If you're looking for a quick bite/coffee break/cool place to chill, hit up Java Beach.
author: Elaine N.

description: Java beach is such a cute little corner cafe. :) I yelped this place since I'm new to the area and found this little gem! Parked on the street and took a little walk into the cafe and was actually impressed by the menu. They have anything from hot/cold sandwiches, pour overs, your regular joe, espresso, some healthy choices like fruit granola and Greek yogurt, quiche, and much much more! And to the right of the menu, by the way guys.... they also have a mini bar! Beer on tap, and some wine too! I think I'm in love....
author: Rachel V.

description:
A great place to grab delicious subs on the way to the zoo!

They have all kinds of different bread choices which is always great and they make a pretty mean sandwich that fills you up for the rest of the day.

Grab a sandwich to go and take it down to the beach and enjoy a mini picnic before heading to the zoo or wherever your San Fran adventure takes you! 

They make a really good Arnold Palmer as well, get the Jumbo size because you can and it's totally worth it. 

Pretty reasonable prices and again the food is great! 

The turkey club, the bbq chicken are my favorite so far!
author: Narek M.

description: Complete hole in the wall surprise! On our way to the SF zoo we stopped in for a quick bite. We were going to grab a simple egg plate but unfortunately they only offered, pastries, bagels, and oatmeal for breakfast. Knowing we wanted something more substantial, we opted for a couple of their hot sandwiches. My husband ordered the BLT and I ordered the open face pesto tomato sandwich. My sandwich was so flavorful that after trying one bite, my husband took the remaining piece of the sandwich for himself.
