While driving out here regularly is not realistic for us, I would definitely get this sandwich again if we are in the neighborhood and indefinitely recommend it!
author: Alison R.

description:
We just wanted a quick bite before we went into the zoo (which they are across the street from). The girl at the counter was super friendly and patient with me. When I said I didn't know what the soup of the day was, she offered up a sample. Ahhhh, yummy soup. I unfortunately forgot what it was called. We also ordered a BLT. Both were really good. 

There is some seating, but the place is really small. Perks? They have a bathroom. There is outdoor seating as well with a view of the ocean. 

Fun little place with soups, sandwiches, salads, and ice cream. Can't beat that.
author: Corina V.

description: Delighted with my hot chocolate and cinnamon toast- not just any cinnamon toast but a Pullman Bread cinnamon toast- a thick slice of fresh toasted bread topped with brown sugar, butter and cinnamon - so simple but so delicious- the hot cocoa is so perfect on a brisk day. My kids loved the grilled cheese sandwich - 4 thick slices of bread topped with Ooey gooey cheese- so delicious- you know it's good when you talk about the food days after! A visit to ocean beach requires a stop at Java Beach cafe! Sit and smell the ocean breeze.
author: Michelle B.

description:
Irish-approved
great attitude
quite decent food
then go get zoo'ed 

oh and so easy to park 
a Subaru (or two)
author: Lloyd M.

description: The salmon bagel is fantastic. The place is clean with friendly staff. Parking can be tough.
author: Eskil A.

description:
I've been living in LA for the past 8 years...but when did the Sunset become a go-to place for coffee loving junkies?! There's a slew of these popular coffee bakeries popping up along the shore, and I have to admit that I love this aspect of the gentrification process.

The people here are wonderful - they always seem to have a big smile on their faces. The lines will pile up, which is the only downside if all you want is a coffee, but it is totally understandable.

$2.50 for a 12oz coffee, and you get to choose which type of coffee you want. Take a sip of the Colombian...take a sip of the Hazulnut...let's try another one...OK settled on Hazelnut!

Free WIFI. Parking is ample around the residential area.

I can only selfishly wish that this place will not grow super popular due to the Yelp effect, but I do wish that they continue to receive ample business as it will further elevate Sunset's reputation as a new hipster hot spot for coffee loving, beach bumming, pastry hugging junkies.
author: David W.

description:
It was really hot this past weekend. I decided that it would be great to go to the cafe near my home and order a refreshing drink and affogato.

Not only did the bar worker forgot my drink, but she had a nasty attitude about it, and gave me a dirty look...like something was stuck up her bum.

On top of that, the affogato they made looked terrible. Wasted money on extremely horrible service. 

I do not recommend this place to anyone. 

If you want a good experience, avoid this cafe at all cost.
author: S. M.

description: I came here because the pictures of the lattes were sooooo pretty on yelp but mine was just OK.... Coffee wasn't the best but 16 oz for 4.50 isn't bad at all :)
author: Hannah C.

description: My hazelnut mocha was divine. Just enough chocolate flavor and hazelnut flavor without being too sweet. I tried their Club Sandwich with cole slaw, which were so-so. This is a good place to go for a casual bite or cuppa joe on a sunny day, as they have outdoor seating.
author: Cameron N.

description: My favorite spot in the Sunset.  Fits the surfer, student, family vibe of the avenues perfectly.  Every single person that works there makes you feel like you're special.  (A smile, small talk, remembering your name, or just plain working their tails off to get your food/drink out quickly.)  Great coffee in the morning and beers on tap for the lazy afternoons.  Nice days get busy but what do you expect being right near the beach?  Bottom line: Java Beach is probably THE place to go in the Outer Sunset if you want coffee or sandwiches or beers and to enjoy the laid back beachy surroundings.
author: Jay J.

description: Nice place to visit when going to the beach! Amazing Root Beer Floats, and the food looks so yum. They always have smiles on their face. Great Environment ~
author: Diego M.

description:
OMG I'm stuffed. I just tried one of the Hot Subs for the first time and I'm satisfied. (BBQ Chicken ) 

There was bit of a wait but that's understandable. When you make great food with fresh ingredients, you will have a fan base. 

I started going here a month ago and have been digging the Muddy Water ever since. There is a great all around vibe and its caffeinating. I will suggest Java Beach to a friend and to fellow coffee enthusiasts. Like how they roast all their own coffee beans.
author: Brandon F.

description: This place is nice to come on a sunny day. It's close to our house so it's very convenient for us when I craving for a sandwich or coffee. I have tried their tsunami...which is really good and fulfilling. Their almond croissant is really good when they warm it up. It's close to the beach so you can walk there afterward.
author: Phi N.

description:
What a nice place to grab an excellent sandwich made to order.  Sandwiches come in three available sizes, small, medium, and large.

As my friend and I both wanted the same sandwich, it was suggested we order the large size and just split it.  We ordered at the counter, gave our name, and grabbed a table.  Our sandwiches came in a plastic basket with some ruffled potato chips.

We got roast beef with melted cheddar on a Dutch crunch roll.  Lettuce, tomatoes, and jalapeño peppers.  Highly recommended.  We also got drip coffees.  We were informed that fresh pots are made on the hour.  You're given a coffee cup and you pump your choice of coffee.  It was hot.

They've got free Wi-fi so there were folks there with laptops.

Conveniently located across the street from the zoo, hence the name.
author: Shirley N.

description:
Ocean Beach may not have lots of dining spots, but Java Beach's options are so delicious, it might make up for the lack.

It has a nice welcoming vibe, great food in generous portions, free wifi and really flipping delicious beverages, homemade doughnuts and pastries and desserts.

My son and I split the hot veggie sub (so good!) and an arugula salad, plus he had a muffin and I had a latte. I couldn't take a picture because we devoured our lunch too quickly. So there's that: food so good you want to eat it instead of photograph it.
author: Merredith B.

description:
First timer in the local cafe, got the Kelly Cove's sandwiches and hot mocha.
The food is good and freshly made, thumbs up. 

But the environment could be improved, since I think the sitting area and table is not very clean so is the only downside I would have to say.
author: Priscilla F.

description: A nice little cafe by the zoo, and I'm so impressed that they were opened on Thanksgiving day. The tsunami sandwich was really yummy with warm melted cheese. my grilled chicken sandwich was ok and not too special. The cheesy broccoli soup was just as expected, but the $5.75 price tag was a little shocking for a small cup of soup. Overall an ok cafe for quick eats.
author: Lily T.

description:
Great for coffee and even pretty good for tea selection. Fresh fruits, hot cereal, pastries, only greek yogurt, bagels, sandwiches, home made pies, vegian foods, ice cream and lots more.

I had breakfast here for four mornings in a row and loved it. 

Great staff of girls with fast friendly service.
author: Doug H.

description: Go for the coffee, stay for the free WiFi, but don't bother with the food. Service is slow and they charge for water.
author: Joe O.

description: Excellent find! We were tired from traveling and this was our first food stop in San Francisco. Sandwiches were large and ingredients fresh. Very limited seating outside and a number of locals had set up residence with thee laptops --seating for less than 20 inside. Staff was kind and personable.
author: Lauren H.

description:
It does the job. Sandwiches are good, not great. Can be a touch slow, but the staff here are AWESOME!

This location is better than the one further north. More families, less dickheads on laptops.
author: Chris H.

description:
This cafe is close to our place, so we decided to walk over on a Saturday morning for breakfast. The picture of the pesto mozzarella tomato sandwich that someone else posted made me drool, so I ordered it. Holy cow...no wonder it's $10. I couldn't even finish it! I also got a 16 oz. decaf soy caramel latte (it felt so fancy ordering it like that!), which was really yummy in my tummy!

My fiance got the BLT and the muddy something coffee. The place was packed with a line out the door. We were going to get our order to go and enjoy it at the beach a couple of blocks down, but two seats at the counter opened up so we ate there. It was a tad bit pricey but definitely a place we wouldn't mind coming back to for breakfast on a Saturday morning. The cashiers were really sweet also.
author: V M.

description:
Really good, but really expensive... I often go there when I have to work when I'm home. I just go chill there with a sando and an Ice Tea. Wait line can be really long, and it can be really hard to sit during lunch hours. 

But hey, it's SF, wait line is mandatory in this city...

This being said, it's definitely worth a try. Must have: Pesto, Mozzarella and Tomato melt.

Cheers
author: Antonin M.

description:
Update: the cafe closes at 9pm now (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/iRmdKzcbdFLIp3s9e4xrHA?select=JmgJUzPCA_vodSMQw8_fAw). The service is still good.

There are not that m(any) cafes in the Outer Sunset by Ocean Beach, let alone one that opens late into evenings...everyday. Java Beach is one. This place also serves beers and wines, yep, so also useful and cool!

For seating, there are a few stools by the order-counter with a wine-by-the-glass list posted on a chalkboard (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/iRmdKzcbdFLIp3s9e4xrHA?select=YEtt8139P6XdhPrKUSg59w). Otherwise, it's all wooden chairs and bench-style seatings but those are usually occupied, making a visit hit or miss if you want to hang around. The tables are all sticky though, probably due to wood type more than dirtyness. There are two doors, the main one leads to the order counter (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/iRmdKzcbdFLIp3s9e4xrHA?select=KqsAsREGADtylaR2wndIGQ) - the other door leads to the seating section. Also, there's just one unisex restroom.

Easy to get to and find, it is located at the edge of Sloat Blvd (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/iRmdKzcbdFLIp3s9e4xrHA?select=ijUxdph8yTfoDeFrl8ItwA) near Ocean Beach, and right across from the SF Zoo's side entryway. I'll be stopping by frequently if anywhere near the area.
author: Peter L.

description:
While at the zoo, we passed by the Leaping Lemur cafe and became thoroughly  disappointed. Nine bucks for a chicken basket? Please.

So we asked around and zoo workers told us to head to Java Beach for a better sandwich.

It was a short ten minute walk there: just exit the zoo and head right on to Sloat, then cross the street and take a right and you can't miss it. 

We got there and the line was out the door, there was a 20 minute wait for food, and nowhere to sit, which was kinda annoying. 

Our food came and we decided to walk back to the zoo and eat in front of the gorillas. We ordered:

Blueberry muffin-- Moist and delicious, but I wish it was bigger

Kelly's Cove-- Delicious, yet simple sandwich. The pesto was soooo flavorful! 

San Patricio-- meh my chicken was dry, but the honey mustard vinaigrette with      avocado was good! 

Bonfire delight-- Best thing we ordered. This thing had more roast beef on it than Pamela Anderson. The sauce and bread all came together to form a delicious sub.

All in all, it was a good experience, worth the 20 minute wait.

I highly recommend coming HERE than eating zoo food!!!
author: Abe M.

description:
Java Beach is a cool little place to have a delicious sandwich and get a quick coffee. It is a good place to stop by right before visiting the San Francisco Zoo. 

Unfortunately, it isn't the best place to hang out and study. First of all, it is very crowded and there isn't that much seating available. The prices are pretty high for a coffee shop. I don't blame them, they have high demand, I would do the same, but for someone who wants a place to study for finals ( I go to SFSU) it isn't ideal. 

Other then that, I like the ambiance and the food is simple, yet delicious. They have good desserts and there is plenty to choose from, as long as you have some extra cash.
author: Andrew G.

description:
Free wifi is always a plus. Their cappuccinos are good. The java classic sandwich was okay, I like the Dutch crunch bread. It's a bit pricy for sandwiches though. The beef pie was okay, barely any meat though and it was relatively small...

Mediocre cafe, if it wasn't for the free wifi, I wouldn't come here. For those who do, just stick to the coffee. 

P.S. Chips are served with your sandwich, extra plus there.
author: Virginia Y.

description:
Just love there sub sandwich. Bread is fresh and with allot of meats. Yummy. And the espresso is must try..
Close to the zoo and close to beach..
Nice..
author: sean c.

description: Similar to the original java beach. Great neighbourhood coffee shop
author: Donald L.

description: I love java beach,I have been a costumer since 1996 and even though their prices are so high the food and the environment is so welcoming,of course you run into dump people,but who cares when the food is over priced delicious,and what can be even better the the garden and walk to the beach is just amazing feeling after a good tsunami,soup,or a mortadella sandwich of course a glass or red wine on cold days and or a glass of ipa
author: Alexander G.

description:
Free wi-fi, friendly cashiers, good coffee!

Hours are great, I've been able to stumble out of here at 6am with a coffee and able to stumble in here at 8pm for a coffee.

The sandwiches here are delicious and a great value, $10 for a sandwich that is one huge meal or two meals with a side of salad or chips.   The bbq chicken sandwich is my favorite.  The ceasar salad here is great as well ( although they add mushrooms to their ceasar, I just have them hold the shrooms).

Their pies, muffins and donuts are great as well. Although their maple bars have some type of cream inside, whyyyyyy?

5 stars! Plus every now and then a group of hot firefighters will wander in, woohoo for the eye candy!
author: Mailah G.

description: If you only want coffee, this is a great place, but the pastries and sandwiches are mediocre.   I seem to order a sandwich on the day they are training someone (the staff is changing constantly), so it is never prepared correctly.   If it is a sunny, weekend day, the line is very long.   Sometimes the line is very long on weekdays too, and they never seem to bring in another cashier.   There would only be one cashier.
author: Yang Q.

description:
Where is the Blue recycling bin? Where is the green compostable bin? Every time I come to this place it makes me so sad to see the single 'collect all' bins overflowing with landfill as well as recycleables and compostables.  

Hopefully the crew here will get on board with the amazing three bin system for its customers! It takes away from the experience of eating here for me when i see that they're not super environmentally friendly. 

Other than that I have had some really great customer service, and some really not so great customer service! Generally the food is consistent, and a nice place to enjoy the sun after some time out at the beach.
author: Best M.

description: Love it! Super cool and fun vibe. Delicious food and yummy chai lattes!! Definitely recommend this place to get a yummy breakfast or a bite to eat for lunch!
author: Luciana M.

description: I like the salmon sunrise bagel and a small coffee, though occasionally I'll get a toasted veggie sandwich or a kale mushroom salad!
author: Ellie C.

description: Java Beach is a solid spot for coffee or a bite to eat. Coffees are strong, the lattes are smooth, and sandwiches are tasty - my fave is the hot Tsunami sandwich
author: Bumble B.

description:
After receiving a message from the owner minutes after my post I raised my stars and decided I really needed to give this place another try. My boyfriend stop in for bagels on his way to work all the time and loves there coffee and breakfast. I'm actually looking forward to my trip back and appreciate when a business owner takes time to talk with their customers.

Thank you Buffy for taking time to understand your customers. I don't think I've ever been treated so kindly for a negative review, you got yourself a returning customer, and a pleased one at that now.
author: Jade D.

description:
Java Beach at the Zoo across the street from San Francisco Zoo and a short walk from Ocean Beach! This place a relatively new coffee shop? Not quite, but it has been here for quite some time now. For those who were born and raised in San Francisco, there were times when we may have taken those random strolls along Sloat Blvd between 45th Ave and Great Highway remembering the Doggie Diner that used to be on Sloat and 46th Ave! The very last time I went to the Doggie Diner was sometime during the last half of 2004. Times progressed, we started seeing more changes and now all I see is the Doggie Diner head every time I pass by on the 18 or 23!

I only ordered the croissant when I came in today, but I'll definitely order some other items when I come here next time for a sandwich and a cup of coffee! An edit/update will be made available when I try other food and beverage items on the menu. There is more of this come from and until next time, come to this cafe for something to eat and drink as you pass by, coming from the Zoo/Ocean Beach! The size of this place is not very spacious so it is not very suitable for large groups! But I do like the fact that there is outdoor seating! Prices for food and beverage items on the menu are appropriately priced so it would fit anyone's budget!

Parking:
Some people just come and go so sometimes you might just be able to score yourself a spot to park your car immediately.

Public Transportation:
- 18 46th Avenue, 23 Monterey & L Taraval

All of these routes have stops nearby, so getting to/from here via public transportation is relatively easy!
author: Bennett W.

description: 4 stars for great food. Its too bad the service is terrible. I've been coming to this spot for over 7 years, but the service is getting slower and slower. I wouldn't come here again on an empty stomach and if you're looking for food to come out quickly. If you have time to spare, come here on a nice day and enjoy the food. Otherwise, avoid if you're looking for something practical and quick.
author: Shastyn G.

description:
Nice weather on a weekend equals large crowds at the zoo equals large crowd at Java Beach at the Zoo.  I had heard about this place from my friend who lives nearby and it initially was described to me as a quirkly friendly local place that had beer and coffee along with food.  By the time I parked and got there, the line out the door was as long as the line for Star Tours in Disneyland.  Not to mention, the seating already was taken too by the solo laptop users and families who are taking a lunch break from the zoo.

I grabbed a coffee to go and sipped it on my drive home.  It was not bad but I wish I could've had a chance to savor it there.    Maybe next time Java Beach...
author: Ben H L.

description: Hubby and I stopped in for a quick bite. We ordered a sandwich to share. Kelly's Cove sandwich with a side mixed green salad. Delicious! Then my husband noticed Guinness on tap! Score! Exactly what he wanted after navigating the traffic, detours and road construction.
author: Michelle L.

description: This shop employs the nicest and the very .... Well, say the service of the best alleviates the pain of the worst. Wide variety of sandwiches and drinks serves palettes of children and discerning locals. The restaurant hosts artwork and comfortable, beautiful seating in addition to outdoor accommodations. Recommended to any Sunset visitor or resident.
author: Angela F.

description:
Stopped for lunch after the SF Zoo based on rave Yelp reviews. 

I had the soup of the day - Italian wedding soup - which was delicious. My boyfriend had the tsunami sandwich and really liked it. 

This place is kinda small and gets busy around lunch time. A few people sit at the tables after they're done eating to work on their computers so table space can be hard to come by.
author: CL S.

description:
I ordered a BLT to go once and they ran out of sourdough and replaced it with baguette.  It was AMAZING.  I was hungry and it was fantastic.  Win-Win!  But I ordered it another time, and this time it was...dry and meh.  

I've also had the Irish Kerry Gold, the grilled cheese on pullman bread also to go.  I got in the car and peeked in the box, and saw two open-faced, small thick pieces of bread with a generous amount of white cheddar melted on top of each and dripping over the sides.  I guess I was expecting processed cheese!  Depends which you prefer.  Obviously cheddar is of higher quality, but I was only able to eat one slice when the cheese on the second slice cooled and congealed.

The pastries are just pre bought ones.
author: Animal K.

description:
Trying to keep my café routines flexible and not resigned to going to the same places all the time, I took on Cassie J's advice and spent the day at this cute little java by the zoo. In addition to having the beach nearby, this cafe is conveniently located to attract more little kids to visit than anyone will ever know. The sunny disposition is shaped by a cast of young, energetic staff, young families that hang out before or after their outdoor fun; and graduate students who tend to stick around longer than usual with their laptops. Wink wink!

Initially I was a little apprehensive about the prospects of the weather in the area, but it turned out nice and warm. Temperature inside was definitely comfy, and the sidewalk seating were filled with people basking in the sun with their pets. At the server's recommendation, my order of Kelly's Cove sandwich ($7.75) arrived warmed by request, and it had a thick layer of pesto and melted Swiss on top of layers of fresh greens and wholesome delicious turkey. The bread was toasted to perfection and although the pesto was a bit too oily, the sandwich was a hearty reminder of Darwin's Ltd. Gosh I miss that place!

During my hours of work I also tried their refreshing iced tea ($3), dark house drip ($1.95), and a cup of vanilla and chocolate soft serve ($5+) to continue my celebration of the National Ice Cream Month. The ice cream was like the ones at Foster's Freeze, not too sweet but dense and creamy. It was the perfect motivation to get some work done. Although the seating area was smaller than desired, I really enjoyed having free wifi and the youthful but laid back atmosphere.

A few limitations observed: 1.) It was a warm day so I hope they had kept their soymilk in an ice container to keep fresh, 2.) Even though the server had tried to sweep the floor several times, the nature of having so many little kids around requires more vigilance to keep the place clean. Aside from these minor issues, they have great hours, nice music, and a welcoming décor to keep you entertained. 

Thank you Cassie, for the wonderful recommendation! I was very productive and had a enjoyable visit. I would love to come back again. 4.5 stars.
author: Daniel L.

description:
I'm a loyal to Java's soil. I dont even understand nor can I fathom some of the negative three star comments about Java. I personally can't think of one bad experience or thing to say about this tucked away treasure. 

The staff is always super friendly and open to all menu questions. They are awesome when it comes to substitutions. The  sandwiches are out of this world (try the three cheese veggie sandwich, you wont regret it) and come completely packed with all the trimmings. The portions sizes are generous. You can choose from small to large, varying in price from 5-7 bucks. I'd always advise to go with a medium sandwich, they are HUGE. Its always clean. I've never seen any type of wildlife nonchalantly walk into the cafe. The back door is always closed, with the exception of the front. Alot of parents come here with their children from the zoo, for a small cup of after zoo ice cream. Its just a wonderful vibe. Its also pet friendly and they provide an outside water bowl for any thirsty animals. 

Now, it is a small location with limited seating, inside and out in front. The tables are circular and small in circumference. Barely any room to fit a 17'' laptop, let alone with a cup of coffee but just enough for you and a companion's sandwich baskets. I feel like because they offer free wifi and serve coffee, younger students automatically assume "prime homework location". First off, its not a library. If your looking to do your homework, hit up a Starbucks. Besides, I personally never understood the whole appeal of doing a dissertation at any type of cafe-but that's a whole other review for a whole other day. 


Moral of the Story: awesome sandwiches for fair prices, great staff vibes, and a perfect lunch location with a short block walk to the beach. Try it out, you wont regret it.
author: Nat S.

description:
Nice local cafe to get some work done while enjoying a cup of latte. Although I usually walk here, there's available parking around the cafe. 

Nice staff, good wifi and enough seating!
author: Winnie L.

description: I am updating my review after being contacted directly by the very apologetic owner.  She really stepped up and took responsibility for my bad experience.  She insisted to paypal me my money back which I really appreciated and she wanted to know exactly which staff assisted me.  I will definitely be going back to Java Beach on Sloat to try another sandwich and more!!!  Really wish more business owners were like this one
author: Ali S.

description: I work across the street from this place and we call for take out from here most Fridays. The food is mediocre and the service is mildly friendly most of the time but they do have their duds, especially the girl who said she's 'so over people today' while working the cash register.  They get our order wrong 90% of the time, I have found a hair in my bagel's cream cheese, good luck figuring out how many days old your cole slaw is, but the reason I have stopped eating here is because of what I found in my latest sandwich.  I bit into a quarter-sized piece of glass in the tuna melt.  Glass.  When I called them to let them know, a quiet woman, who obviously didn't know what to do, apologized and took down my phone number.  I assumed I would hear from management/owner within a week to apologize and offer me a gift certificate or something. It has been almost two weeks and I have heard nothing.  I told the woman on the phone where I work and they are aware how much business we give them.  Well, used to give them.  I recommend going next door to George's.  Better quality, better customer service, and much better food!
author: Allison P.

description: Great neighborhood spot. Highly recommend anything with their pesto, but haven't ever been disappointed by the delicious sandwiches. Regular coffee is ok, but worth it to splurge for the pour-over.
author: Evie M.

description:
What a great place to stop by before or after a walk on Ocean Beach. Or if you swing by the SF Zoo too. It does have a great feel inside. Very comfortable place to bring a book, laptop (free wi-fi), or just enjoy a sandwich and drink. 

I really enjoyed my hot sandwich called Tsunami. Bread may be a little thicker then I normally like. Food is priced well. They have Happy Hour prices on beer. If its a nice day outside then you can enjoy some out door sitting.
author: Justin C.

description: Dropped in to this coffee shop.  Nice surroundings and they serve beer .  I ordered a BLT.   Not impressed.  Bacon had very little meat, lots of fat and not thoroughly cooked.   They served it up with some coleslaw on the side and the coke slaw juice made half of my sandwich soggy .   Beware of the BLT.
author: S C.

description: 4 stars for being a bit pricey. But the food and the location makes up for it. The food is simple but it just has a great ambiance to it. Tourist sit there and enjoy the lifestyles of the locals and plus the zoo is across the street and Ocean Beach is down the street. Oh and their chocolate chip cookies are homemade and delicious! Smoked salmon with everything bagel....to die for.
author: Sothary C.

description: Very busy, but for good reason, The coffee and food is outstanding and that staff are amazing. Love the staff. It is so popular, it can sometimes be hard to find a seat. Still, if you wait just a second, one usually pops up. They have free wifi, which is a big plus. It's a great local hangout.
author: Philip M.

description: It was one of those crazy, rare hot days we had a while back in May, I was craving one of the root beer floats from Java Beach- I just had to have one- diet be damned !  This is a great place to hang out and meet up with friends. They have beer and wine also if you are in the mood.
author: Mary M.

description: Okay coffee. Nice vibe and all, and decent food. Not much to my taste though.
author: Uddhav A.

description:
This cafe is just a few blocks from the beach (hence the name), which is a nice touch if you're the kind of person who simply enjoys being near the ocean. I cannot speak for the coffee, as I did not have any, but I did order Stacy's Mexican Salad which I enjoyed. The salad has dorito chips in it, which was a pleasant twist for a salad. 

The only reason I give it four stars is that there wasn't really enough indoor seating (which I understand isn't their fault). I had to sit at the tables outside (which wasn't too bad because it wasn't too chilly) until an indoor spot opened up. 

Would absolutely return to Java Beach!
author: Sasha B.

description:
Field trip to the zoo! And no, I'm never too old for a field trip, esp to the zoo!

Came here a bit too early, and i was pretty hungry, so I was browsing through yelp which would be he best cafe/restaurant for breakfast. Spotted this place, and thought, "why not?" 

I grabbed a Pesto Veggie Bagel for around $5-6 since i thought their Salmon Lox Bagel was a tad too expensive (-$9 for a bagel... hmmm) Anyway, I'm glad I got my pesto veggie bagel anyway because I believe it's probably the best bagel I've ever had in my entire life! The first bite was pretty orgasmic, and I could not get over how good their pesto sauce was. lol

I wasn't hungry, but I felt like I could've stuffed more down my stomach if I could. 
Kind of wish I tried their coffees too, but oh well, next time! 

Definitely a great place to grab a bite if you're near the zoo!
author: Harriet W.

description:
When I'm in the neighborhood and have extra time to kill, Java Beach is the place I go to. With friendly staff and wifi, it's hard not to like this place. It's a great place to grab something quick to eat, do a little work, or just stop for a coffee. Located right across from the zoo, there's usually a crowd of people in the mornings, and seating can sometimes be hard to find. As far as parking, it's pretty easy to find parking. Sure, you may not get the parking spaces right in front, but there's still parking in the Avenues or the lots for the zoo (unless you come the first Wednesdays of the month around noon). Little bonus, there's a small bathroom if you need.

Usually, I get some kinda of bagel, but I've heard all their sandwhiches are good. My most recent favorite is the veggie bagel, which includes tomatoes, cream cheese, lettuce, onions, and sprouts. Though there was little too much cream cheese, it was really good! As far as beverages go, I've only had the hot chocolate, which was a little dissappointing. For me, a chocolate lover, it was a little too rich and not quiet up to par with other hot chocolates I've had. Even though the hot chocolate's not the best, don't let that steer you away from this place.

So if you're in the area and need something to eat, come here and you won't be disappointed.
author: Alanna H.

description: My day started when I arrived at my friends house we all decided to go to Java Beach. When I arrived I received the most brilliantly made cup of coffee. The foam was  creamy frothy and delightful. I would recommend this place to any coffee connoisseur, I want to give the credit to this masterpiece of a coffee to a gentleman wearing a red beanie and camo pants, unfortunately, I don't know his name.
author: Thomas S.

description:
What a rollercoaster ride, Java Beach.
You gave me the most amazing hot chocolates the other night, and I was tempted to up your rating to 5 stars because of the lovely service. Hot, rich, and dark chocolate to warm up a cold winter night in San Francisco. 

And then I order a chai tea latte the next day and it's not as strong or spicy as I would have liked. Perhaps I should have stuck to the espressos. Or the sandwiches.

ALAS, THEY HAVE DUTCH CRUNCH BREAD AND WHAT - THEY TOAST THEIR BREAD.
Brilliant. madness.

And so I leave you with four stars, you convenient little coffee shop. I will be back!
author: Colleen M.

description: Lol I wrote kind of a bad review a while back but now I live close by and come here all the time and I love it!
author: Kayla C.

description: My friend and I decided to get some bagels and sandwiches (to pack for our hike) here. There was a steady flow of customers, but service was pretty quick. I got an asiago bagel with cream cheese. Yummy but nothing out of the ordinary. My friend let me try a bite of his wheat bagel with sun dried tomato cream cheese. One bite of that and I immediately wished I got that instead. I'm used to Noah's Bagels' sun dried tomato shmear. But this one definitely tops it. Real bits of tomato and so creamy! I forgot the name of the sandwich I bought. But I do remember it had lots of chicken (a lot a lot), bacon, lettuce, tomato, and mayo on sourdough. So good! Haven't had a good classic sandwich like that in a very very long time. I also would like to add that I ate my sandwich about 3-4 hours after I bought it. Still amazing! Overall, good decently priced food in a great area (by the zoo and Ocean Beach).
author: Carmelisa M.

description: It's nice -my friend who got a sandwich ended up being kind of annoyed at its messiness, but other than that everything was enjoyable. A good place to go for breakfast or lunch.
author: Tasha T.

description:
This place was forever in my bookmarks so I decided to finally give this place a try.  Tryin to steer away from your "typical" coffee and I always love to try new coffee spots.  So today was my first time and man was it awesome. I ordered my typical vanilla soy latte (so I can compare) and cheese danish (which was huge btw).  As I was ordering I noticed their bagel menu and low and behold I spotted a smoked salmon bagel sandwich!  Hell yeah "I'll take the smoked salmon bagel as well!" (coffee and smoked salmon are 2 of my favorite breakfast items) The staff was very polite and inviting and I think she kinda knew I was a new face so she was very accommodating. 

As I was waiting I had a chance to scope the place out and they had beer on tap!  Another plus was that they served Guinness Heyyy!! Their seating seemed to only be for 2-4 max but I can see they want to keep the chill vibe.   I heard my name, grabbed my coffee took a sip and raised my eyebrows, mmm!  Then I heard my name again, grabbed my bagel and couldn't wait to eat so as I stepped out about to head to my car I decided to grab a seat and eat outside.  Love the atmosphere, the service and the food.  Can't wait to come back for Happy Hour 5-7 to order a build your own sandwich and a pint of Guinness.  Heck ya! (shameless plug) Team mom and pop shops!

~~organic coffee~breakfast~lunch~beeeerr!!
author: Marilou A.

description: Came in and had a Tsunami sandwich, bowl of curry, and a couple of pints of Fort Point. The sandwich was awesome with its nicely toasted bread, salami, and ham. Great place before wandering around the zoo or lounging around at the beach. Definitely a place I would like visit again.
author: Randy L.

description: Everything is super overpriced and food is bland. Good for a drink and a small bite but not for a meal.
author: Anastasia P.

description:
Still a great little spot to grab a cup of coffee and sit outside amid the fog and the ocean breeze. The scones are good. Yet, arriving early in the day does ensure pastries will be fresh and plentiful. When I arrived later on in the afternoon yesterday, the selection in the window was limited. 

I will have to go back and try one of their lunch or meal specialties. This is also a good place to take in local flavor and atmosphere. It is very down-to-earth and unpretentious.
author: Jonathan F.

description:
I took my old roommate out for breakfast here after we discovered that the place we wanted to go eat at down the street was closed on Mondays.

We ordered two identical bagels, and got different results because I think someone was stoned and forgot what the difference is between a poppy seed bagel and a sesame seed bagel.  We rolled in the face of this tragedy and weathered on.  the service was quick and friendly, and the coffee was pretty OK.

I dunno...  It was decent.  I would go back.
author: Sam A.

description: Can I give them Zero stars?! Stopped by hoping to pick up sandwiches to go to the zoo. They took over 30 min. Tried to get a refund and that took forever!
author: S D.

description:
Perfect after-zoo pit stop. 

The food is good--but for a cafe like this, you expect the food to be good if it is going to stay open in San Francisco. The real draw is the cozy atmosphere and the friendly service. Everybody on staff seems happy to be there, and that is very pleasant to be around.
author: Kelly A.

description: Cute little sandwich spot by San Francisco zoo.  Came here on a gorgeous day and you can see the ocean outside, they have a big variety of made to order cold and hot sandwiches! I got a turkey pesto which was very delicious!
author: Stephanie C.

description: GOOD strong coffee. Moist and delicious chocolate muffins. Staff is friendly. This place is popular for a reason. Great neighborhood spot!
author: Monica D.

description: After a really unpleasant experience the owner contacted me and offered me a refund which i thought was very nice customer service.  I was really disappointed with Java Beach staff and quality of food/wait time but I realize every business has an off-day, so I'm changing my review to reflect the latest experience I had, which is that the owner cares very much about the place and is looking to make some positive changes.
author: Katie K.

description: This place is great for coffee, sandwiches, whatev.  You can also work comfortably on your laptop.  The service is great.  Wish it was walking distance for me.
author: Patricia D.

description: Nice staff and excellent sandwiches. Lots of regulars come to this location. It offered the same high quality food that the on Judah does with half the wait.
author: Mike B.

description: Came here to get a sandwich and it took 20 minutes... Everyone who ordered before and after me got their sandwich when mine was still not done. Sandwich wasn't even warm but they said it was "toasted". Rude workers with attitude, don't think I'm ever coming back
author: Polly C.

description:
Java Beach is right around the corner from us, and while we only discovered it recently, I think it's likely to become one of our standard "places to go when we forget to thaw something for dinner."

The café is smallish (you'll probably have trouble finding seating inside on the weekend, but if the weather is nice there's ample seating outdoors), but they have a large selection of salads, sandwiches, baked goods, and other items. I've pretty much settled on Stacy's Mexican Salad, a delicious if slightly overpriced southwestern style salad with - wait for it - Nacho Cheese Doritos delivering your necessary crunch. The build-your-own sandwich option is also great, as the café has a wide variety of bread, meats, and cheeses from which to choose (the fiancé swears by their pastrami).

We've started sending our out-of-town guests here for their morning Joe (we don't own a coffee maker), and they've all enjoyed it, and Java Beach also offers smoothies, juices, and even beers and wines for the rest of us. Overall, this is a nice little place for a quick, casual bite after your trip to the Zoo, the beach, or that hip-happening Outer Sunset neighborhood.
author: Kristen L.

description: We looked up "breakfast" and "zoo" because we remembered good reviews but could not remember the cafe's name.   We thought it was this place and delighted with what we found.  Great sandwiches at the appropriate price. We had a table in the sun and relished the food and the ambiance.  Will return to try other selections
author: Lynne O.

description:
This was my local high school hangout spot and continues to be our favorite high school reunion cafe. The atmosphere is "chill" (as the young people say) and the drinks are delicious. I also recommend their sandwiches!

Favorite drinks: sweetened chai latte, frozen hot chocolate
author: Jenny A.

description: Great neighborhood gem. I love walking over here for brunch or lunch and sitting outside ( when it's nice out!).  Great sandwiches, very filling and fresh. The only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is that the wait for your food is often very long, even when they are not crowded. I think it's because everything is made from scratch, but sometimes it still seems like a really long wait for a sandwich. Come here on a leisurely day when your not in a rush and it will definitely be worth it!
author: Liz C.

description: A Latte and an bacon & egg Pastie.....view of the ocean and the sun on my back. It doesn't get any better than that. Service quick and to the point, my breakfast and latte hit the spot. I've always loved this place. I wish I could start every morning here.
author: Danielle G.

description: Very good coffee. Fast service, on a busy day. Friendly baristas. Nice ambience. Great place to do work/study. We need more coffee shops like these!
author: Andrew F.

description:
As the fog rolls in in the late afternoon as it basically always does by Ocean Beach, Java Beach is the perfect place to relax and enjoy a hot cup of coffee or a quick snack. Whether you're recovering from a day at the zoo with the kids, trying to get some reading done, surf the web (wifi is available for customers), or catching up with a friend, I think you'll enjoy this awesome place.

There's a great selection of food and drinks! I had the Original O.B. Sandwich with Pastrami and Provolone cheese and it was toasted to perfection! The sandwich was delicious (and comes with a nice kick from the special sauce that tastes like italian dressing) and comes with some kettle chips. A hot sweetened chai tea on the side was perfect. Aside from your typical coffee and tea specialty drinks, this place also has beer on tap that some folks will find comforting for that extra warmth if coffee won't do the job for you.
author: Cheston W.

description: Great coffee and fresh sandwiches. A great location of your visiting the zoo, Ocean Beach, or even Lands End. The only reason I gave 4 stars is seating is limited and sometimes a lengthy wait. The staff is always laid back and friendly.
author: Cassie S.

description:
This is my slightly-out-of-the-way-but-worth-it spot to go to for a cup of coffee or even a decent lunch. Let me say that I totally think the place is slightly overrated and the staff could use some customer service lessons, yet somehow the place still keeps me coming back. 

The food is always great, and how could it not be. They make it right when you order it. The cinnamon toast is great for the post party days when the stomach ain't doing so hot. 

The coffee? So many to choose from (but totally overpriced) and you pour it yourself, so feel free to make yourself a hazelnut Colombian french press caffeinated dream escape and go power walk the beach on your Bluetooth. That way I can sit on the beach and vote "Bluetooth or crazy" with my friends and have something better to do hung over. 

I digress.  This place is marvelous regardless. Disregard all the unusual amounts of pretentiousness and drive away into the sunset.
author: Jeremy R.

description: I've been here a number of times. Their coffee, bagel options and sandwich menu are all very good. Lots of outdoor seating for folks with pups.
author: Jennifer P.

description:
I did not have high expectations for this place because it was not crowded when I came, but I was impressed by their hot veggie sandwich! It was served hot, and the bread was a little hard to bite because it was so hard. Nonetheless the flavors were delicious. It came with cucumbers,sprouts, tomatos, avocado, and 3 cheeses. The small size is about 5 inches, but it's piled high. 

The one complaint I have is all the gnats inside the restaurant. The whole time I was there, my friend and I were swatting them away from our food and table. We moved from the bar to the table area, and but could not escape the gnats. I noticed other customers swatting them away too.

I would return back here to grab a sandwich to bring to the beach or to the zoo!
author: Kristina N.

description: Cool little spot right around the corner from Irish Cultural Center on Sloat. $2.50 for a cup of coffee and it sure woke me up. Nice staff, the girl that worked there was cute too. I definitely look forward to trying out what they offer to eat at some point.
author: Marty J.

description: So I have been to the one right at the GH before and love that place, this one I was not sold on before because I liked the way the other JVC does their chicken ceasar salad, but I have came in here a few times now for soy latte's, a danish, muffin etc. and was always pleased....today I got one of their "Whirling Dervish Veggie Subs" and it was AMAZING! I love this (I got the small and trust me, I am STILL full and I ate this at 3:30pm (it's 7:20pm lol), stuffed would be a better term. So I say - give em a go! And try that sub....damn it was good =)
author: Bella B.

description: Staff is very sweet and the ambiance is nice and down to earth. WiFi is spotty at best and my phone kept dropping calls. Reggae music while I was here was blaring, a bit too loud to study or work.
author: jhenya a.

description: We live around the corner from the cafe and come about twice a week.  The staff is so friendly and attentive.  Most people assume that a place like this would just have decent drinks, but the drinks and food are amazing! I prefer a bagel and a blended iced mocha for my weekly visit :)
author: Amanda G.

description: Awesome. Service was fantastic. Had the hummus veggie bagel, and the sundried tomato bagel. Also awesome. And, it's one of the few places that I found that has stevia as a sugar substitute, so again..... Awesome ! Will come back.
author: Alana S.

description: The best coffee, the best food, the best location, the best looking women working the front counter...and on top of it all, they told Starbucks to screw off when they tried to buy them out.  Hell yeah this is my favorite coffee joint in town.
author: Nick F.

description: Got two Tsunami and two Ocean Beach. The total came out to be about $40. I like that the sandwiches come with a side salad. The sandwiches were just alright. They put way too much mustard in them. Overall, sandwiches were ok, service was ok. Definitely not something I would go out of my way for.
author: MonkeyGirl C.

description: I haven't been to Ocean Beach in a decade or so and was heading to the beach to collect sand dollars. I was getting hungry with the wife and 2 kids still on summer break. I was looking for the Doggie Diner. Odd that I just saw the Doggie Diner head on a lamp post, but no restaurant. DUH! Java Beach at the Zoo took its place! Thank goodness because I really wasn't looking forward to hamburgers and hotdogs! This place is good to pick up a few sandwiches for the beach. Turkey club, the cheese melt and the BBQ chicken sub are all good! Comes with my favorite chips (Kettle sea salt) and green salad with some vinaigrette dressing. Will need to come back here to try their milkshakes and variety drinks.
author: Marcus Y.

description: Much better service compare to the sister cafe on the other side of the beach. The one thing that holds me back from giving 5 stars is the coffee beans that Java uses. There must be better choices out there.
author: Lianna D.

description: This place has Stevia! I love it here. Wish I could stop by more often.
author: Jocelyn J.

description:
Before I entered Java Beach at the Zoo, I expected beach dudes and Baywatch Pamela Andersen look a likes sipping coffee.
"Whatsup dude! Surf's Up!"  I was wrong.  But I did find a great hidden gem.

A few things make up a superb café experience and Java Beach at the Zoo hits all these marks.

Starting with the food, the turkey sandwich is on par.  The fresh bread that was slightly over toasted is accompanied by fresh ingredients and crunchy potato chips.  They also serve soft serve, beer on tap, wine, and a list of creative sandwiches.

The service is friendly and the ambiance is just simply cozy.  Warm wood panels surround the interior making it a prime spot to surf the extra fast internet and work while the sounds of ocean waves are just a few blocks away.

If you're going to Java Beach at the Zoo to do some work, avoid the lunch and dinner crowds.  With just about eight tables, it can get crowded.  

Try their featured salads and sandwiches, their attention to presentation makes the café food on par.
author: Rayfil W.

description: Raised their prices. Wifi doesn't work anymore. Service is super slow, took me 10 mins to get my latte.
author: Morgan H.

description: This sure beats Starbucks! Funky place with great coffee and breakfast. Also great lunch with beer and wine! very friendly staff.
author: Carrie D.

description:
Unseasonably delicious.

Another 70° February day. Either global warming is in full force, the Big One is coming or the female EDM-loving deity watching over us just likes San Francisco.

Java Beach was the perfect destination for lunch on this summer-ish day. Ocean just down the street. Tables outside to enjoy the weather and/or free WiFi and a delicious BBQ chicken sandwich.

Plenty sauce. Plenty of poultry. Plenty of sunshine.

They even had ice cream. Straus Family soft serve. Quite appropriate on yet another Indian Winter day.

The deities most definitely love us. They'd dig Java Beach too.
author: Jason B.

description: Our favorite place in San Francisco to get coffee! Every time we are in town, we stop by to get their almond milk lattes (one of the few places that make a good almond milk latte). However, this last time we stopped by, we noticed that the girl making our drinks was not using gloves, but we thought, "ok, she washed her hands... No big deal!" But then we noticed that she kept rubbing her face & hair, pat down the espresso, fiddle with her glasses, and then hold our cups by the rim where we drink out of. That's pretty gross and unsanitary. We will come back one more time and if we notice the same issues we will have to get our coffee somewhere else.
author: Jeff D.

description:
Another update to my review, 5/9/13:

Still 1 star, for the same primary reason--they have so atrociously laid out the seating plan here that approximately half of the space is totally wasted.  In the last 6 months I have checked 3-4 times, and each time there have been zero available seats.  Today I got the last one, and I can plainly see that if they laid things out differently they could fit twice as many people in here.
Almost all their customers are using their laptops and working alone, and the other half of their tables remain empty and unused.  To make it worse, in every corner they have made it so only one person can basically use it, whereas before they remodeled 3 or 4 could be there.  I can't believe they haven't fixed this (I would think they could almost double their business if they just took a clue)

------------------------------------------------------------------

I have updated this review on 1/7/13 due to a response from the cafe's owner; see below to read about that.  Here's my original post.....

It is impossible to get a seat in this cafe now, the food and coffee are average, their prices are too high, and their wifi sucks.

Since their recent 'remodeling'/re-shuffling of their space, my guess is that they roughly cut in half (or at best a third) the number of seats available for individuals showing up alone.  The way their new, inefficient setup is, there are nonetheless lots of seats empty, but they're either crammed into a corner behind 3 or 4 people and nearly impossible to get to, or you'd have to sit across from a stranger and share a tiny table space (which I never see anybody do) the width of an actual surfboard (what were they thinking?!?).

Since it seems that most of their customers are individuals, they end up taking up two seats, and I basically NEVER find a seat here anymore, and now find myself just leaving and going to another cafe 90 percent of the time (I have noticed that Beachside Coffee Bar & Kitchen a block away suddenly had a big spike in business after Java Beach re-arranged their seating, and I am not surprised).  

Not only that but they've upped their prices to an unreasonable amount.  I think the only reason this place does so much business is there has been no competition near the beach.  They aren't good enough to deserve so much business, or such a high rating.

Oh, and their wifi sucks.  It's always very low bandwidth, shared by many users, and usually multiple times per hour it goes down and you have to wait until a barrista has time to reboot their router.

UPDATE, 1/7/13:
A months ago I received a reply from this cafe's owner in response to my negative review.  She agreed that the place can be pretty crowded with their new seating layout, and told me that they would be upgrading their wifi soon.  She also had the audacity to tell me that if I came between certain hours when a certain manager worked there, "she will ensure you get a seat, and an espresso drink on the house as a way of our apologies."   
I take this to mean that since I gave a bad review they would somehow get me a seat in their overcrowded misused space (how?), and a $4 beverage on the house.  So, what about all the other customers who can't get seats?  Will they need to write bad reviews and wait to get special treatment?  I am confused.

I hear that for every person who bothers to register a complaint or give a bad review there are likely 10-20 others who had that same experience but didn't bother.  I'm guessing that's the case for this place.
author: Jason F.

description: I love this place and don't want anyone else to discover it and ruin it for me. Then again, it will take a while for people from the Mission to even find it. The young women who work here are lovely and work their butts off. I've only tried a few things off the menu because I keep ordering the yogurt and granola with fruit. I've eyed other orders and there is always a generous amount of food on the plate. Coffee is excellent. Somehow despite the number of people who move through here, there's almost always a table. Tables turn over b/c it's not a laptop cafe, hallelujah. My one major complaint is that the bathroom is RIGHT off the main eating area, so everytime someone goes in we all get an unpleasant view. Worse, people frequently leave the door ajar or open. I won't rant here about manners (but really....) but thought I'd suggest to the management that they install a gizmo on the door so it closes on its own. Please????
author: Peppi M.

description:
My neighborhood go to when I'm out of coffee (or lazy and in need of food)

Everything I've tried here was fresh and delicious, the customer service is top-notch, even when it's packed during the morning rush...

The only draw back is that it can get pretty cozy in there when it's busy : /
author: Brittany T.

description:
Fresh OJ, and Guinness on tap?!?

Who thought of this magical combination?!
author: Jeff P.

description:
My local coffee spot!

This place has it all--- dynamite coffee, beer, wine, soft serve, awsome sandwiches, salads, oatmeal, free wifi, spicy and sweet chai, killer fruit bowls, all the milks you could ever want (soy, almond, rice...).

I will say they are super busy on the weekend and it is because they are AWESOME. 

My only advice-- know what you want before you get to the register!
author: Kimber M.

description:
Java Beach is a funky little cafe that always seems to be busy. They do breakfast, sandwiches and sweets. Several kinds of coffee, beers and lemonade.

It's directly across from the zoo and 2 blocks from Ocean Beach. Take a seat outside and listen to the gulls and the waves. There are about 10 tables inside, and plenty of outlets to charge a laptop.

The sandwiches aren't cheap (the bill was $21 for 2 sandwiches and 1 drink), but the location is great, the facilities are super clean and the ingredients are fresh.
author: Monarch B.

description: The food is decent cafe style sandwiches, bagels, and salads. My only complaint is why the hell do they not wipe down the area where they make all the food?!  Every time I go there the line or cutting boards are just filled with cream cheese, crumbs, and other food products at all times. All they have to do is wipe the board and put stuff back. It all just looks really clumsy. Other than that its a decent spot.
author: Wyatt F.

description: Great sandwiches, good breakfast and ice cream for the kids. Easy to pick something up and head over to the beach.
author: Nicholas R.

description:
Starbucks? Starbucks who? 

Seriously. My first time here and I am definitely coming back. I got a medium Vanilla Latte and it was perfect. Not too hot, but it didn't cool down too quickly either. I also got the Hummus Veggie bagel. It had hummus, sprouts, tomato and lettuce and it was delish. 

The atmosphere is extremely friendly. Something I could get used to going to every day.
author: M C.

description: I came here for a little snack with some friends before we went to hang out. It was all ladies working and They were wonderful with their service. I love the casual feel of the place and I love how its all open. The food was good and the atmosphere was good. I would come back here again.
author: Anji W.

description:
Ok, in one way this place deserves three stars, and that is the slow food preparation.  If you order a hot sub or bagel on a weekend, be prepared for it to take 15 minutes.  

That said, they make up for the slow food delivery is so many ways; the food is really good for casual/cafe food, the portions are generous without being ridiculous, there is a good variety of food & beverage and lots of pastries.  The coffee is probably the best in the outer Sunset.  But the best thing about this place is the staff.  Everyone that works there is really great.  Even when they are super busy, they manage to be friendly and polite, and the baristas know the difference between a cappuccino and a latte.
author: Rein G.

description:
For this one little aspect, this place for me deserves 5 Stars, up one from the previous 4: The gals working there yesterday night were extremely friendly, and attentive, despite just being a little cafe at the beach.  

I needed to escape some tension at home yesterday night so I decided on Java Beach since they close at 11pm--great convenient hours.  Once arriving, the gal at the cashier was friendly and patient as I decided on what to order.  I was contemplating on whether or not to try something new, or stick with the BBQ Chicken Sandwich that I love there.  I finally decided on the known, along with a Green Tea.  For customers eating there, they have cute little personalized "Java Beach" mugs, that are also available for purchase.  

I noticed the gal making my sandwich wearing gloves which I really appreciated despite her not handling any cash.  After a few disturbing experience at other places, seeing gals switching off from handling cash to making food, I've always been bothered by this little aspect.  But it was great seeing this gal wearing gloves and cleaning her counter after each order.  

My sandwich arrived, and it was consistent and satisfying.  After my sandwich, being the way that I am, I had to buy a cookie.  The Vegan Banana Chocolate Walnut Cookie made by "Zoe's Cookies" quickly caught my eye--perfect, chewy, soft, and actually tasted really good, despite my preconceived ideas about Vegan food being bland and boring.  

They also sell soft serve ice cream, available in Vanilla, Chocolate or Swirl.  Furthermore, they have a little bar area for Draft Beer and Wine.  Such a cool little aspect for a cafe.  Very well rounded items for sale here.
 
I was quickly at ease from home life here at Java Beach.  The combination of my  y u m m y  sandwich, hot green tea, and the beachy atmosphere, was a great way to end my night.
author: Cass J.

description: Visiting family in the Outer Sunset and only had the horrid hotel coffee and waited until I could grab a drink at Java Beach instead.  Friendly service and delicious, hot and beautiful.
author: Jenn C.

description: Great coffee shop near the beach! Good food and drinks. Nice place to chill or grab lunch with a friend!
author: Talia A.

description: This is a great place for a quick bite in the morning. The coffee is excellent and the pastries don't disappoint.
author: Ed P.

description:
It's a freaking Cafe that sells beer! What are you waiting for?! You got your alcohol, caffeine, and toasted sandwiches on Dutch crunch. That's all you really need before you head to the Zoo or kicking back at the beach, right? WRONG. You first need to use the free Wi-Fi to update your facebook status or something. I forget what I ordered but it was along the lines of a bbq roast beef sandwich with swiss on the Dutch stuff.

I recommend walking or biking here if you're in the neighborhood on a sunny day. It's just a relaxing spot to munch on your dutch crunch with an Italian soda on a warm sunny day. Did I mention that they're open late too? Well if I didn't.. they are open late. Haha
author: Benson T.

description:
It's better than the Java Beach original location!  The zoo location has soft serve ice cream (chocolate and vanilla), more power outlets and no minimum purchase for credit card use.  With the ceiling fans (good circulation), free wi-fi, bathroom, and free/unlimited parking, it is a great spot to hang out and work - but the seating is uncomfortable (all wood, no cushions).  I also love the view of the iconic Doggie Diner head!

I had a medium latte (quite decent, sometimes with foam art) which was on the small side and a bowl of hot oatmeal ($3.75).  They have plenty of food and drink options including giant muffins, croissants, bagels, toast, soup, salads, hot and cold sandwiches (starting at $5.50), beer on tap and wine.  I wish the coffee cups were larger.

The toast is interesting; it's a soft roll.  I've also had a toasted sub there and they do a nice job with the toasting, the ingredients are fresh and you can choose your bread, meat and cheese.  The small size is a half sandwich and it comes with a pile of greasy potato chips.  

The crowd is diverse, from old regulars to parents w/ their rowdy toddlers (presumably they come before and after visiting the zoo).  If you can, bring your own cushion like I do.
author: Lolia S.

description: I had a spinach-garlic quiche and broccoli-cheddar soup.  Both were fresh delicious and without fillers, much better than that corporate food at Mimi's Cafe.   I think this cafe has the best food in the local neighborhood south of the zoo.
author: A H.

description: Fun, relaxing spot to grab brunch, a snack or a drink.  Especially on sunny days, it is a nice spot to go to and sit outside. Low key, chill vibe. A neighborhood favorite.
author: Johanna W.

description:
I would pick this cafe over the other Java Beach Cafe just because it's a little closer to me. Again, I have to acknowledge the almond milk in my white mocha--my absolute favorite. 

I also tried their beef peasant pie and kelly's cove sandwich and I loved both. This joint might a little pricey for some items but trust me, the quality and taste is worth it. This is a great spot to stop at especially on a nice sunny day in SF. They even have soft-serve ice cream now which is just another plus. 

*I also just learned you can call in your order to pick up. The pluses keep piling on!!!!!!!!
author: Valerie E.

description:
This place is great!  It's so nice having a great coffee shop in this part of town.  Indoor and outdoor seating, good coffee, great sandwiches.

Only 4-stars though, because the service at the register seems to be 50% awesome, or 50% lame - its like playing roulette when you walk through the door.
author: Anthony B.

description:
I stop by when I can.. I do love the atmosphere here.. very peaceful and comforting. 

The prices were what slapped me to my sense.. definitely not your average starbucks! But the quality is better. The tables were a bit sticky as I was doing homework. I ordered a large Italian soda but they gave me regular=[ And it wasn't carbonated.. Their vanilla lattes are sooooo good though, again, pricey. But its cute that they're pretty dog friendly, they got doggy bowls out for the patrons with their pups outside.
author: Wendy X.

description: Max rules, if I need to say more you just don't know. If you don't know Max, you better go find out. If you don't like coffee though, please don't ruin this place for me
author: Tom H.

description:
This place rocks!!  It's a perfect cafe in the area.  I've been here on beautiful SF days to sit outside and enjoy an iced tea and sandwich, and on gloomy cloudy rainy days to sit inside w/ a nice hot cup of tea and ham and cheese croissant.  I've killed time doing computer work by utilizing their free WiFi, or just sitting around talking.

They have a huge selection of drinks and food, so you are more than likely to find something you want...including alcohol (beer and wine only).  They have one bathroom and the counter seating is pretty chill also.

Definitely returning when it's convenient for me...maybe next time it'll be for food and drinks to go for a visit to the beach.
author: Ninja H.

description:
Update May 15th - We decided to give Java another try after the owner reached out and apologized from my first review. 

The good news is that I haven't had to wait for 40 minutes again. It's still busy so it feels like they might be getting faster which is great. So I raised the review up. 

I'll update again in a couple of months. Java is right near my house so it would be good if they were a great cafe to visit on weekends. 

-----
Food is ok but don't come here on a weekend. It took them 40 minutes to make a BLT sandwich even though the cafe was half empty. 

Sometimes the line is out the door which means an hour wait for basic food. Don't make a trip unless you have a book to read during the crazy wait times! 

Head to another cafe instead.
author: Chris D.

description: Good location.  Always crowded.  But the food isn't good.  I've tried this place 3 times and today is my last.  Too long a wait.  We were told it'd be 15 minutes, and we figured it'd be a while, but it turned into 45 minutes for food.  I had the Mexican salad which wasn't good.  It was suppose to come w/ tortilla strips instead it was crunched up doritos?!  My friend had the BLT.  Disappointing.  On a good note, I think this place is good for coffee / muffins.
author: Janet C.

description: Free wi-fi, parking + ice tea on a hot day ftw
author: Tiff W.

description:
Service: 3/5
Food: 4/5
Wait: 2.5/5
Price: $$
Presentation of food: 4/5
Presentation of restaurant: 4/5
Overall: 4/5

Had their Turkey Pesto on Dutch Crunch. yummm
author: Eva H.

description:
I walk here at least once a week - haven't eaten anything yet, but the chilled cafe is delectable. 

Great place to hang on a sunny day, before or after your way to the beach.

Real laid back, smooth sailing, easy skanky type of spot.

Yadig
author: Phil H.

description:
+Great place by the beach / zoo
+Outdoor seating and also plenty of indoor seating
+Soft Serve ice cream

I came here with my bf and his friend during Sunday Streets on the Great Highway. It was fun to ride our bikes along Great Highway free of cars and Java Beach just topped it off for our day. We chose outdoor seating to avoid the risk of having our bikes stolen. I ordered the San Patricio sandwich and the Kelly's Cove, both were $8.50. The San Patricio was a chicken sandwich with honey dijon spread, cheese,avocado, and spring mix greens on ciabatta bread. The Kelly's Cove was a turkey sandwich with pesto, cheese and spring mix. Both sandwiches come with a handful of potato chips. The water dispenser is located by the coffee and napkins. 
Outdoor seating is great for people watching too!
author: Connie C.

description:
Despite some of the reviews I have read this place is sweet... 

I mean come on people STELLA  on tap... get over all your complaints right there...

The food is awesome for a java joint.. wifi is free!  And the staff are cool people with killer attitudes.. they actually enjoy there work.

Oh and its DOG friendly :) little and big dog bowls out front.. outdoor seating and plenty of room for friends to have a pint with ya before you hit the beach.

A+
author: Timber B.

description:
LOVE THIS PLACE! Java Beach by the Zoo is my favorite study spot in SF. The food is great, the coffee drinks are delicious, and when you need a sweet treat they even have swirl ice cream. I love the staff, and the area.

My favorites: Veggie bagel, BBQ Chicken Sandwich, Toast with Nutella, any soup they offer...who am I kidding all the food is great, and I like trying something new when I am in there!

Check it out ASAP!
author: Darcy W.

description:
Uhhhm a beach cafe that has beer on tap?! Yes please! Their food is fresh and light. Some people may say it's pricey but it's really good food and fair portions. Their sandwiches and salads are all good and made to order. My fav is the veggie pesto bagel. It's a great way to start the morning. The fresh vegetables and crisp of the lettuce with their pesto sauce yummmmm OH and the sprouts! I love when any sandwich has sprouts. drool.
I live really close to this spot so it's a great stop on my way to the beach. Just beware of drinking too many beers then stumbling to Aqua Surf Shop and doing some drunken shopping. hehheh a bad habit that happens way too often for me.
author: Janu A.

description:
I love this place, PERFECT for breakfast, lunch, dinner or snack. 

From Pastries to Beer and soft serve...What does this place NOT have.

Great place but there are sometimes interesting characters...Great sandwiches with chips. My favorite is the toasted Pastrami on a French Roll with everything and toasted...Delicious!!!

The coffee is great also! They have a range of Rice Milk, Soy, Almond and the regular Whole, half and half and non fat.
author: Brendan L.

description:
Stopped here today before a trip to the zoo. I got the Classic Veggie sandwich on Dutch crunch, because I wanted something light. I thought the sandwich was delicious, and I like the chips that come with it...but I still don't feel like it was an $8 sandwich. 

Maybe it's just me, but I've always felt that Java Beach (both locations) charge a bit too much for what they're dishing up. $3.25 could get me a chai double the size of their 'small' at Starbucks...which makes me sound like an anti-local-business she-devil, but I'm a student who needs to watch their wallet and I think about value. 

That being said, if you crave a good sandwich and a very satisfying chai tea latte, and don't mind spending a little extra to support your local sandwich and coffee shop, you should definitely hit up Java Beach.
author: Rachel A.

description:
Alternatives...it's nice to have 'em. Sometimes I can be a creature of habit and tend to frequent establishments way too often. Like my local cafe for instance. It has everything I need but sometimes there's a point when you need a break from the regulars and staff.  So this new Java Beach Cafe gives me a great new cafe option since it happens to be on the way home from work.

The outside surf-themed decor is both original and attractive. The interior doesn't quite have the same pizzazz but is still pleasant enough. I can't vouch for any of the food but the beer and coffee I've had have been fine enough. The staff has been friendly and so far, the patrons have been cool too.

My only wish is that they had more comfortable seating inside but that's just a minor qualm. Overall a 4-star joint in my book!
author: Art O.

description:
On a nice sunny warm day in SF, be sure to stop by here and grab your toasted sandwich and head to the beach.  I ordered the turkey on dutch crunch and it was the best toasted turkey sandwich i had.  So crunchy all around.  

There was a short line, it went by pretty quickly.  I didnt enjoy the ice cream as much as it was hyped up by someone.  

Overall, sandwich is very good.  Its a must eat! :)
author: Mimi S.

description:
I reallyyyyyy want to love this place but it's the second time they screwed up my order. I got TWO totally different sandwiches. Maybe they bagged the wrong ones..... I don't know. I assumed it was mine cuz nobody else was waiting and I was waiting for a while already.... Please check your orders before leaving, even if they call your name. These are pricey sandwiches to get mixed up.... The lady before me got her drink messed up as well. 

Anyway, I really love their Bonfire Delight sandwich.. Warm roasted beef with cheddar and some sesame ginger dressing. Too bad I won't be having that today!
author: Allyson L.

description: Great fruit bowl and bagels. Perfect place to chill out after excercise or walk on the beach.
author: Petr K.

description: So many great coffee places in the area... Greeted with a smile and the coffee was fresh!
author: Kimberly R.

description: I was staying at the Days Inn next to this place so I gave it a try. I had a turkey pesto sandwich and a coffee here. The coffee was flavorful and the sandwich was definitely good. This place actually reminded me of a lot of the spots down where I live (Long Beach, CA). I thought the prices were reasonable and the quality of food was good. I did notice the place was a bit crowded and finding seats could be a challenge like some other reviewers said. I ended up sitting in front of the beer taps since I was by myself. I didn't use the wifi so no comment there. But the place had a steady stream of people going to it so I'd take any negative reviews with a grain of salt.
author: Joe R.

description: a-okay food, near the beach, makes for a good spot to have a meal after a long run
author: Long C.

description: Awesome sandwiches. Excellent service. Near the beach.
author: Chris P.

description: Spacious enough, not overly crowded and the turkey pesto sandwich is pretty tasty. The also offer soft-serve ice cream. Now that's a sign of a decent establishment. Clearly a lot of folks come here for the free wifi, but I like the view of the Doggie Diner statue.
author: Farah S.

description:
Don't know why, but for some reason I thought I wouldn't like this place.  Perhaps because of the other location which is quite popular, but for some reason, that one never really did it for me.  Wow, was I wrong!  Had lunch there recently and ordered a hot pastrami on dutch crunch and a diet Coke.  It wasn't the best pastrami I've ever had, but it was still good and the person who made it definitely didn't hold back on the pastrami.  It was way better than I ever expected and it was really filling.  Loved the crunch of the bread...that was awesome!  

I loved the potato chips that came with it (nice and thick dip chips) and the person who helped me was totally cool and charged me for a lesser item since I didn't want all the vegetables and frills.  For me, when I order a hot pastrami, it's all about the meat and the bread.  I heard the same thing happen to another customer, so apparently, this is a common practice there.  Very cool...it makes sense and I was impressed.  Free WiFi too!  Even the guy that brought me my food was really nice...great staff there.  Now I know why this place is so popular.  I will be back!
author: Roy N.

description:
great sandwiches.
great coffee
great place to take your laptop and do work.


I had a Medium tuna salad on dutch crunch. was better than expected. tuna wasnt too dry. bread was really good. 

and they have beer on tap!
author: Erica L.

description:
As I finish soccer practice, I drive around the corner because I need one of two things....beer on tap, or excellent coffee to re-energize. 5 stars for getting the job done, with free wifi, friendly staff, and Guinness on tap as well as great coffee!
:)
author: David N.

description: Very good coffee.  I had a mocha latte - low on sugar, quality chocolate.
author: Vas N.

description:
Java Beach is a local Sunset coffee joint and this is their location near the SF Zoo. Love the place - great atmosphere, friendly service, and overall a comfortable environment to sit and grab some coffee or sandwiches.

I always come here on my way to the SF Zoo, and I advise others going to the zoo to do the same. Definitely beats zoo food. The sandwiches are really good, and they also heat them up if you want it (even the ones that say cold on the board). I've also had the daily soups and most of them are good and hearty. Their fruit/yogurt is a nice generous serving too. 

Can get crowded and filled with kids (just fyi, not a complaint since I bring my 3yo) so be careful with the drinks near laptops. Oh yea for you laptoppers, they have wifi and many outlets.

Lastly, they even serve wine here so you can definitely chill out with friends. If it is not too cold, the outside seats are awesome and you can just relax the day away.
author: Dom L.

description:
I walk to Java beach a lot and what people are saying about seating is true, there are a lot of seats provided for this small cafe but they are usually all taken. 
I love their Nutella Bagel and they have soft serve which the other java beach does not. 
They can take awhile serving larger items like Sandwiches or salads but they do taste really good! Especially on Dutch Crunch. 
Its a good place to come and study or read and they do provide fast wifi. 
Lots of parking is available, and on nice days its just a couple blocks down from the beach and the zoo entrance.  
The staff is pretty nice and don't act like they are annoyed with you even when people are there until closing which I think is at 11pm (open late which is a plus).
author: Kelsey W.
