description: I can't give a complete review of this place yet. I went here today, and I really wanted to try a sandwich, some coffee and sit down for a few hours while I job hunt. However, arriving at 1130am it was packed already. All the tables were taken with laptops. It didn't seem like anyone was going to leave any time soon, so I didn't bother to wait. It seemed quite popular, and the fact that it serves beer on tap is a plus. Another time, when it's not so crowded.
author: Vanessa K.

description: I like the environment, small coffee shop/sandwich place, but it was small. the seating was limited, but otherwise everything else was pretty good! The sandwich I purchased was called the kelly's cove. haha very cute name and it was a pretty meaty good sandwich, i would come back!
author: Joanne C.

description: Absolutely love this place! Best chicken ceaser salad and great vanilla latte... They even serve a limited variety of beer! Service is great so far. Only thing is it's kind cramped in there especially on a sunny day!
author: Candace N.

description: I have been back a couple of times because I don't like writing bad reveiws and wanted to change this one. The girl who was rude to me still works there but I think she had a bad day last time I wrote a review. They let me order my latte in a large cup which it seems everyone in town is trying to stop me from doing. The M&M cookies are pretty good now as well.
author: Keyser S.

description: Great atmosphere. Great food. Great coffee. What more is there to ask for? Java Beach never fails impress. I'm not a big fan of sandwiches, last Sunday my bf and I were trying to decide what to have for lunch. He looks me with a hesitant express and ask Java Beach? He was worried I wouldn't want to go since they mostly serve sandwiches. By his surprise I agreed to go. We decide to try the one by the zoo guessing that it would be less crowded. They were busy however not super crowded like the one near the beach. We went with our favorite, the pumpkin spice latte (haven't found a place that makes it better), soup of the day a red pepper chowder, and a San Patricio. All delicious. All down side was the sandwich was a bit messy to eat.
author: Jennifer H.

description: Their unsweetened chai (they carry Bay Chai--thank you!!) is my favorite part of taking my little one to the Zoo on free day. It's a warm airy cafe with a good bathroom and staff that don't freak out when Mr. Jumping Bean wants to see what's going on behind the counter or rearrange their sugar station.
author: Gretchen T.

description:
This place's food is great. And their hot chocolate was amazing. 

I recommend their cheese croissant, although the sandwiches my friends ordered looked very, very appetizing as well. They also give chips with their sandwiches, which is appreciated.
author: Samantha M.

description: I normally come here after a nice jog around Lake Merced. It's close by and parking is fairly easy. It's a great spot to enjoy a healthy lunch and some sun. They have great salads and sandwiches! My favorites being the Garden Salad and the San Patricio sandwich. There are many other items available here such as bagels, soups, pastries, and even wine and beer. Prices are reasonable for what you're getting. The salad portions are huge! I don't know why I haven't tried the coffee yet, but I soon will.
author: Lauren D.

description: So after having a bad experience i decided to give this place a try again. My sandwich was much more filling and up to par than before, and the staff was much more friendly. Four stars for convenience, and for management caring about their customer's experience.
author: Brandy B.

description: This place is beautiful! Bonfire delight is one of my favorite sandwich. Me and my friend usually hangout at java beach after a run by the beach which is few blocks from this place. This is one of my favorite place to go on weekends !!! I love java beach and I recommend it to everyone who haven't been here:)
author: Loraine C.

description:
This is my favorite coffee shop in Cali.  The coffee and food are superb, and it's got a quaint neighborhood feel to it.  I ordered the steel cut oarmeal for bfast, it was delicious and the presentation was nice (came with raisins and brown sugar + flax).  Like I said the coffee is superb.  I also got a veggie bagel here once, I just love how everything is very wholesome and healthy (it came with hummus spread instead of fatty cream cheese, right on!), yet it still tasted awesome.

I could bring my laptop and sit here all day, or just people watch sans-laptop.  Always a default pit stop for me when in SF, great place to stop by before surfing to pick up a hot coffee and snack!
author: Jo G.

description: Food was excellent, I had a Tsunami sub and a coffee.  The service was a little slow because they were busy, but it was worth waiting for and I had nowhere to go that day anyway.  Highly recommended if you are in the area.
author: Hugh K.

description:
This place was my fuel up right after the *free admission* day at the Exploratorium and before we *attempted* to attack the SF Zoo. 

I got myself a nice warm bagel, and the rest of the fam got sandwiches *gosh darn giving up meat for Lent!!*

The coffee was also very nice! =)
author: Jackie F.

description: Nice place to stop for something quick to eat or a cup of coffee. My dogs like this place too.
author: James M.

description: First of all, thank God for the WiFi here. For an area like Outer Sunset, especially if you don't live there, WiFi is rare, so thank you! Now to the food-- the roast beef looked more like ham. The pies were average. The raisin cookie was good though. As a local cafe, this one is definitely my favorite. Java Beach at the Zoo closes pretty late for a cafe.
author: Eric L.

description:
Bright and clean with a good little selection of sandwiches and salads. Wine, beer, coffee, soft serve ice cream. A good spot near the zoo and the beach at the end of Sloat.

I ordered the tsunami to go - ham, mortadella, salami, cheese served on French bread and heated. It had lettuce, tomato, mustard and a little special sauce (italian dressing essentially). It was quite delish actually. I ate it in the parking lot at Ft. Funston before taking the hound for a walk.
author: Sam P.

description:
Lunch before beach? Ice cream after beach? Beach irrelevant, just need a cold beer? Plenty of reasons to stop by if you're out in the sunset. 

I had the Popeye Special, it was a spinach salad with candied walnuts, feta, tomatoes, red onions and a raspberry vinaigrette, and it was to die for! Fresh, crunchy ingredients, really thick dressing, piece of bread on the side, generous portion. Next time I go back I think I have to get the same thing. 

They've got 5 beers on tap, as well as soft serve ice cream and plenty of coffee drinks and pastries. Walking distance to the beach and zoo!
author: Alyssa G.

description:
I love this place. I've been coming here since it opened and will be coming here for years to come. It is a great place to take kids before the zoo. I love that they have more the one alternative to milk, but my favorite has to be the almond milk. 
I love the staff here, for the most part it's the same which tells me that their good to their staff. The staff is always happy to answer any of our questions and love talking about their coffee. You have to try the pour over, nothing like it. I know that lots of people say blue bottle is the best coffee in the city but I think Java Beach is where its at! 
Got to try the sandwiches, no matter which you get it's all made to order and so good!!

Soft serve ice cream, that's all there is to say about that!

Again love this place!
author: Helen L.

description:
My boyfriend and I go her religiously it's convenient and great food for breakfast lunch or even dinner. My favorite are their mocha's and fruit and granola bowl with honey yummy! Kelly's Cove is a super tasty sandwich fresh Turkey and pesto! 

My only qualm is that there are tons of people that take up all the seating and don't buy anything just utilizing the wifi. This always takes up the space from paying customers with no where to sit. Other then that this place is a must staff is always friendly and sweet at well !
author: Jackie P.

description:
After a frigid surf out at Ocean Beach there's nowhere better to warm up! I start thinking about the BBQ chicken sandwich even before my last wave! Five stars because I like the Irish folks that run this place and they have draft beer, free wifi, and strong coffee on drip! 

No frills or anything but you'll find yourself wanting to go back. I stop in for a Scone and a quad latte before surfing and a sandwich and beer after. You should do the same.
author: Lee S.

description: I love coming here! All the food is fresh and delicious, and I've had the best latte of my life here! The staff is always smiling and friendly and it's such a great atmosphere and a great vibe.  It's also nice to have a glass of wine or a beer, and I love the soft serve ice cream!
author: Victoria T.

description: I use to live right down the street from here and it was convenient when a rare java craving came on. Their sandwiches are great and on a sunny day it's not a bad spot to rest your hat and overlook the ocean.
author: M R.

description:
Free wifi-, and outlets are available.

The downside is that it's pretty small, and for some reason doesn't feel all that cozy to hang out in.  They blasted the oldies the entire time I was there, which for some folks might be nice, but I quickly got tired of it :P
author: Corey C.

description: Love the coffee, love the friendly staff, delicious bfast fare (hello veggie bagel!), and sandwiches. Great for kids too!
author: Ce Ce M.

description: I frequent here whenever I've had a seriously long day and it's nice outside. Being at school from 9-5 takes a toll and the guys at Java Beach really know how to take the edge off when you need some time to unwind. Their coffee is great and you can enjoy it sitting on their outside tables looking at the great view they have to offer. Honestly, what more could you ask for on a beautiful day than some nice R&R. I definitely recommend you guys try it and you won't consider any other place! Definitely one of my favorite spots!
author: Michael N.

description:
This place has taken on a sentimental association for me.  I go here with my closest friends for our coffee breaks and study dates, as it's one of the more convenient, local spots.  When the bf is in town, this is where we always go for two medium sweet Chai lattes, although the last time we decided to just go with the spiced, unsweetened version and found ourselves missing the sugar, haha.  Service is always efficient, pleasant and polite.  

To get to other aspects of this awesome establishment, decor is bright and airy thanks to the ginormous windows facing the zoo, lots of tables, chairs and outlets for laptops; however it can get pretty hustle and bustle quickly.  Wifi, solid..

..But I prefer talking about my sentimental associations!  The location lends itself to lots of little kid encounters (zoo, elementary schools within walking distance) so the atmosphere is quite cheery and family-oriented.  One particularly sunny day, I look up from my laptop (with smooth wifi, did I mention?) and catch this 3 year old cutie making eyes at me.  His dad tried to school him on tips to win over the ladies as they ate their sandwiches ("Subtlety, dude!") but to no avail.  This kid knows what he likes.  Food and drink from Java Beach and innocent flirtations, just like me :)
author: Jaclyn L.

description: love this place. The staff is always so nice and friendly even on crazy busy days. I live two blocks away, so whenever I forgot to go grocery shopping this is my go-to place. Their salads are delicious (Stacie's mexican salad w/Doritos.....wut). I'm a vegetarian, so I don't get sandwiches. The veggie sandwiches are a bit too cheesy for me, but that doesn't mean they are bad I just don't mix too well with large quantities of cheese. However, the bf gets the BLT every time and loves it. I always go for the Pesto Veggie bagel. SO good. Idk what they do to that pesto cream cheese but it is amazing. The other thing I'm in love with is their greek yogurt, fruit, and granola bowl.. I'm not a big fan of getting light granola bowls for breakfast(I love bread and eggs) but this is huge, and amazing!! So filling, and absolutely the best case scenario of opting out of the bagels for something healthier. Last but not least, their coffee is awesome. The bf and I have a perfect concoction: 3/4s Colombian, and 1/4 Hazelnut. Always perfect.
author: Bat V.

description:
I'm so lucky to be able to roll out of bed and right into Java beach. Everything I"ve had so far has been great. Tea, coffee, soft serve, sandwiches, bagels, salads, wine, beer, sangria, I think I've had it all. Free strong wireless internet and very friendly staff. 

My favorites: Ice Tea, and I like that the coffee is free trade and organic. Once I had this coffee Starbucks tastes like garbage. Also the Tsunmai and veggie melt Sandwich.
author: Roxanne W.

description: Great coffee!!!  Yes, better than Blue Bottle.  Love Bernie's blend!  Sandwiches are fantastic and hearty.
author: Vespa V.

description: The cutest little coffee shop/ bar/ cafe ever! The food is casual but delicious and the coffee is amazing. The ladies working knew all of their regulars and were incredibly friendly and quick. Neighborhood gem!
author: Jessica F.

description:
This place says beach café all over it. The outside is painted with the beach colors of blue, yellow and white and the Java Beach sign is shaped like a surfboard.

This place has great, friendly service. A peppy young girl took my order of a vegetarian bagel, green tea and an apple muffin. It's a big order but after you surf pretty hard, this is the place to be. When I got my sandwich, the onion bagel had been toasted to perfection and had the right amount of cream cheese. It also had lettuce, onion and tomato, tasty. The apple muffin was to scream about, seriously what did they put in that thing? It was amazing. The green tea was also good.

I like this place because it has healthy food at a reasonable price, the décor is inviting and it has indoor and outdoor seating. The best part is that it's close to the beach and the zoo (you'll see a ton of families here, most of the kids ordering ice cream of course). I recommend this place to beach goers, zoo fanatics, and anyone wanting to eat some good food.
author: Brent R.

description: Just remembered to update this. The owner contacted me and apologized for the experience that day, I guess they were a couple people short. I'll be going back.
author: Andres A.

description: Just as good as the Ocean Beach venue and just as likely to have a line out the door. However the weekday A.M. I dropped in there wuz not a nan nutter person except the cashier. I can't wait to take my favorite family members down here to try simply the best hazelnut coffee I've ever sipped in my life.
author: R J.

description: We stopped here for lunch before the zoo. Great sandwich. Prices were decent. Can be hard to get a table.
author: Barbara G.

description:
Another chill spot with free Wifi!! AWESOME! It's my first time having a Yerba Matte, it tastes like Horchata. Mmmm!!

I was introduced to this place yesterday when Mocha 101 closed early and we needed a place to discuss Las Vegas hotel logistics. 

Free Wifi: star
Great costumer service: star (I didn't know what a matte was and they were able to explain that it's like a Chai tea, but more bitter, then I was sold).
Ample seating (well on a Saturday afternoon when the weather just chilly and windy to the point  people wouldn't be wanting to go out): star
consistent late hours until 11pm (altought we didn't stay until closing, but knowing they do is great): star

oh, they also have beer on tap. WTF? ORRRRR FTW?!?!
author: Cipriano G.

description:
I love this place they have two locations and we like them both .
Nice to have a nice coffee shop to hang out at .
onagh is great she is good at her job ,she does not miss a beat ,she goes out of her way to make sure you are happy and everything is to your liking,one of the reasons we keep going back .
love there dutch crunch sandwiches and love there soft serve ice cream reminds me of home ,it is just yummy.
the one in sloat is handy for us, as we take our dog to stern grove dog park and then we hit java beach so dog is happy and we are happy,so if you havent been there check it out ,it is a nice place to hang out and meet friendly people from the neighbourhoor,cant beat that.
author: Paula C.

description:
I absolutely love this place. LOVE THE VEGGIE HUMMUS BAGEL & THE WHERLING DEVISH SANDWICH. everything is awesome here. good lattes. Good looking & friendly staff. love love love.

also parking is plentiful, wifi is awesome here, andddd they have soft serve ice cream.
author: monique D.

description: great warm sandwiches , soup and cold brew, shakes look amazing will try that next time as i will go back again for sure
author: John S.

description: This was fab find in the Ocean Beach area. Across from the zoo so if you are there this is convienient and yum-o. This wasn't a touristy place but instead one that had a steady stream of locals throughout the time we were there. (A place with people during slow times has something going on!) Though we were there between traditional lunch time and dinner time, the offerings were the same. Items such as salads, sandwiches, coffees, soft serve ice cream, beer, wine and other eats. The place is small but organized efficiently. You enter through one door. Prepare to order, order and then sit at a small bar area, outside or the dining area seating. Once done drop off flatware, plates and recycleables in one bin and trash in another. This is a clean up after yourself kind of place. Wooden furniture inside makes it feel rustic and casual. Now on on the food. The portions are spot on and the food is presented well. The taste of the sandwiches was delectable. The condiments amp up the fresh ingredients. We tried the Caesar salad which was delicious and fresh. Perfect tasty dressing and not too much of it. The sandwiches we picked were unique to them. The had roast beef, cheese melted on Dutch crunch. The veggie sandwich had sprouts, tomatoes, red onions, lettuce, cheese, all seemingly farm fresh. The bread was soft and with chewy crusts. The coffee was so completely sensational. They don't let you know about the beans totally(read the sign) because if you knew you would buy them from wherever and make coffee daily at home. Instead you will be drawn back to get another drink. That drink has a little leaf design made out of the foam. Required? No. Fun? Yes! A really cool local joint to come as you are!
author: H D.

description:
I love this place!!  One of my greatest draws is that it isn't as crowded as the other Java Beach.  The staff all remember my name and I love going early in the morning to catch a table by the windows so I can read as the sun streams in.  It's not particularly picturesque, but it is so awesome to finish a large coffee and croissant with nutella (my personal favorite) just before heading on a walk to the beach, which is only 2 blocks away.  Unless it's a free day at the Zoo, or a particularly busy family weekend, there's always a plethora of parking too, so it pleases on all fronts.  I hear they serve beer and wine all day and the sandwiches are quite decently sized.  All around, one of my favorite coffee shops in the city.
Oh, and also a great place to check out attractive guys on their way to work or just back from surfing at Ocean Beach...:-)
author: Colby J.

description:
Besides the amazing coffee and the GREAT service (All The Staff), 
THE MUSIC IS PATHETIC !!!  It's a coffee house, not a motel lounge or an elevator. Please change it ... Give the staff some musical motivation. Let us want to hang out!  Music effects people more than you know !
"Music is the one incorporeal entrance into the higher world of knowledge which comprehends mankind but which mankind cannot comprehend."  
Beethoven       ( unless you're at the Java Beach Coffee Shop )
author: Rollo T.

description: Very good coffee. You can taste all the different flavors - fresh. Way better then Starbucks and Peets. The pastry are large and there is a good variety to choose from.
author: Roy G.

description: Food is good.  Coffee is good.  These two factors alone would warrant 3-4 stars.  BUT my main gripe is the service, in particular, the sandwich-maker, Dalia--young brunette girl with round face who is a serious liability to this place.  After waiting in a line that went down the block, I finally made it to the cashier and placed my order: Hummus Veggie Bagel and a large coffee.  When I finally got my order, it consisted only of hummus spread on a whole wheat bagel.  Hmmm, I found that odd and went back to read the description of the bagel on the chalkboard menu--yup, there should have been some sprouts, lettuce, tomatoe, etc.  When I asked Dalia (remember her?  round faced tall-ish brunette) why there weren't any veggies on my bagel, she proceeded to accuse me that I did not order any veggies.  Well, I guess i MUST BE a simpleton if I assumed the Hummus VEGGIE bagel came with veggies!  Should I have also specified, Dalia, that I would like some HUMMUS, as well?  How about I mix things up and order my Hummus Veggie Bagel ON A BAGEL???  I stood there a bit shell shocked, waiting for her to apologetically take my bagel and restore some normalcy to this whole situation...instead, she snapped at me and literally USED HER INDEX FINGER and pointed at me and then the line and told me to get back in-line to tell the cashier that I wanted veggies.  Well, considering the line at that point consists of 5+ ppl...how about NO FREAKING WAY, DALIA???  How about you learn the meaning of customer service, take back my bagel, and add some sprouts with a flick of your wrist  rather than continue to waste my time????   This girl's audacity was incredible.  I have never met anyone in the service industry with such a huge chip on their shoulder.  I had to take down her name because I was floored!  I'm from NYC--ppl are always giving an I-don't-give-a-fuck-about-you kind of vibe, but even this was nothing compared to what I'm used to back at home.  It felt like she was actively trying to humiliate me with all the finger pointing like I was some child needing rehabilitation for my misguided food-ordering ways.  If you're getting the slightest hint from this review that I'm a sensitive whiney person, I can only offer up that there was another patron  who witnessed this whole debacle and spoke to me in the back area about how inappropriate Dalia was.  I couldn't agree more.  Hey Dalia--GET A NEW JOB....preferably one that doesn't require interaction with people.  Maybe the Zoo across the street is hiring.
author: Aimee C.

description:
I had a tuna melt from here after visiting the SF zoo with friends. It was absolutely delicious. My friends ordered some other sandwiches that were also really tasty. The chips it came with were also pretty good. We also came in the morning for some coffee, and it wasn't crowded. Nice and quiet.

When we came later for lunch after the zoo, there were no seats left inside since families were coming out from the zoo also. We had to sit outside in the wind and cold (since it's down the street from the beach). Still a great dining experience.
author: Thao T.

description:
Having one of my favorite coffee spots be cloned is simply awesome! This is perfect as it's a bit more spacious then the one on Judah but none the less, everything is the same. Great coffee, pastries and a place to sit and enjoy the view... as well as the sounds from the zoo!

I recommend the Hazelnut Blended Mocha with their vegan banana walnut chocolate chip cookie... yummy!
author: Ms. Hala A.

description: Cool location. Chill vibe. Very good coffee. Slow brew coffee and white cap recommended.
author: Micah M.

description:
Great neighborhood place. So happy there's a place where I can get a beer and my kids can get a hot chocolate after a long day at the zoo. Also nice to have decent coffee in the neighborhood, as Sea Biscuit is a little too far to walk when I need coffee (Shout out to Sea Biscuit, too. I like you but you're too far away from my house to walk). Yummy soft serve.
I have two complaints 
#1 (admittedly my own personal tick) I don't like lettuce and mayo on hot sandwiches. it's gross, but it's standard there.
#2 (which is the one thing that prevented me from adding one more star) The place gets too busy for the staff to handle apropriately and food comes out inconsistently. Some plates have chips, some don't. Wrong bread, wrong condiments, etc. Oh, and the menu on the chalk board is too confusing to read quickly.
author: Andrea L.

description:
I live in the hood, so this is my spot! They have lots of outlets for free WI-FI, a changing table in the bathroom for the diapered ones and a ton of ceiling fan's witch my son finds highly entertaining and leaves me time to surf the net! I love the hours they open @ 6am and close @ 11pm on most if not all nights (Sun. maybe 10) they have beer & wine, always a plus in my book! The weather is really nice alot of the time so the outdoor seating fills up fast but you can usually finagle a spot if your crafty. I love the hot veggie sub, salads are great, now they are featuring Root Beer floats. 
They always have fresh fruit and it's consistently fresh. I go there a few times a week, they are fast friendly and did I mention they have beer & wine :)
author: Courtney D.

description:
Located conveniently across from the SF Zoo on the corner of 43rd and Sloat.  They offer free Wi-Fi and a variety of salads and sandwhiches to choose from with vegetarian options available.

My friend and I shared a medium vegetarian sandwhich...it consisted of pesto, tomato, and mozerella.  It also came with a side of chips.  Sandwhiches come in small, medium, and large.  Portions are very large, so I'd recommend going with the small sandwhich, unless you are starving.  We also tried the vegan banana walnut cookie, and tasty, but it broke apart easily.
author: Patty O.

description: Very convenient location, free wi-fi, great coffee and food! A little small for the amount of people who frequent it, but I'd say it's a testament to its popularity.
author: Seth R.

description:
i love this place for two reasons: (1) the food and coffee are great and (2) it's where a good friend of mine and i meet up for lunch to catch up and laugh at life's ironies...usually our own...

this last visit i had:
+ stacy's mexican salad
+ spinach and feta peasant pie
+ iced hazelnut latte
+ lemon bar
+ jasmine tea

the salads are huge with fresh greens and just the right amount of dressing tossed in, and comes with a bread roll. the spinach feta peasant pie was good but a bit more dough than i expected. i was thinking of phyllo like a spanakopita. however, still quite yummy.  the iced hazelnut latte was spot on. the lemon bar wasn't too sweet or zesty, which is how i like my lemon bars.

are you getting the picture? the food is really good. next time i'll try a brew. yup. they have a small bar and beer on tap. we were there for about 5 hours from lunch time to late afternoon. what? we had a lot to talk about. college kids, parents and their young kids came through. quite a few set up shop with their laptops due to their free wifi. i love the bench seating along the walls. wish they had cushions and pillows, but that could get messy especially with the kiddies. oh. did i mention they also have soft serve ice cream? so with all this good stuff, java beach cafe is quite popular and can get crowded quickly but it's worth it.
author: Claudine D.

description:
If it weren't for Java Beach I'd probably starve some days. Aside from the awesome food, the staff is friendly, smiling, helpful and super cute :)

BTW, go for the granola/yogurt/fresh fruit bowl - totally worth the $6.50... I'm fairly addicted. And their hot subs are so delicious if I didn't have self-restraint I'd be 200 lbs heavier than I am now. 

Coffee's pretty good too.
author: Jaimee C.

description:
Java Beach clone is just as good as the original!  Great location and nice surfer feel to the new coffee shop decorum.  Super clean, friendly, great sandwiches and bagels, and a good place to chill with locals.

Magners = Yum!
Yerba matte latte on ice = Yum Yum!
author: Vicky B.

description: When my mom came out the San Francisco for a visit, we stopped into Java Beach almost every morning for the great coffee, ham and cheese breakfast sandwiches and views of the Pacific. It's stands alone as the elite cafe in the Outer Sunset. Honestly, I would come here over any other cafe in the Sunset. And they have Lagunitas on tap for the mornings that you don't want coffee. True awesomeness.
author: Matt K.

description:
Someone said something about blatant over-charging. I agree.. 

I had their lattes in the house mugs few times and always felt like I can't believe I already finished my coffee.. kinda small mug for medium latte. ok, maybe I should just order to-go cup. those cups are pretty standard. well, today they made me MEDIUM latte in to-go cup.. and long and behold it's in freaking REGULAR 12oz paper cup.. WTF?! Medium is 16oz.. at Peets, Starbucks, everywhere else.. 

and so for your average 12oz of Java Beach you pay 3.75$ as for 16oz latte elsewhere. it's upsetting because it's so hidden.. Some will say so what? they have a great location.. they do.. but as far as ambiance - ALWAYS crowded, staff is hit and miss. The other day one of them yelled out loud that we all should huddle over our tables to make room for new customers. Overall, meh..
author: Latte A.

description:
I've only come in to grab a quick cup of coffee or indulge in a mocha, but when a friend of mine stayed for the weekend from Sacramento - we wanted to grab some lunch after a night out in SF. 

I was not up for a drive around the city, so I suggested Java Beach since it's a few blocks away. It was my first time trying the food - we ordered small Tsunami sandwiches and they definitely hit the spot. They don't skimp on the meat and I love sandwich juice. The chips were my favorite kind - super crunchy and thick. 

I hope to try more of the menu soon!
author: Maria B.

description:
ate only one thing here...

my own build-a-sandwich .. worthy of a review
*came out to $8.50

*sliced sourdough bread (didn't lose any teeth, freaking fresh as hell)
*avocado (non- franken-food, very buttery, appeased my feel good genes)
*provolone cheese (taste like cheese Mmmmmm not overwhelming)
*red onion (thinly sliced, not too strong)
*lettuce (it was actually green, not that low budget ice burg crap)
*tomato (red, not pink)
*sprinkled black pepper
*mayo and mustard
*roast beef (tender not chewy, won't cause your whole sandwich to fall apart...boy does that suck balls)  I'm a smaller type girl so I asked for half the amount  (normally they put about 8 thin slices)

*warning: if you like those artery clogging saturated dripping in heart attack sandwiches (shitload of mayo, oils, fatty meats, butter spread, fatty cheeses)... this is not your place... 

they give more of a natural well balanced pre -industrial- right -sized sandwich (capitalism tends to make this sandwich look like it's a rip off... but it's not for me..)

service was excellent!

*CLICK  link below for salad, sandwich, and extras MENU
http://www.javabeachcafe.com/pdf/JavaBeachCafe_Sandwich_Salad_Extra_Menu.pdf

*CLICK link below for breakfast menu
http://www.javabeachcafe.com/pdf/JavaBeachCafe_Breakfast_Menu.pdf
author: Katherine F.

description:
NOT open until 11...now closes at 8 (yes that's EIGHT) PM. make me so sad. Now I have to either fight/wait it out at Westlake or drive all the way up to the other Java Beach...


although every failed attempt of mine to go study at night, ends with a failure (they say they reaally reaaaally DO close at 8) they're always super nice about it
author: Amy L.

description:
OK, maybe I am a little biased because we used to live right by this place but this is one of my most fav places to go eat or just hang out, and by far one of the best things that happened to my neighborhood. 

The coffee is not my favorite but that's not really what I come here for. They have awesome sandwiches, great salads, only had the soup once but it was good as well. They have beer on tap, wine by the glass, frozen yogurt and sometimes sangria. I just wish there was more seating and the people behind the counter were a little nicer.
author: Yulia K.

description:
Okay I'm so moded, I thought this was Ocean Beach Cafe but it's really Java Beach Cafe...oops!

Stopped here with the bf for lunch and it was pretty darn good, they have a breakfast and lunch menu.

I ordered a small Tsunami on dutch crunch, it had mortadella, salami & melted jack cheese - it was the perfect size and was hella good! Came with a side of chips..

Employees are friendly and the place is clean, you can SEE them making your sandwich...

Seating outside is available and it's right across the street from the zoo!
author: Jade B.

description:
As I sit here on a sunny Sunday morning enjoying my weekend ritual of a large Caramel Latte (2 shots) and an everything-bagel with cream cheese and a couple slices of tomato (Go Team Jami!), I realized I haven't yet reviewed my new local spot.

Out on the Sloat side of the Sunset, there are no options for a good cup of coffee or a salad, which used to kill me until Java Beach got smart and opened one up on our side of town.

Now the bf and I skate the 5 blocks down on our longboards for anything from breakfast to happy hour.  Things can be hit or miss... like today my latte is a bit weak, not very caramel-ly, and on the lukewarm side.  But the bagel is solid, so I'm good.  The vibe at the Sloat location is good too... not as bustling as Judah and the clientele isn't as random.  

So, overall, a mostly 4 star experience but an extra star for convenience.
author: Tara G.

description: I come here when I can solely for the coffee. Their dark french roast is like crack! So addicting and strong....love it! If I'm famished in the morning, one my favorite is their ham or turkey croissant with cheese. Croissants are fresh and flaky after toasting and goes great with the french roast. Their oatmeal with banana is also delish as well. They also serve wine and beer here, which I'll sip on on a sunny Sunday afternoon as I sit with a good read or my laptop.
author: Lisa B.

description:
Love Java Beach. 
They have amazing food (sometimes they even have gluten free cookies!!) coffee, and have a small bar for beer, mimosas, etc.
The staff is always friendly, even though they are usually under fast paced and stressful conditions. It can get pretty crowded in there, and the line will be out the door if there are more than 4-5 (roughly) customers waiting to order. 
That being said, I'm pretty sure the reason Java Beach often gets crowded during peak hours is because it is a small establishment, but easily attracts return customers. The facts that they provide free wifi, and are just a stones throw away from Ocean Beach and the SF zoo are also likely contributors.
Java Beach is awesome, and I stop there regularly for coffee on the go...but unless you're lucky enough to go during a lull, finding seating to dine-in may be difficult. 
If it's a dine-in experience you're looking for, I suggest checking out one of Java Beach's other nearby locations- such as the one on Noriega, which is much bigger and has much more seating.
author: Gina M.

description: I spend a LOT of time here.  The building alone has made a great improvement in the neighborhood - from an area of blight and nothingness to a more lively and lovely place.  I love the aesthetics, particularly at night - and the outdoor seating is a nice touch.  My favorite thing in the whole world to get from here is an oatcake.  Though sometimes even the cashier may not know what it is - it is hiding on the bottom shelf behind the newspapers.  It is really like portable oatmeal, slightly sweet with dried fruit.  Their coffee is pretty good, and their sandwiches and salads are super yummy -- they also accept cards for even the smallest of purchases.  You should probably come here since it's basically awesome.  But then I'm biased because I grew up on Java Beach on LaPlaya.  I'm just stoked to have one on my side of town.
author: Ashley S.

description:
Ive been coming to the place for a few weeks now and it is definitely my favorite place to study. I actually drive 15 minutes to get here! Theres free wifi with numerous outlets and decently size tables. Parking here has never been a challenge for me. 

The drink and food offerings are plentiful and not too overpriced. Ive tried most of their salads and sandwiches and nothing has disappointed me yet. (they're a little on the pricey side for a college student budget but well worth it in my opinion) The frozen yogurt, arnold palmers, hazelnut coffee, subs, and popeye salad are among my favorites. Another plus for serving beer and wine. 

The staff is extremely friendly and there is a good mix of people that come there. Im glad theyre open until 11 everynight as well.
author: James T.

description:
One of the few places that DOESN'T fuck up a hot chocolate.

Plus, it's so mind-blowingly quaint that I can never resist it when I'm in the area. A coffee shop with a wine/beer bar near the ocean where I can laugh at out-of-town surfers freeze their chachas off? Yes please.
author: Courtney S.

description:
I really do like this place. So let's do it this way..

Pros: close to home, sandwiches and salads, free wifi, iced white mocha, friendly staff, they close pretty late too.. i think 11?

Cons: I HATE THE STICKY TABLES!!, and it does get kind of packed around finals
author: Eda L.

description:
I've never been to the original, but there are some stand outs for this cafe.  The coolest thing to me is the fact that they do not have a microwave on site.  The pastries that you order may take a few more minutes to heat up, but will be oh so good even oh so much better.  
The place was our breakfast choice for our three day stay in the Sunset.  It was the first few days that they were even open.  
It didn't seem like there were even any wrinkles to iron out.  All the staff were very friendly, and the bagel sandwich selection is enough to bring us back again and again.

The coffee isn't of the BB or Ritual caliber, but the vibe of of this cafe is way nicer than either espresso mecca.
author: Robi P.

description:
My earthlink modem crapped out again.  Thank you Java Beach for having an outlet, a corner table and wireless internet for me. My tea is hot and strong. My sandwich I ordered for lunch was perfect. Toasted sub style with the works. 

The patrons seem pretty cool, laid back, cool moms with their kids, students, surfers, hippies. Of course I can't make my sales calls from here (shake your booty playing in the back round) But I can do all of the marketing research I needs and check my e-mail. Yaaay Ive got mail.

Breakfast, lunch and probably a glass of wine later on.
author: Amanda L.

description:
I came here after a hard dragon boat workout with my team. I ordered the BBQ Chicken Sandwich (bbq chicken smothered in bbq sauce, melted cheese on dutch crunch, are you salivating yet?), chips, ice water, and a vanilla softie. Woo man that totally hit the spot for a Monday night.

Service was good and I inhaled that large sandwich in no time. I usually like to go to places more than once if the place has some good eats. If it doesn't, I'd be telling you about it here with a 1 or 2 star review. 

Definitely a place to go to if you're down with just a salad or a sandwich. The bread comes toasted too. Yum!
author: Jason C. J.

description: Love a turkey cheese sandwich on a croissant here and a nice latter.  4/5 only because seating can be tight.
author: Shamir C.

description:
I've been watching the progess waiting for this location to open. The south end of the great highway was just waiting for something like this to come along. I am a loyal customer of the original on Judah but this location is so much closer. Plus it's withing spitting distance of a doggie diner head, that just makes me happy. I can sit outside and see the doggie diner head watching all who come down Sloat Blvd.
The menu is the same which is awesome. I can get my oatmeal with cranberries and walnuts in the morning. 
It's light, airy and inviting with lots of natural wood, pale lime walls. 
I recognized staff from the other location both in the am and pm. and everyone seemed to be up and running.  I came twice in one day afterall. 
This one will do great with all the people coming from the zoo. 
I will still go to the other one because I just love the cast of characters that I find at the other one, eclectic would be the best description for them. This one too will give birth to it's own eclectic cast in the near future. But now I have somewhere to come if I want to get a beer and tsunami sub.
author: Maria M.

description:
Yummy yummy sandwiches!! This place is in a great spot right off the beach, right across the street from the zoo and there is usually a lot of parking. 
There was one girl who worked there, I wish I remembered her name, but she was such a sweetheart! I am really really indecisive when I find a menu with a lot of things I like (I'm a Taurus but you would think I'm a Gemini) and I get really confused and I need help. Sometimes I get so flustered that I have to tell the person working "I like this and this and this so just make me something because I cant decided" and the girl working at Java made me the best sandwich ever with turkey and pesto and cheese and other stuff and it was wonderful. Thank goodness for that girl because I probably would have gotten too flustered and eaten nothing lol.
author: Tori E.

description: Delicious foods with so many different options! I had a melted veggie cheese sandwich which was amazing and I've tried there coffee and I enjoy it. I love how close it is to the beach, I wish I could eat there more often! Definitely check it out though.
author: Bree G.

description:
This place is awesome! 
Get the pesto veggie bagel cause its delicious & the veggie subs are always bomb. The ambiance is real chill, cute and small but not too small to the point of being cramped. Seems like it's almost always busy, but trust me...definitely better than the one on Judah--friendlier and prompter service. It's near the beach and across from the zoo, how convenient.  

Great spot to just chill and relax for a quick and yummy bite!!
author: Alexa M.

description:
Based on Yelp reviews we decided to check this place out for lunch and I'm glad we did!

We ordered a Barbecue Chicken sandwich and Hot Veggie sandwich...both were small.

The bread and ingredients were fresh and flavorful..the portion was just the right amount and prices were good!

This is a nice local spot with surprisingly good sandwiches.

We will be back!
author: Daddy F.

description: My best guy friend wanted me to meet his new girlfriend for my stamp of approval. He decided to take the both of us to Java Beach for a bite to eat since it was a cozy cafe, making it the perfect spot to loiter even after our meal. The sandwich portions are enormous here and I had a hard time finishing my first half. I like that they have the water filter nearby to serve ourselves as frequently as we want. There are some small booths, but mainly tables. The staffs makes sandwiches quickly and I love that it was toasted and piled with veggies and turkey!
author: Surge C.

description: I had a bagel with cream cheese here today, it was toasted on an "Everything Bagel" it was really good, but way too damn expensive!! Almost $5, crazy!! My bf went in and got it for us, if I knew I would of said, "No, Thank You!" But I wasn't there..so I got to at least try this $5 bagel, and it was a very good bagel, tasted fresh, and the cream cheese was also different...rich, and kind of had a tang to it, I liked it, but I don't think I'd ever go back and pay that price.  My BF told me it was appx $1.50 difference for cream cheese than butter.  Maybe the rent is so high they need to compensate with high prices.  I would go back though, to maybe try something different, I'll update you next time.
author: Charla M.

description: On a sunny day (lol) this place is great for lunch by the beach. Luckily I work nearby and have take advantage of said sunny days (all three of them). Salads, sandwiches, coffees and beers. What else do you need? Oh yes, free wi-fi. They have that too.
author: Heather L.

description: This joint is awesome! The food is great and the service is excellent! Love the choices in coffee that they offer.  The plus is that the coffee is fair trade.
author: Sol P.

description:
Im so happy this place has opened! a coffee shop near ocean beach is long overdue. its a perfect stop on the way to the beach, or zoo.  There is
lovely outdoor seating (if the weather permits), and the inside is charming and welcoming. 

They have a bar with both wine and beer on tap, in addition to a little room in the back with seating and places to plug in laptops. 

There is also a breakfast/ lunch menu...food is pretty good...nothing outta this world. its a good grab and go option for sandwhiches or salads, and they have good healthy (vegetarian options)....

plus, always a good place to see the cute surfer boys (heheheheheheh!!!!!)
author: sarah f.

description: Good sandwiches but no refills on iced tea ($3 and I think they brew it there). Come on! It might seem like a small complaint but I find that to be cheap in the extreme and it really reduces the likelihood that I'll return.
author: Stuart M.

description: I'm not a cheap guy and I do really enjoy the product and love both locations and I will continue to visit both locations.... However, $4 for there largest iced coffee, $5 after my tip (I know the tip is my choice but still),is sorta insane!  I KNOW its cold press and it is very good but $4?  Its not a pint of Sierra...
author: Joseph A.

description: I love the chill vibe at this coffee joint. On a sunny Sunday afternoon when I walked in, everyone in the place looked relaxed with smiles on their faces. I ordered an iced chai latte, which I had been craving, and it sure hit the spot. I also lucked out and scored the last table on the front sidewalk. Sat in the sun and sipped my chai and felt my cares all slip away.
author: Colleen M.

description: Love their breakfast croissants and free wi-fi!
author: Noreen F.

description:
As Christiane C. said, " This is the best thing that has happened on this side of Taraval in a long time." 

yeah.

Thanks to the owner Pat M., another fine product of St. Ignatius College Prep, extending his small business empire. (go cats!)

And yo, SF chamber of commerce, where are you? Are you reading Yelp? we need more neighborhood places on the South side of the 'Set! I hear you got something in the works on the site of Roberts' Motel? Well, shake a leg, baby! This century ain't getting any younger!

Oh, and my favorite part of this new JB, all the light!!! The cafe faces south so that means you get sun all day long (ichi-nichi-ju). Let's just hope no more tigers get loose, yaddimean??
author: Elizabeth F.

description: Honestly, giving this place 3 stars is being generous.  Its your typical coffee house that also sells sandwiches and beer.  The food and drinks are priced noticeably higher.  The internet took 20 minutes to connect to and very slow.  The pastry tasted decent but definitely old.  The ice coffee isn't freshly brewed and I drank a mouthful of coffee grounds in my hot coffee. I don't think that has ever happened to me before.  I would say, however, that their bathroom is very clean.
author: Dean W.

description: Very good food, tea, coffee, and service. Nice place to hang out and read or catch up on internet business. Wifi much appreciated.
author: Mark H.

description:
Ehh, this place is alright. I come here once in a while to study or as a pit stop when I'm on my way to school. The prices here are a pretty penny for basic cafe items. Their cups seem smaller than other places too. A lot of the times when I order the self serve house coffee, multiple coffees are out. What the heck?? A coffee place that is out of coffee? Shouldn't they be on top of these things and brew more... especially with the coffee rush in the morning? Sometimes the sugar, napkin and stirrers are out too. 

As for the actually staying in to enjoy my food/coffee part, not bad. The place is clean and has seats. I study here for a couple hours at a time and it's not bad. I do not feel rushed to finish my drink and leave immediately which is what I like. Although I do make an effort to buy multiple items every so often if  I am planning to stay for a long time. They do take a really long time to prepare sandwiches though.
author: cindy w.

description: This cafe is a great place to get coffee and a sandwich after going to the zoo! It is at a very convenient location, and the place is very cute.
author: Emma L.

description: I love this place! On hot days I get a sandwich and drive down to the beach or sit outside. On cold days, I pick up a hot apple cider and drive down to the beach and sit in my car while I watch the waves. Sandwiches are delicious... good choice of beers. And the staff is a lot happier and friendlier than the other Java Beach.
author: Giovanna C.

description:
I moved to this neighborhood a month ago and have gone here for coffee for the last 4 Saturdays. They have NEVER gotten my order right. Not just the order, the size, number of shots-the works. 

I know nobody is perfect, but the staff is very combative when you point out their ineptitude. I also am repulsed by the man making your drinks in the tight ass, nut hugging jeans that expose 2/3 of his crack. The sandwich making woman spends all her time chatting w/her sister who I'm guessing is mooching free food, rather than preparing yours.

On top of all that, they are always out of lids and act like you're asking them to donate a kidney if you ask for one. Everyone waiting for their drink is crammed in the front like cattle waiting to be slaughtered.

This place SUCKS!!!
author: nic d.

description:
A coffee shop full of charm! The first time that I found this place, I was having a horrible day. Lo and behold in a neighborhood not well known for charming businesses, Java Beach exceeded all of my expectations and made my day oh so much better.
My latte was perfectly crafted, the sugars in the milk coming out in a perfect blend with the espresso, complete with latte art fleur de lys, which proves to some extent any barista's skill.
The sandwiches are made fresh, and they have five beers on tap!! Besides the above mentioned well made latte, they also know how to correctly pour their Guinness, thank you, thank you. The shop is impeccably clean, and the staff is always very friendly. It's also within sight of Ocean Beach.
I wish I lived in the neighborhood, because I would definitely be here much more often. Thank you Java Beach for being the clean, more than competent, friendly, awesome coffee/bar that you are. Duly appreciated!
author: David H.

description:
Was a volunteer at the San Francisco Zoo for years, and was always saddened by the fact that I could never find good food in the area. The sandwiches at George's Zoo were always raved about by my co-workers, but it didn't have any "Wow" factor for me. Then... the Java Beach Cafe opened. The first time I saw it, I had to stop and blink. After all, it's a very bright blue. How could I not have seen it before? And I have to admit, the choice in paint job made me think twice before stepping inside.

I walked in with a friend the first time. I noted the polite service and nice variety on the menu. I ordered the basic vegetarian sandwich, on a french roll with no cheese --- avocado instead (because I don't do animal products). And for a beverage, I got a large soy hot chocolate with strawberry syrup (they will do this upon request). Once I got the food, all I can say is WOW. Tastes great, comes with chips, and is reasonably priced... Does it get any better?

I've gone back several times. In fact, the last few times I've been in the Outer Sunset is because of this place, despite the fact that it takes me an hour of public transportation to get there. Needless to say, nobody I have ever taken with me has thought badly of the food either.
author: Alaka F.

description: Good ambiance.  Coffee is strong (and big). Bring your laptop if not a date.  If it's a sunny day in the sunset and you're feeling like a lazy bum, this is the place to hang out and mooch off their free wifi.
author: Victor C.

description: The staff here is flippin' awesome! It's seriously some of the best customer service I have been around in this city, which is a big reason why I have made this my go to spot. Another reason why I keep coming back is because their granola bowl with honey is AMAZING.. I've tried making my own at home, but it's not even close to how good they make it. You may argue their prices are a little steep, but you get what you pay for.
author: Andre T.

description:
Terrible service! My boyfriend and I went the other week and over half the ticket was wrong.
When we first ordered, we were shuffled between two cashiers. The woman who ended up taking our order was obviously not paying attention. We ordered a tuna melt, a tomato/pesto melt and two root beer floats. After 15 minutes, he finally got his sandwich... but my vegetarian sandwich was rather rung up as a roast beef. The woman who had taken our order just punched it all in wrong. My correct sandwich was then made. (Took another 15 minutes)
 Neither of us had our drinks. Apparently, you're supposed to ask for your root beer float at the time you order it, they don't automatically give it to you. On the ticket, she also rang up a large orange juice instead of the correct drink.
When we asked to talk to the manager, the woman who had taken our orders wrong came over. Yeah.. the manager is that inept at inputting orders.
The java beach north of here is much better. I'm not going to pay over $20 to have 3/4 of my ticket wrong and wait 30 minutes for room-temperature food again.
author: Katie H.

description: Love coming here on a sunny day and snagging a seat on the sidewalk with my dogs. After filling up with a sandwich, I take my coffee to go and walk over to the beach. The food is nothing special, I'm giving the stars for the location and cool neighborhood feel.
author: Ai S.

description:
Great food, excellent coffee, fun atmosphere.
We had some Muddy Water (Americano's) that were solid and some breakfast bakery items. I loved the chocolate croissant (very buttery, compared to $tarbucks or whatever) and my wife had an almond croissant, also very good.
We sat outside on a gloriously sunny weekend morning. We saw lots of kids, families, people walking to the Zoo, surfers coming back from the water. Very relaxing and fun!
author: Christiaan V.

description:
Great coffee shop, with good hours of operation.  The people are very nice, lots of outlets, and free wifi.  I'm a big fan of Justin, always nice, and remembers your name.

One complaint is that the tables and benches are sticky as a result of it being such a popular place for people to go to.  The floors also have lots of crumbs.  A nice rag and "clorox clean up" once a week could fix that right up.
author: Kenneth L.

description:
They don't use a microwave, bonus!  Even though it takes a couple more minutes, its worth it for me.

Friendly service with a smile.
author: Shannon M.

description:
Because I live close by, I come here pretty often.

The location is pretty amazing since it's a couple blocks away from Ocean Beach and a block away from the SF Zoo.

I'm not a big fan anymore.  Weekend afternoons, especially Sunday and the first Wednesday of every month will be crowded.  Parking will be a pain in the a$$.  Parking should be fine every other day and time.  I'm also not a big fan because of the fact that many people park their large trucks right in front of the cafe.  You'll end up inhaling all of the smog that comes from the idle cars on Sloat.  Besides the negative aspects of being at this cafe, I would like to move onto the food.

Being spoiled by the great sandwiches from Ike's place, I thought I might get a mediocre sandwich from Java Beach because it was close by.  I made a mistake... by ordering a toasted turkey sandwich and the crust came out as hard as a rock.  Taking a bite into the sandwich the crust crumbles into your mouth like a dust storm.  I ended up tossing the whole sandwich out.  Besides the sandwich, I believe that most of their food comes from Costco.  (Don't quote me on this.)

I enjoy the fact that they have free Wifi, but there are always people at the cafe with their laptops setup.  You'll probably end up sitting outside.

I like that they have a bar setup with some of my favorite beers on tap.

To recap, you can't go wrong if you order bottled drinks and some of the pastries behind the glass.  Other than that, I would stay away from their sandwiches..

Don't make a special trip here.  It's not worth it!
author: Walter C.

description: Perfect after a trip to the Zoo and before going to the beach down the street. I forgot what my sandwich was called but it had honey dijon mustard and grilled chicken and avocados. It was delicious and boy, was it filling! Their espresso drinks aren't half bad either, especially on a windy day in the bay.
author: Anna T.

description: This laid back little shop is just a hop, skip and a jump away from the SF zoo.  We popped in for a quick bite before a long day of running around.  I ordered a chai and a cheese croissant .  The chai unfortunately came out of a box.  but the croissant was melted to perfection.  My friend ordered a basque pie, which he loved.  The meat pies come from Peasant Pies so I don't think Java Beach can really lay claim to them.  If you are in the area and need a bite go for it, but I wouldn't make a trip out there just for fun.
author: Megan P.

description: I first stopped at the other Java Beach location---but could not find a place to sit. I like the tea selection, although wish they had tea that was not in bleached bags. It is a little loud...but still not a bad place to work.
author: Cameron K.

description: You shouldn't even think about looking for a Starbuck's on Sloat. Look for the big, old Doggy Diner head and pull in for real coffee, served by people who smile while they make it.
author: Leslie M.

description: 5 great beers on tap, good sandwiches and pastries.....my staple is a double shot jumbo depth charge though.
author: Kim K.

description: Love it.  Moved to the neighborhood recently and this is a great find!  I love the veggie pesto bagel and the hazelnut coffee.  mmm good.
author: Kate K.

description: After a "hard" day at the zoo and beach, Java Beach is the perfect ending, sipping lattes and hot chocolate with their incredible croissants. Another time we'd definitely come back for ice cream or dinner and drinks.
author: Jason S.

description: This is the newer branch of Java Beach and it shows. The decor is fresh and they've added loads more space to sit and enjoy your coffee, sandwich or drink. This location is way more chill than the La Playa one, and I've always been able to find a table outside on a nice day. The barristas are good but not AS good as La Playa. Love their coffee, can't speak on the pastries, soft serve, food or beer selection.
author: Ravenna P.

description:
Alright, so Java Beach numero dos! 

So once again, me and my friend, and if you couldn't tell it's pretty much the same friend that I go with to all these places that I review (the lil stalker) minus the one I went to Frjtz & Miette. And let me just start by saying that this place's wait is 10x shorter than the one on Judah. Thank God. I didn't know if I could take waiting another 30-45 minutes for just one simple meal. The cafe would've undergone another form of sabotage..

The environment was really cute, and the outer appearance was cuter than the other one as well. It was larger, more colorful and just seemed more spacious. Workers were friendlier and actually seemed to give a shit about the food they were preparing. I ordered the pesto veggie bagel and the spread is a must-have. I think I could put that spread on anything and it would satisfy me. 

Dilemma: Judah Java Beach or Sloat Java Beach. Without question, the one on Sloat. Not to mention it's by the zoo so you can go take a peek at those creatures there.
author: Steph W.

description: This is a cute lil' place across the street from the zoo & not too far from the beach. I came here on one of SF's sunny & hot days. My friend & I ordered some lunch & chilled outside. The food was GOOD. My only complaint would be that the place is a bit small...I wish there were more chairs & tables, but other than that, I have no complaints.
author: Michelle F.

description: Aside from having an out of the way location (for me at least) this is one of the best cafes in the city. Has all of the important attributes of a great study location: wifi, power plugs, great food, and beer for when you feel so inclined! Their food will not disappoint in regards to quantity or quality either.
author: Wes B.

description: Love this place!! Best coffee everrrrr. Really friendly staff, especially Ciara the Irish girl :)
author: Melissa M.

description:
I'm so thankful this venue is now in my neighborhood.  The hours are great, and there was a steady stream of people coming in and out of here even a 10pm on Tuesday night. 

I haven't tried the beer here, but I had a Raspberry Zinger with a very unique carrot cake.  Not having visited the Judah St location, I'm not sure how this place stacks up.  The seats aren't comfortable, but great for doing work.  The wireless internet is free... and the seating outside is nice too, and well lit for night time.

I recommend you check this out.  A place like this was a long time coming for the Taraval neighborhood!
author: Matthew P.

description: I think one must consider how awesome this business is with respect to its location. To begin with its footsteps from the Pacific Ocean in the corner of San Francisco city limits. I lived three blocks away from Java Beach for roughly two years and was a very regular customer. Thereby, my review should be taken seriously. Coffee? I drink many cups daily and have enjoyed the worlds best in their respective countries. Java Beach has they're own dedicated roaster and he/she has skills. The Colombian here is perhaps the finest flavor you will taste outside of Colombia. Believe me when I say this. Sammies deserve high commendation. Bagels are always fresh. Peasant pies are delicious and healthy. Menu here is balanced and fairly extensive for a small venue. Prices are higher since there is little nearby competition but honestly worth the higher quality. I am shocked there are more four than five star reviews.
author: Satar Z.

description:
Great coffee food and wonderful staff. Service was excellent and I really enjoyed my visit. First time here and had a wonderful lunch.
would highly recommend Java Beach for lunch or a nice coffee and snack while enjoying the beautiful San Francisco weather... thank you for making my visit a most enjoyable one. The owner is a very pleasant man Pat Maguire, we had a nice talk. Thank you
Deanna D. Vallejo CA.
author: Deanna D.

description:
Free wifi and 10 feet from the beach. This is a great place to kill time and a great rest-stop if you are walking your dog along the beach. 

Remember to bring some cash, because I'm pretty sure they do not take credit cards.
author: Nick A.

description: So so delicious i cant even express how much i love their sandwiches. The tuna melt....YUM! with the works ;). AND everyone there is friendly with a bit of sass to put a smile on your face. They never fail to please me.
author: Mackenzie P.

description: Very unimpressed, not only was the coffee way over priced, but it didnt even taste good.
author: Renae L.

description: Much better than the Java Beach on Judah! This newer location is cleaner, has good service, makes a mean iced latte (even though I managed to drop half of it on the ground during errands)  and has those killer toasty turkey and cheese croissants! Cute spot and has more space too.
author: Lisa J.

description: I come here to chill the fcuk out. Food selection is good if you're looking for that simple bite and the iced tea is my favorite with a pump of raspberry Torani syrup. The staff here are cool as $h!+ and the free Wi-Fi is a plus.
author: Dan P.

description: Awesome place to sit outside with your puppy dog when it's sunny, enjoy your sandwich and coffee. I love their vegetarian toasted sandwich and chips are nice and crunchy. Super nice and helpful staff. Beware of baby-stroller traffic as it is across the street from the zoo attracting a ton of families- keep your limbs close or they may get run over  by a stroller =)
author: K W.

description:
Hey guys,
Everyday I would drive by the new unopened location of Java Beach to check on the progress.
Well today was the grand opening.
The place is awesome., just what this neighvorhood needs.
I met the owner Pat (forgot his last name) seemed like a great guy.
I asked him if everything would be the same as the other location., food, drinks, prices etc.
He said yes.
I sat outside and had a latte, It was almost a zen experience had there not been all the street traffic on sloat.
Can't wait to come back to have one of their awesome sandwiches and a beer.
Al
author: Nuno M.

description:
Taboobis and i were waiting for Java to open up over on this side of the tracks [Taraval] that is. 
There is no better feeling than to sit outside and sip coffee or tea, eating a pastry and looking at the ocean, smelling the ocean. 
I love coffee so much i have 6 pounds in the closet just in case their may come a time... you know. 
When i took a sip of their coffee.. DAMM! ACID REFLUX out the but. I tried to water it down by pouring 5 ounces of milk, cream, to dilute it, but i ended up dumping it in the street. 
I really really love my coffees but come on, 
Nobody makes it that strong. 
IT hurts soo. 
I went back and asked for their version of fairy pea coffee, again diluted by one half, again i couldn't drink it. 
What a shame that i have to bring my own coffee their and order a pastry to look at the beach on these sunny balmy days
author: billyubba f.

description:
Sometimes can be less crowded than the other Java and free WIFI.

Don't expect to get your food fast here.  If you get a toasted sandwich (the best food there) it will take 10-15 minutes.

Right across from the zoo and sloat garden center.
author: Banana G.

description: Java Beach is cool. I m a big fan of the croissants with Turkey and Cheese. Little bit to crowded in the weekends. Perfect place for a beer in the evening.Hazelnut Coffe is my favor house coffe outhere. The sandwich are good, I wish the chips were better. This is a surfers spot, so chill is the attitude, One of my regular coffe shops for years. Always good.
author: Alex M.

description: So.... I am totally addicted to this spot's veggie bagel sandwiches!! I can hear you all saying: "What's so special about a veggie bagel sandwich? All it is is a bagel toasted with cream cheese and some veggies on it?" You would THINK you could find a good one just about anywhere that serves bagel, but you would be mistaken, my friend. Nope nope nope. Not easy to find....at all. Fluffy yummy bagel, melty gooey cheese, crispy fresh veggies..yuuuuummmers.  I am telling you, no one else makes it as good as they do.  In addition to these wonderful bageley treats....they also have some of the BEST coffee around. I hear its all organic and fair trade too. Extra bonus! My boyfriend hits this spot up every day now for pastries and coffee...and it definitely out of his way (that says something right there). Also, you can pull up a chair outside to enjoy your treats, and watch the people walk their pups, and I love that too. I think I know what I will do this Saturday morning....
author: Jenn T.

description: Terrific! An healthy option after a morning at the zoo. The sandwiches are made with great care. For instance someone had taken the time to put pepper on the tomato layer of my veggie sandwich. They also have tons of high chairs and a koala changing station in the bathroom. So it works great with young children.
author: Elsa T.

description: Unlike Java Beach on La Playa St., JB @ the Zoo was a big disappointment.  Poorly laid out interior, all hard seating, the floors were litter-strewn, table tops sticky, they were out of all vegan cookies, and though I asked for a ceramic mug for here, instead got my drink in paper.  Won't be back.
author: Bob G.

description: Come here almost every time I have work. Usually has great coffee, but there have been a couple occasions where my white mocha was completely milk. Not a way I like to start my morning! Another time my cup of coffee was not even close to full. Pastries are good here, I love their cheese croissants and fruit granola bowl. There are days where this place is empty and quick and other days where the line is insane. Sometimes they may even forget your order! But oh wells, I'm still gonna come here because I need my fix!
author: Jackie M.

description:
Their food and lattes are yummy!  Good foam on a latte is my favorite part and they do it well there!  Overall, I really enjoy the atmosphere of this quaint beachy-culture coffee shop!

However, I did experience one very rude employee who was clearly on a power trip, which seriously made me consider not coming back to a favorite coffee shop where I do homework every week.  I had sat down to do some homework and was doing it for about 30 mintues and about to go buy a latte as a pick me up , and she rudely came over and told me that "You need to buy something" in a very rude tone!  Obviously, I was not there to rip them off, especially since I am there every week!  I was really bummed/pissed that she made me feel so demeaned at an otherwise wonderful spot!

Also, they are a little pricey... $3 for a tiny single shot latte is steep... I also ordered a soup and sandwich and that was $11!!

So overall, I really really wish I could give them 5 stars, and before my encounter with the rude employee, I would have!!!
author: BD G.

description: Love this place. Great coffee and tea. HOWEVER, it's a little pricey and sometimes they get a tad slow depending on the crowd. Also, there is hardly room to form a line occasionally. Other than that, the food is great. If I had to choose one thing I love from there, it's definitely the salads.
author: Brittany S.

description: The coffee was great here and the staff was terrific. I was visiting for a week and went here almost every morning. Loved it!
author: Cynthia L.

description: Love Java Beach. I originally started going to the La Playa location, which I loved, and then decided to try this one out. Same great food and drinks, but because of the location, there is usually more available seating (it isn't as packed as La Playa). Free wi-fi, and I love the fact that it's a coffee shop that sells beer and wine. I hang out in there for hours drinking tea and cocoa and doing my homework. Perfect study spot.
author: Dayna H.

description: This was the best sandwich that could have walked into my life after completing my second Bay to Breaker's run. I opted for the toasted turkey, provolone and avocado. I devoured the entire thing. It hit the spot and we even found a table outside in the shade!
author: Jen B.

description: This place is a haven for the Irish beach dwellers. They've got Guinness on tap (although I don't indulge anymore) and the best coffee and the most superb rich and creamy lattes I have had since I last patronized Caffe Trieste in North Beach. They serve you up fast and are friendly and appreciative of their customers.
author: Eileen M.

description: I dunno, I gotta give them another star because their coffee is good, and their salads are big and good. And what else is out near the beach?
author: L J.

description:
The good: I'm using their free wi-fi to write this review.  Free unlimited parking in front! U know thats nearly impossible to find in SF.  Sandwiches are all amazing!! Really some of the best.  Friendly staff.  

Not so good: In my opinion their drinks are really pricey.  A small chai and a cookie costs $6.  And their small cups are really small! Shoulda just got a sandwich.  Seats are really hard, so if your planning on studying for a while, hopefully your tushie is cushioned.  Oh and also there usually are no seats/tables available.  Especially in the evenings.
author: Jenna A.

description: I love this cafe. The sandwiches are really good and the location is convenient. I love their free and fast wifi and the cute decor. Their employees are very friendly and the customer service is good. This would be my go to place if I needed to grab a bite to eat with my team after practice or needed to get some work done somewhere with a good wifi hotspot. Highly recommended!!!
author: Lisa M.

description: I like this place. It has a rustic beach atmosphere and the food matched it. On cold days the chili con carny and half sandwich is great. Haven't been here in in several years though so from the pictures they might have renovated. Service was good and fast.
author: Keit K.

description: This place has great sandwiches, decent soup, good orange juice and coffee. They also had bakery treats that we didn't try but also looked good.
author: Dan G.

description: I came here last week to grab a snack before meeting up with my class for a field trip at the zoo. I ordered their white mocha with a single shot and a pesto veggie bagel. The white mocha was definitely better than starbucks hands down. It was really sweet and does not have a strong taste of coffee. The bagel was delish! Toasted with pesto cream cheese and fresh veggies. This was a perfect place to go especially on cold days like we did last week.
author: Lynn P.

description: It's the coffee shop/cafe literally right around the corner from me and I often stop in for a mocha or a sandwich.  The San Patricio is yummy (chicken and pesto) and filling!  It's convenient for me when I get off work late (9pm) and have nothing in the house for dinner =)  The staff is really sweet, pretty much even when it's crazy busy and crowded--which it definitely is in the mornings and midday on the weekends!  Prices are decent and the coffee is way better than what you get at Burnt Coffee Central aka Starbucks.
author: Nicholle B.

description: Location, location...we needed a place like this in this area.  Coffee is pretty good but pricey for the size. Don't care for the pastries. The banana muffin tasted artificial, muffins were dry and hard. $2 for toast was a bit too much. Still 4 stars for location, outdoor seating for my doggie & good coffee
author: Jenny W.

description:
th place is good....! 

a little bit pricy, btu aside from that, it's pretty worth it.


the salad portions are huge, and it's original too! it looks healthy, tasted healthy, but i'm pretty sure the dressing they overload it with is not healthy. it's still good though and well worth what you pay for it because how often does a salad fully fill you up?

the sandwiches here i havn't tried. it looks pretty decent though, i wouldn't mind trying it because the cost is not that bad for sandwich and chip. 

the best thing here is the soup though. i had a clam chowder here last time and it was well worth the money. the cost can be medium or high depending on how often you want to pay several extra bucks for bigger bowl of soup. 

four stars for the nice ambiance of the place and friendly staff members + all the stuff i wrote above.
author: Stanley C.

description: Great place-love the atmosphere and the unpretentious service is a plus.  Sandwiches are a bit pricey but always delicious and the new guy who makes coffee really knows what he is doing!!
author: Samantha G.

description: What a great little spot!  My hubby and I were in SF for 4 days for our son's graduation from SFSU and Java Beach was a morning stop for 3 of those days.  Fast, friendly service and those apple fritters...delicious!  A block from our motel and the beach; what's not to like?
author: Jan M.

description: If you like the idea of a day care coffee place then stop by. It seems like most of the patrons simply dropped off there kids and went some where else.  The staff seemed worn out on a Sunday after noon and they burned to a crisp my turkey and cheese croissants. One of the easiest meals to make on the planet.  BTW $2.35 for a brownie come on.  So if you enjoyed the Zoo stop by the kids circus that is Java Beach.
author: Dan K.

description:
was walking down Sloat Blvd. and came upon the most awesome new place in the Sunset.  This is a cafe", wine bar, pub, restaurant, combined.
Awesome view of the Ocean.  This is the best thing that has happened on this side of Taraval in a long time.  The staff was friendly, and efficient.
Great food, drinks, and great atmosphere.  A place like this has been long needed in this area.  Great Family environment. Kid Friendly...!!!
author: christianne c.

description: We stayed nearby at Ocean Park Motel, and we happily walked to Java Beach for delicious coffee and breakfast.  Staff is friendly.  Breakfast croissants are good (favorite: turkey and cheese).  Oatmeal is good but not the best.  Several choices of coffees.  We bought some of their special blend whole bean coffee.  Wifi availlable and both times there were several people working at laptops.  Not a lot of seating space but it was warm enough to sit outside.
author: Patricia W.

description: I was glad to finally have a locally run coffee shop/cafe open in our neighborhood.  When I have the chance to support small businesses I do over Borders or Starbucks.  Java Beach is a good place to sit and watch people although it's less crowded on weekdays and the foggy days if you want some peace and quiet.  I like the whole wheat bagel with veggies and hummus; cookies taste a little too eggy; on warm days it's a great place to grab an IPA on tap.
author: Gina T.

description: this place has the most awesome soft served ice cream and it is from straus family creamery local farms at a reasonable price! they also have delicious sandwiches and the portions are very generous  I would definitely come here.
author: Sophia C.

description: I live like a block away and was sooo excited for this spot to open. It finally did and I love it. Theres finally a cafe spot with WiFi closer to me. Patrick the owner is so awesome. He hooked my friend and I up with  some Soft Serve. Very Nice guy! The neighborhood needed a spot like this. I'll be back!
author: Lynn T.

description: This place rocks. First off, they did a nice job fixing up what previously was a putrid looking building. Especially nice the way they light the place up at night.
