Good sandwiches, I highly recommend the san something (petrino?) with chicken, cheese and avocado. Small, but quality list of beers on tap, and of course good coffee and pastries. I was a regular the first two weeks when the weather was awesome, not sure how the outdoor seating will fare in the upcoming cold and windy Sunset days. Staff is super-friendly (and a couple of the gals are pretty cute). All around a great place to grab coffee, beer, pastries or free WiFi.
author: Al K.

description: Love, love, love the oatmeal. Creamy and hot. Lovely with blueberries and strawberries.
author: Yumiko L.

description: Love this place, great for studying is there isn't a loud crowd present. Excellent baristas always!
author: M K.

description:
Being a coffee joint during the era of the Starbucks craze, Java Beach deserves some brownie points. It's location is pretty good.

Seating Arrangement: The inside is very crowded, but maybe that's because I visited on (1) a hot day (2) at peak coffee/tea/frozen-yogurt hours (?). The outside is nice. That's basically it.

My Drink (White Mocha): Delicious! Nothing else to be said. Tasted like a white mocha from heaven. 

Service: Spectacular. As I fill out numerous job applications for the summer, I notice each one mentions "serving with a smile." As much as I hate that cliche, I actually faced a very pleasant woman who couldn't look any happier to be serving me. When the barista messed up and made a "normal" mocha for me instead, she immediately apologized and made my white mocha without any hesitation. However, it was still record time in my book. 

So....4 Star. I'm not head-over-heels to run over there again, but it is definitely better than most coffee shops in the area. I hope to explore their other items next visit.
author: Danny D.

description: Kick back attitude and free wi-fi. What more could you want? I like the muddy water, best caffeine for your buck.
author: Abraham Y.

description: Flies in the pastry case, rude irish cashiers, takes way to long to get a sandwich.  Coffee is overpriced.  Tullys is much cheaper and the workers are much friendlier.  They actually recognize me and get my order without me having to ask.  Now that's personal service.  I think the whole java beach scene is a bit mismanaged.  They always seem swamped and I guess the owners don't feel they need to hire anymore help.  Squeeze what you can out of those poor college kids I guess!
author: Pat M.

description: LOVE this place. Used to go there every day. Nice people excellent sandwiches, they are so so good!! This place has really good coffee too. They have wfi, and also serve wine and beer. Cool place to chill, use the internet, read, or hang out.
author: Nikki P.

description:
This past weekend, I decided to drive along the Great Highway and try and find a nice spot to get a decent breakfast, even though it was already 12:30 on a Sunday. I stumbled across this Java Beach Cafe place and was instantly drawn to the "beachy" feel that the restaurant gave me. Being from the Pacific Beach area of San Diego, the place reminded me a lot of some of the Cafe's down there...however, that is where the comparisons end. 

I have tried sandwichs from New York to Honolulu, and next to a certain Philly Cheese Steak at a sandwich shop called Italian Delight in Novato, this is without question the BEST sandwich for the price that I have ever had. The review that I read earlier about the bread crumbling like dust is rediculous. Melted in your mouth is more like it...The one qualm that I had was that it took like 20 minutes to get my sandwich, which was really bothering me at first, but once I bit into that sandwich, my buddy and I both agreed that the wait was well worth it. 

I live all the way in the Presidio, but you can bet that I am going to be heading back to Java Cafe in the not so distant future because it is so awesome. Trust me, you won't be disappointed!
author: J B.

description: YELPERS.....you have got to try their White Mocha "Bra-vey" style...with at least 3 shots of espresso.....that is the bomb right der, to get you going through the day.....they also have a variety of sandwiches which are the best I've ever tasted (only when this bald-headed white dude) makes 'em. If you guys go here and see that dude making sandwiches, you have better order one and experience a deli made sandwich like never before!! Try the Tsunami for starters....I live only a few blocks away so I stroll over there from time to time to get me my coffee and sandwich when that dude is working....but seriously I don't swing that way I just love them sandwiches you make dogg!!!
author: dave s.

description: I enjoyed the Dutch Crunch bread.  Pleasantly inoffensive cookies and coffee.  There are plenty of seats and outlets for your laptop.  The best part is that you can see the Pacific Ocean (if you crane your neck) through the window.  It's a good place to grab a sandwich or to hunker down with some work.
author: S P.

description: I love this place!  I have been going for coffee and their ham and cheese croisant sandwhich for years.  I like the music on Friday nights and on Sat and Sunday morning, there are tons of kids and dogs out front and sometimes a few stray surfers on their way in or out of the water which is across the street.  My favorite (sometimes salty) waitress always has a smile and she doesn't take any shit from the yuppy customers from Concord that have bad energy.  Its owned by an Irish guy and he hires kick ass Irish Broads that are straight up cool.  One day I was waiting for a friend to to go Stern Grove.  She was one hour late and this older guy chalked up conversation about the Giants and the next think I was on a Muni on my way to the game with him... the Muni goes straight from Java Beach to AT&T. Does it get any better? Come down and smile at the wicked Irish girl behind the counter...  Food is good but atmosphere is awesome!!
author: Jenna J.

description: Slow service, poor communication, overpriced, flavorless entrees. There's not much else in the immediate area, so I suppose it has that going for it.
author: David K.

description: My favorite is the Tsunami sub.  It's so tasty. The rest of the sandwich menu are great too.  It's a great location nr the zoo and the beach.   On a nice sunny day, i like to sit outside and just watch the people go by.
author: Dan G.

description: Now this JAVA BEACH I ADORE!  The only reason it does not have a full five stars is because I wish that there were some couches for me to TOTALLY lounge about on-  it would be COMPLETELY perfect then!  Where to start-  well, the staff is great!  Fantastic, friendly, fast customer service.  PLENTY of outlets for a nerd like me that likes to eat breakfast, lunch and dinner at a cafe, work and do thesis writing from a cafe, since being at home makes me go stir-crazy.  Free Wi-Fi.  Super laid back attitude, not too many people, where you are panicking about getting a table, or freaks are going to steal your stuff.  All of the customers I have chatted with have been super cool, including my new bff that I met there, who I am going surfing with.  Oh, yeah, the location:  two blocks from the beach, so when the work is done, or if you need a break, just roll outside for a breather.  The food is great, AND they have beer!  I love this place!   For under $8, I got two beers for my friend and I, as  a reward for writing for three hours.  Hearts!
author: Jennifer O.

description: We love walking our dog down here for coffee on the weekend mornings & is a great place to hang out. Took us about a year before we went there for lunch & found they have top notch sandwiches. The Tsunami sandwich it epic & they serve beer so it's become impossible to drive past this place w/o stopping for beers & a Tsunami after golfing a round @ Harding.
author: ryan a.

description: just had a bagel so dry . . . .  .  terrible
author: Johnny C.

description: If you are around this area, this is a very good place to relax and enjoy breakfast on a sunny morning!  I like the granola bowl! The coffee is good too!
author: vernice l.

description:
my go to study spot.
free wifi.
wonderful subs and good range of drinks.
author: Rachel R.

description: Big delicious sandwiches. That's saying a lot because I'm not much of a sandwich person. Grab one and go eat it on Ocean Beach.
author: Lisa M.

description:
what's with the 4 & 5 stars and mediocre reviews?.i live 1 block away and have frequented JB too many times to count. It has a lot of things going for it, but at the same time, falls short onfriday/sat nights as their are lots of kids running around, locals and makes for nice vibe
cons: overpriced, Costco pastries for $3+ is ridiculous; I also don't like their ordering system (you order/pay @ counter & you order/ticket is sent to the kitchen, and from there is a crapshoot, and your odds are not too good). Last nite I ordered soup, sandwich, beer and the sandwich never came, had to ask twice for it, 25 minutes later it came and all they could say is sorry (how about another beer, next latte on the house? nope...) On that note, I've never seen them giving a small handout to a patron in all of the time I've noticed them mess up an order. Go when it's not too busy, s*** is less likely to happen. Stay away from the pastries, soup, & other "pre-prepared" foods, on the other hand the coffee, sandwiches are  good. The place is clean, comfortable, well lit, wi-fi, and the employees there are pretty nice (which I can't say is always the case in SF establishments).
author: christian i.
